loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng L., 40 years old, lives in Toal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Eng, are farmers who own a plot a land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Leng L. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow her farm field to support her crop. Besides farming, Mr. Seng Eng is a construction worker, receiving a small income to support his family. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a student and the youngest is 4 years old. Mrs. Leng L.'s husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her farm field

loans.name: Radany

texts.en: Mrs. Radany D., 33 years old, lives in Kampeaeng Tboung village, Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market and is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to help her business, she decided to buy a motorcycle to transport her fruit. Mr. Seng Eng is a widow with two children, who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport her fruit

loans.name: Unenbat

texts.en:
Unenbat B. is 35 years old man who lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder daughter currently attends a local middle school while the youngest daughter stays at home. 

Unenbat operates a wooden product making business. The business is very family oriented, as he designs and produces each product while his friends decorate and paint them. Unenbat started his wood products business in 2000. The business has been successful and it has grown into a stable operation. 

Unenbat attributes his success to the quality of his products, which is in demand by his customers. He is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paint.

loans.use: Purchase more wood and paint.

loans.name: Artemio Jose

texts.es:
Artemio es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus menores hijos en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Paiján, una zona de movimiento comercial moderado ubicado en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven en labores agrícolas, el trabaja en una empresa agrícola de la zona como obrero, su oficio consiste en recolectar diversos vegetales que se producen en la zona como espárragos y tomates. Esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos.

Artemio desea realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, la cual está construida de material rústico, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Artemio siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos, por ello siempre se esfuerza por brindarles lo mejor. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien trabajador y respetuoso.
texts.en:
Artemio is a 27 year old father who lives with his wife and young children in a marginalized urban area in the district of Paiján. This area is located in Ascope Province, La Libertad region, and experiences moderate commercial activity. The community is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Artemio has been doing farm work since he was very young man. He is employed by an agricultural business as a laborer. His job consists of harvesting various vegetables produced in the area, such as asparagus and tomatoes. This job is his only source of income.

Artemio wants to make a few improvements to the infrastructure of his home, which is made of basic materials. In order accomplish his goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Artemio always looks out for the welfare of his family, so he strives to provide them the best. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be someone who is hardworking and respectful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to the infrastructure of his house

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina P. is a widow who lives in Barangay Purisima, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a batchoyan (fast-food) business. Rizalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, She has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, Rizalina is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as an additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Rizalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Walter Carlos

texts.es:
Walter tiene 28 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, un distrito con movimiento comercial moderado que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicio de transporte), el brinda su servicio en el distrito donde vive y en los anexos y ciudades que lo rodean, como esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta el trata de mantenerse en el negocio brindando su servicio de la mejor manera posible.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de la mayoría de carreteras del lugar han hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños en su motor que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para poder reparar estos daños y brindar el mantenimiento que su vehículo necesita, Walter ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Walter es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 28 years old and lives with his family in Paiján, a district with moderate business activity located in the Ascope province of La Libertad region. It is 2 hours from Chiclayo city, capital of the Lambayeque region. He works as a mototaxi (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a cabin) driver, transporting cargo and passengers. Walter works in the district where he lives and in the surrounding districts and cities. This activity is his only source of income and he takes it seriously, providing the best service possible. Walter is legally able to use his vehicle. The rough condition of the roads has caused some problems with his motor, which require urgent repair in order to keep running. To repair the damages and keep his vehicle well-maintained, Walter has requested a 1,000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Walter is a hardworking man. His greatest wish is to keep working to be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Kodia, Madredijos, Bantayan Island in the southeastern Philippine province of Cebu . She earns her living by engaging in a general store and a hog-raising business.

Sheila’s husband, Franciso, is a 36-year-old poultry worker and they have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Sheila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and a hog-raising business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities.

Sheila is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 49,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and hog-raising businesses which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions.

Now, Sheila is borrowing Php 49,500 for her 16th loan which she intends to use for her general store and hog-raising businesses. Sheila is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store and hog-raising businesses

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Mr. Saran K., pictured with his wife, is 41 years old and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun Khoem, is 42 years old. They live along National Road Number One about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Saran and his wife are fishermen and farmers. They grow cucumber and wax gourd on their farmland in the village. Saran does not have a water pumping machine to spray his farm, so he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 US to buy a water pumping machine. He will also use a part of the loan to purchase a fishing net for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine to spray his farm and to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo es un padre de familia de 63 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, un distrito agrícola de relieve muy accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace masde diez años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, de sus cosechas y la venta de las mismas depende el sostenimiento económico de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera.

En esta ocasión el ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para lograr que su cultivo brinde una buena cosecha, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Erasmo es un hombre bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus familiares y vecinos le consideran una persona responsable y bastante trabajadora.
texts.en:
Erasmo is a 63 year old dad that lives with his wife and two children in Nueva Arica, an agricultural district with rugged land, close to the mountains. It's located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agricultural activities for more than 10 years, he has a piece of land where he grows different kinds of grain, his family is dependent on the harvest and the sale of it, that's why he always does his best to keep the land in good shape. This time around he has sown corn and he is working really hard on it so he can have a good harvest, that's why he needs to request a loan of 1000 new soles that he plans to use in purchasing fertilizer for his crops. Erasmo is a family man. His wish is to give them a better quality of life. In the community, his family and neighbors consider him a responsible and hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn field.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha P. (pictured with her son) is a 45-year-old widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. One of her children is a construction worker, another one attends school and another is still young. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sitha has been a garment-factory worker for three years. She wants to renovate the house where she lives, but she does not have money. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan in the amount of $800 to use for her project.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Sophal Mov, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two sons, one of whom attends school while the other one is still young. The couple has been operating a silk-weaving business for more than ten years. They sell their products to the middleman in the village who then, in turn, sells in Phnom Penh or other places. Sokhoeun has obtained a Kiva loan one time already. She how is requesting another loan, in the amount of $700, to purchase silk material for continuing her weaving business. She will also use a part of the loan to help finance her mother’s business selling roasted beef and boiled duck eggs.

loans.use: To purchase more silk material for her weaving business and to finance her mother's business

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger D. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in Uvurhangai, a central province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local secondary school while his wife works as a kindergarten teacher in their town. Batdelger operates a taxi service. He began his taxi business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience since then.

Batdelger and his wife are planning on opening a home goods retail business in the local market. He believes that they will be successful since his wife has a lot of experience selling these types of products and because he has experience owning his own business.

Batdelger says, "I am trying my best to complete my house within two years which will help our family live better and more conveniently." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang S., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sreysan Sour, 28, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. As well, his parents-in-law reside with them.

Samnang has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for ten years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for the same length of time. He does not have electricity to use, making family life especially difficult at night. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan of $200 to connect his house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To connect his house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.name: Horloo

texts.en:
Horloo R., 44, lives with her husband and two children, ages 13 to 16, in Uvurhangai Province of central Mongolia. They reside together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, and both of her children attend a local secondary school. Horloo operates a business sewing a variety of clothes, and has become established in the local business community. She purchases materials and supplies two times a month and hopes to become even more successful so that she can better provide for her family in the future.

A modest and open-hearted woman, Horloo is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase more fabric and materials such as buttons and trim for her business. She says, "I am trying my best to expand my business line."

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mrs. Mony U. and her husband, Mr. Doeun Pon, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children, all of them married. Mr. Doeun Pon is a farmer, growing many types of crops and vegetables in his village.

Mrs. Mony U. has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother, since she was 16 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Mony is now asking for her second loan, in the amount of $200, to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
Carlos Miguel es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicio de transporte), el brinda su servicio en el distrito de Guadalupe y es los anexos que lo rodean, esta actividad es la unica que le brinda ingresos por lo que siempre trata de realizarla del mejor modo posible, actualmente se ha asociado con otras personas que realizan la misma labor y juntos tienen un paradero en la plaza de armas de su distrito.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños en su motor que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Carlos Miguel desea realizar las reparaciones y mantenimientos necesarios para poder trabajar sin problemas, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Carlos Miguel es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Miguel is a 31 year old father. He lives with his family in the Guadalupe district, which belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region. It is located one hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides cargo and passenger transportation in his “mototaxi” (a motorized vehicle, which is a motorcycle that has a cabin attached in order to provide transportation service). He provides service in the Guadalupe district and the surrounding areas. This activity is the only one that provides him with income. Therefore, he always tries to do it in the best possible way. He is currently associated with other people who do the same work. Together they have a stop at the Plaza de Armas in his district. The continuous use of his vehicle has caused it to start having some motor problems. These require urgent repairs to guarantee that it functions correctly. Carlos Miguel wants to make these repairs and perform the necessary maintenance in order to be able to work without problems. That is why he has requested a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Carlos Miguel is a hard-working man. His greatest desire is to keep working in order to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for his mototaxi

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona que tiene bastante movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad. Se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chialyo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de dos años a la comercialización de animales menores, ella cría patos, gallinas, pollos y pavos en su vivienda, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado principal de la ciudad en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Luz Angélica desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz Angélica es una mujer empeñosa y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es tener una casa propia, ya que la casa donde actualmente vive es alquilada.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is 30, and a mother of two who lives with her husband in the agricultural district of Chepén, an area that has a lot of commerce. It is in the province of the same name, in La Libertad region, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been working for more than two years selling small animals. She raises ducks, hens, chickens and turkeys around her home. When they have grown to a good size, she sells them in the main market of the city where she lives. The earnings that she receives from the business help her husband with the financial support of the family. Luz Angélica wants to provide more nutritional food for her animals so that they will develop better and she can sell them for a higher price. That is why she has seen the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new soles. Luz Angélica is a hard-working woman who is always giving her best to have her family get ahead. Her biggest dream is to have her own home, since the one where they currently live is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and improve the nutrition of her animals so that she can sell them.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe S. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling eggs. She lives in Purak Bontoy, Barangay Ticad, Bantayan, in the province of  Cebu with her husband and their six children. One of their children has their own family already while the rest are going to school.

Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her egg-selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.

Fe is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

Fe aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man but has no child. He has been operating his electrical business and fixing sockets for four years. With Ksh 20,000 he wants to purchase electrical panels, circuit breakers and sockets. He operates from door to door to his neighbors and works on new buildings.

Mohamed’s main challenge is theft. He hopes that someday he will work in a very competitive environment and earn more money.

Mohamed decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan to boost his business. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His monthly expenses include electricity.

loans.use: To purchase electrical panels, circuit breakers and sockets

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a single mother with two children.  One attends school and the other one is still too young for school.

Samira has been operating her food stall business for three years. Her previous occupation was selling fish. With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to expand her business by purchasing a bundle of wheat flour and 50 kgs of rice.  Samira sells from her home to neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is seasonality, especially during the rainy seasons when the number of potential customers is reduced.

She hopes that in the future, she will open a restaurant in a large market. Samira decided to work with Yehu because it's so simple to join. She owns a home with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To expand her food stall and purchase a bundle of wheat flour and 50 kgs of rice.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is a 56-year-old, married woman who supports her family by buying and selling used clothes. She lives in Villa Hergon, Brgy. Rizal, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She is pictured here with big bales of used clothing, which she buys from wholesalers to resell in her stall.

She has been a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon since 2006. With the help of loans from NWTF and through her own hard work, she has improved her living conditions in recent years. By working hard at her used clothes business, she is gradually ensuring that her family is economically stable. She now earns an average income of 12,000 PHP.

Evelyn is seeking a loan in the amount of 29,000 PHP ($625) to expand her business operations. Notably, this would be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan, which was also in the amount of 29,000 PHP and which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Evelyn aspires to continue to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business operations

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
37-year-old Fidela B. is married to a 39-year-old hired laborer. Without any offspring since their marriage life started, Fidela and Nolie are enjoying the company and the love of each other as husband and wife.

For as long as they are together, life, despite poverty, seems to be happy and easy. However they don’t deny the fact that both of them are excited to, in the future, have their own child and feel the real essence of a family. But, for now they are working so hard to earn money through a business to be financially prepared for having children.

Fidela runs her small sari-sari (variety) store financed by loans she has received from ASHI since her membership in 2006, while her husband earns sporadically as a hired laborer.

For Fidela’s dream of renovating their house for a better and safer shelter against storms and any other forms of calamity, she has to grow her business to make it profitable. Then she will be able to put up a savings fund meant for her plan. To make this possible, she therefore would like to request a loan.

Having a very good performance as an ASHI member since joining, in terms of attendance to weekly center meetings, loan repayments, and managing a business, she is confident to request a much larger loan.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of foodstuffs, beverages and grocery items for her sar-sari store

loans.name: Samand

texts.en:
Samand B. is 41 years old and lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. A year ago, she divorced her husband. Now she lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughters attend a secondary school. B. operates a trucking business with her Kia Forter truck, which has a capacity of two tons.

B. is a modest, hard-working person and is very committed to improving the quality of her life. Business is very important to her. B. says, “My daughters are very smart. I believe that they will grow into good people. As a mother, I would like to be financially able to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up.  Also, I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future.”

She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en:
Smbat I. is 48 years old and lives with his family in Lchashen village, Sevan region. His family consists of his parents, his wife and their two daughters. Smbat graduated from a military academy in Russia, and for about five years he worked at the Hrazdan Humanities Institute as a lawyer. Now he works at a Hrazdan thermal power plant as a head assistant.

At the same time, he is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. His family helps him in his farm work. Smbat has cows and sheep at his farm. On his land, he is raising oats, which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. With his incomes, Smbat supports his family and pays for his daughters’ educations; they are studying at Yerevan Institutes.

Smbat is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and to do some sowing on his land. In the photo, you can see Smbat and his father.

loans.use: To buy some calves and to do some sowing on his land

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva Borrower is a married woman from Lebanon and the mother of two young children who still go to school. After seven years of experience as a hairdresser, she opened a beauty salon in her town in 2007. She offers all types of beauty services, including make-up, manicures, pedicures, etc.  She is well-known by a good number of clients.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy beauty products and to add new services to attract more clients. She's certain that with the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty products and add new services

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family and, like the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his job income.

He has owned a barber shop in his town since 2005 and has ten years of experience in this occupation; he learned this occupation when he was very young. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the decor of his barbershop and to make some renovations to offer a comfortable place to his clients.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop and make some renovations

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik A. is 38 years old and married with two children.  He is the family’s main breadwinner. His wife takes care of their two young children. The family lives with Garnik’s parents.
 
Garnik owns an internet club and DVD rental shop. The big demand for information exchange in Armenia is being hampered by high internet costs and low internet penetration. Only 7% of the population are internet users. Therefore internet clubs are highly popular in Armenia, giving internet access to the large number of people who don’t have permanent access to the internet.
 
Garnik has been in this business since 2005. He rents the club’s premises in one of the busy streets of the capital city, Yerevan. Currently there are 10 computers with internet access in the club. Taking into consideration the large demand for more desks, Garnik has applied for the loan to purchase 5 more computers and desks.

loans.use: To purchase computers and computer desks

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Tserennadmid S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Tserennadmid currently operates a raw materials trade in her district. She started her business in 2003 and has found success in her business. She is now renting a small food shop in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar in order to improve her quality of life and stabilize her family's financial situation.

Tserennadmid dreams of possessing her own food shop in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and food supplements for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old woman from Lebanon living with her sister's family. She has been working for the past 15 years as a beautician in her sister's home, specializing in nail care such as manicures and pedicures. 

She has prepared a special room in the home where she can receive her clients, but, over the years, she has outgrown the space because increased numbers of clients are asking for her beauty services. For this reason, she hopes to open her own beauty salon. 

She has recently received the opportunity to open a beauty spot in a salon. In order to take this opportunity and to prepare the space, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. She will also purchase beauty equipment.

loans.use: To open a beauty spot in a salon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old man from Lebanon who works as an electrician. He works on a freelance basis, responding to customer requests in addition to taking on home projects. 

Over the years, he has been able to pursue more work, building his experience in this field and gaining a good reputation. He has been serving his small community since 2004, and has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas. 

In order to fulfill this project and to take on more projects, he is asking to borrow $800 in order to improve and upgrade his electric tools.

loans.use: To improve and upgrade his electric tools.

loans.name: Juliet Rose

texts.en:
Juliet Rose D. C., age 30, has been a member of ASHI since 2006. Her current request for a loan will be used to finance a business she plans for herself: a general store. She wants to help her husband support their family. For the past three years she has been busy taking care of their three small children, but now that the youngest child is three years old, she would like to do her part in earning money to provide for her family. 

Manuel, Juliet’s husband, is a construction laborer. He supports his wife’s decision to manage her own business. He believes that if his wife can procure capital for starting up her business, she has the capacity and ability to make it grow and become profitable. He knows that she is motivated by the desire to see her children happy and well-educated. Both Manuel and Juliet would like to see the children eventually graduate from college, an opportunity that they themselves did not have.

Juliet intends to purchase inventory items for her store. This will include foodstuffs, beverages, grocery items, and basic commodities.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, beverages, grocery items, and basic commodities for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He and his wife have one child. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 and has 14 years of experience as a barber. He coordinates his efforts with those of his wife, who works as a beautician. They pool their resources to cover their family expenses. 

He has recently bought a laser machine, which he is paying off in installments. He is known in his local region for his good reputation  and has many clients. He has also received many new customers since the acquisition of the new laser machine.

He is presently asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to perform renovations on his barber shop. In addition, he would like to complete paying off the cost of the laser machine.

loans.use: To perform renovations on his barber shop and to pay off the cost of his new laser machine

loans.name: Kenjebai

texts.en:
Kenjebai K. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own "ger," a traditional housing tent in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His son is four years old and attends a local kindergarten. Since January 2010, Kenjebai has been renting a car repair center, a venture he undertook based on his three years of experience repairing cars and machines. 

Kenjebai is modest and hardworking, He is hopeful about the future and is looking to expand the scope of his work. He tells us that he has been planning to open his own car repair service center.  

He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary tools and equipment for his new business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and equipment for his new business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34 year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his mother and he is taking care of her. He owns a spare parts shop.

He wants to take out a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a l. to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirement of his clients and make a good income. He plans to use the loan to invest in new car speciality equipment because his shop is located in a car plant area and all the car mechanics shop with him to acquire their work needs.

This will be his second Kiva loan. He was a consistent client with on-time repayments for his last loan of $600.

loans.use: Buy more spare parts

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru:
Nurlanu 22 qoda. On ne jenat. Seychas on jivet v Absheron regione s semyoy. U neqo yest 2 sestri kotoriye mladshe neqo. On ochen pomoqayet svoyey semye s pomoshyu etoy raboti. On transportiruyet qruzi uje 2 qoda. Et mashina bila eqo dyadi kotoriy uvedel chto on nujdayetsya v rabote  i podaril eqo Nurlanu chtob tot rabotal i pomoqal semye. 

Seycahs Nurlan nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN cto bi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya eqo mashini. Kak vi videte na fotoqrafii mashina staraya i nujdayetya v remonte chtobi bilo leqko perevozit tovari.

V budushem on zarabotav bolshe deneg xochet pomoch svoyey semye sdelat remont v dome.
texts.en:
Nurlan is 22 years old. He is single. He currently lives in the Absheron Region with his relatives. He has two younger sisters. He helps his family a lot thanks to this job. He has been transporting cargo for two year already. This truck used to belong to his uncle, who saw that Nurlan needs work and gave the truck to Nurlan as a gift, to make it possible for Nurlan to work and help his family. Now Nurlan needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy the necessary spare parts for his truck. As you can see on the photo, the truck is old and needs repairs in order to make it easy to transport goods. In the future he would like to earn enough money to help his family renovate their home.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with three children who all attend school.  She has been operating her business of selling second hand clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby for five years.  With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase a bale of clothes and clothing materials.

She faces the challenges of seasonality, especially the months of May and June during the rainy season when only heavy clothing are on sale. Zena hopes to build her own house someday in her life.

She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to boost her business and improve her way of living.

Zena rents a house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and clothing materials.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina A. was born in 1981.  She lives in Getahovit village, Ijevan region. Irina is married and has two preschool-aged children. Since 2001 Irina's family has engaged in beekeeping and cattle-breeding, the income from which help them to keep their young family. Also with farming income they bought a car which they use to move their farm animals to mountains.

Irina needs a 400,000 AMD loan to buy 4 or 5 calves for her farm. Irina and her husband intend to move these calves to mountains in summer months, and sell them in autumn. 

In the photo you can see Irina, her husband and her son.

loans.use: To buy 4 or 5 calves for her farm

loans.name: Valex

texts.ru:
Valex jivet v Absheron regione. Emu 28 let.Valex ne jenat i jivet odin v odnokomnatnom obshejitie. U neqo yest malenkoye kafe v katorom on rabotayet uje 4 qoda. on u neqo net deneg chtobi uludshit eto kafe razvit eqo. 

Potoermu nurlan nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye veshi dlya eqo kafe. Ne smotrya na to chto u neqo malenkoye kafe no on vse ravno xochet v budushem uvelichit eqo i nabrat mnoqo kliyentov .Tak je on xochet chtobi krome toqo chto toqo kak prixodit tuda pit chay ili yest  on eshe xochet v budushem chtobi tam on provodil nashi nacionalniye nastolniye iqri pod nazvaniyem "Nardi" ,"Shaski" i "Damino" chtobi ludam bilo intersno.
texts.en:
Valex lives in the Absheron region. He is 28 years old. Valex is single and lives alone in a studio apartment. He has a small cafe, where he has been working for 4 years; however, he does not have money to improve and expand his cafe. Valex needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase necessary items for his cafe. Despite the fact that his cafe is small, he still wants to expand it in the future and attract many customers. He wants customers to not only come to his cafe to have tea or eat, but also wants to host our national games, such as "Nardi, "Shaski" and "Domino" there, so that customers are entertained.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy necessary things for his cafe

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with two boys who go to school. Her husband works as a blacksmith and he contributes to the family's basic needs. Sylvia operates a food stall from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, 50 kgs. of cooking oil, a sack of potatoes and a bundle of maize flour. She faces the main challenges of seasonality and theft. She hopes that someday in the future will be able to open a restaurant. Her main aim of joining Yehu is to get a loan to expand her business.

She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, potatoes and maize flour.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Shirnen Otgonbayar is 39 years old and lives with her five children in Darkhan province, one of Mongolia's big provinces. She and her family live together in their own house. Four of the children are secondary school students and her older son is a military officer.  

Otgonbayar's family moved to the town from the countryside, where she was a herder, eight years ago in search of a better life. Her husband works in a local company, where his salary is between $100 and $200 per month, in order to help them with their living expenses. Otgonbayar now operates a grocery store with a few basic items. Her store is in a good location where there are always many people around. 

She began her business in 2002 by operating a small booth. She says, "I will work hard to pay the bank loan on time and I will use it to grow my business." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak V. is 30 years old. He lives in Ghashtarak village in the Ijevan area. Artak is married and has two preschool-aged daughters. Since 2008 he has been working in village administration, and at the same time he is engaged in pig breeding and land cultivation.

In the future Artak hopes to increase his number of pigs. Recently began building a new pigsty for his pigs, because the old one is tumbledown and very small. He has completed building the walls for the new pigsty, and now he needs a 300,000 AMD loan to roof it.

loans.use: To roof his new pigsty

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man, and has been operating a video cafe for the last four years, serving his neighbors and passersby. With the 20,000 KES loan he wants to renovate his video cafe, and buy compact cassettes, blank CDs, and the latest movies to sell. He has no other source of income.

John experiences seasonality as a major challenge in the business. He hopes that someday he will open a theater and get more profit with that business.

He decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan and uplift his standard of living. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and food.

loans.use: To renovate his video cafe, buy compact casettes, the latest movies and blank CDs to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
M. is a married woman with four children, all adults. Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family financially. She has been operating her food stall for over ten years, selling samosa (fried or baked triangular-shaped pastry shells) filled with spicy potatoes and peas. She sells in a shop and from home to her neighbors and passersby.

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to start another business, selling cosmetics.

M. faces the challenges of high transport costs and seasonality. She hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To start a cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.ru:
Valeh jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On rodilsya v 1966 qodu. Valeh bejenec iz Fuzuli qoroda. Seycahs jivet v Absheron regione.v Etom biznese on uje 16 let. 

On uje odin raz bral dengi u Kivi i za eto ochen blaqodaren Kive cto oni pomoqli emu razvit eqo bizmnes. No kak vi znayete s kajdim dnem vixodit vse noviye produkti tovari. Poetomu on seychas xochet vzat 2000 AZn chtobi kupit bolshe novoy produkcii dlya razvitiya eqo biznesa
texts.en:
Valeh is married and has 2 children. He was born in 1966. Valeh is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli. Currently, he lives in the Absheron region. He has been in this business for 16 years. Valeh already borrowed money from Kiva once and is very grateful to Kiva that they helped him develop his business. But, as you know, new types of products get released every day. This is why he wants to borrow 2000 AZN today in order to buy more new products for expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new products

loans.name: Lala

texts.ru:
A. Lala rodilas v 1968 qodu. Ona jenata  u neqo odin rebonok sin kotoromu 20 let. Na fotoqrafii eyo sin (Amir). On rabotayet v meste so svoim otcom . Oni remontiruyut mashini uje 4 qoda no Amir rabotayet tam uje 2 qoda. 

Seychas A. nujdayetsya v 2000 AZn chtobi oni smoqli razvit ix biznes  i kupit zaposniye avto chasti. 
sama Agaalarova leyla toje rabotayet v etom biznese oni pomoqayet yesli bivayet rabota s shityom sideniy. V budushem ona xochet jenit svoyeqo sina.
texts.en:
Lala A. was born in 1968. She is married and has one child - a son, who is 20 years old. Her son, Amir, is the one on the photo. He works together with his father. They have been fixing cars for 4 years, but Amir has been working there for 2 years. Currently, Lala needs 2000 AZN in order to develop their business and buy spare auto parts. Lala also works in this business. She helps when there is seat upholstery work. In the future, she wants to marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn B. is a very supportive wife to her husband. Ever since she joined ASHI, the loans she has received have been invested in her husband's fish-selling business. She has been a partner in selling as well as in raising their only child, who is now six years old. 

Despite the fact that Jinalyn is getting loans through ASHI, most often they fail to grow their business because they can’t avoid spending some portion of the loans for their own needs. Nevertheless, Jinalyn has never failed to repay the loan she received through ASHI, because she wouldn’t want to lose the faith and trust of the other people who are wanting to support her endeavor and her fight against poverty.

Now, she and her husband agreed to request another loan which she hopes will grow their fish-selling from a resale to a wholesale business, and also that  its profit will help support their daily needs. 

No matter how hard life has been for them because of poverty, Jinalyn still believes that through the profits of the business their standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: To purchase a larger volume of fish for resale.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob Yeganyan was born in 1983 in Azatamut village in the Ijevan area. He is married and has one daughter. 

Hakob works at the village school as a physics teacher and simultaneously he has his own coffee sales business. With his business incomes he fulfills his family’s needs.

He bought a coffee grinder, scales and a packing machine, so now he sells not only coffee beans, but he grinds and packs up coffee as well. He delivers ground and packaged coffee to his village's food shops. 

Hakob is asking for a 400,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow him to deliver coffee to neighboring villages, and thereby to increase his family's income and to develop his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car, which will allow him to deliver coffee to neighboring villages

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Garmai K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Great. She is 28 years old, married and has two children, age 12 and 5. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For four years, she has been selling rice in Congo Town Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice.

She describes herself as a person with great determination. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes of different types

loans.name: Money Tree Group

texts.en:
Marie C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Money Tree. She is 27 years old, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years old. She was only able to attend school through 2nd grade due to lack of financial support. 

For seven years, she has been selling cassava (also called manioc, the root is similar to a potato) and oil in VOA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of cassava and gallons of oil. 

She describes herself as respectful. Her goal is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava and gallons of oil

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1  est un regroupement  de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, au moins 4 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
MINATA C. utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte  est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional extended families. On average, the women are 36 years old and have at least four children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third farming loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Minata C. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and soil additives, at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. The members of the group each expect to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenditures.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
KARYA K. utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Dah, San et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 2 is a group of married women of the village of Dah of the prefecture of San, area of Ségou, fourth administrative area of the republic of Mali, who live in large traditional families. They are on average 35 years old, with 6 children and cultivate peanuts. With the aim of making their farms profitable, the members of the group have decided to incorporate the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso starting 3 years ago. After having correctly refunded the preceding loans, they are on their third countryside loan. KARYA K. will use her loan to buy, a sufficient quantity of peanut seed, small equipment and seeders, at the large market of San city. After the wintering, harvests are stored during a certain time so that they reach best value before being sold at the large market of Dah, San and in the surrounding markets, in small lots (often large lots), for cash to customers generally from the big cities. The members of the group expect to each realize, after the flow of their agricultural product, a benefit of 35.000 FCFA which will be used to refund the interest of the loan and the current expenditure of the family.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seeders, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Rachel C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Favor. She is 33 years old, is married, and has seven children who range from 4 to 16 years old. She also cares for one sibling. Rachel was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 14 years, Rachel has been selling frozen meat, such as chicken and pork, in West Point community, Monrovia, Liberia.

Rachel plans to use her 11,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 55,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more frozen chicken and pork to sell. She describes herself as moderate.

Rachel’s goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chicken and pork to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 3  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
FATOUMATA K.  la présidente du groupe utilisera son prêt  pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants, exclusivement  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
FATOUMATA K. à l’instar des autres membres du groupe compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de son produit agricole, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 3 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional extended families. On average, the women are 38 years and have 6 children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Fatoumata K., the group's leader, will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and input materials, which are only available at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. Fatoumata K., like the other members of the group, expects to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 4  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
DJENEBA B. va utiliser prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants, au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 4 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional families. On average, the women are 38 years old and have 6 children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Djeneba B. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and input materials, at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crops will be stored for them to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. Each members of the group expects to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover their family expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural materials.

loans.name: God With Us Group

texts.en:
Princess K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God With Us. She is 34 years old, is single, and has three children who range from 1 to 18 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Princess was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.

For six years, Princess has been selling rice, bitter-boy, pepper and oil in ELWA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, bitter-boy, pepper and gallons of oil.

Princess describes herself as peaceful. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bitter-boy, pepper and gallons of oil

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
BAOUMOU D. utilisera son prêt  pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage,  sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Dah, San  et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
BAOUMOU D. compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de  sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 5 is a group of married women from the village of Dah in the San Prefecture of the Segou region (4th administrative region of Mali) who live in traditional extended families. On average, the women are 38 years old and have 6 children. They grow peanuts. Because of concerns about the profitability of their farm, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. This is their third loan and they have repaid their previous loans. Baoumou D. will use her loan to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural tools and input materials, at the general market in the town of San. After the rainy season, the crop will be stored for it to gain value and then sold at the general markets in Dah, San and in surrounding markets, in stores (often in bulk), or to cash customers from large cities. Baoumou D. expects to make a revenue of 35 000 CFA Francs from selling this agricultural product, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the family's expenditures.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soap and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pay As You Call Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Pay As You Call. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four children who range from 15 to 30 years old. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.

For three years, Elizabeth has been selling charcoal in Congo Town community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth describes herself as peaceful. Her dream is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: God Provision Group

texts.en:
Matthew R., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Provision. He is 34 years old, is married, and has two children who range from 1 to 5 years old. He was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of support.

For eleven years, Matthew has been selling timber in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more timber to sell.

Matthew describes himself as trustworthy. His dream is to expand his business, build a house, and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Setting W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Help The Poor". She is 49 years old, married and has eight children who range in age from 12 to 34 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. For 4 years, she has been selling rice and oil at the Duazon Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as a good woman.

Setting plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil. Her goal is to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil

loans.name: Thanks To God Group

texts.en:
Fatmata K. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in a village called Okro Hill, forty-three years ago. She is a widow with five children to look after.

This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

For over twenty years now, Fatmata has been selling cloth, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), and gari (a fast food made from cassava roots). Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy eight bags of gari, four bales of cotton, and twenty gallons of palm-oil to add to her stock. 

Included in the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh on the left handing over the loan and branch manager, Abdul Karim mistakenly pictured at the back right.

loans.use: To buy eight bags of gari, four bales of cotton, and twenty gallons of palm-oil to add to her stock

loans.name: Future Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Future Traders” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Edna B. C., pictured in the left handing over the loan.

Memuna B. (who is pictured second from left) is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old was born in Godrich, Freetown and is married with three children. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells charcoal which she buys from the provinces and sells in Freetown.

Memuna will use her share of the loan to buy bags of charcoal to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to add to her business

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Hope to God” group. They are small-scale-business people based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, pictured on the left handing over the loan.

The leader of this group is Alie K., age thirty-nine. He was born in Yoni, a village in northern Sierra Leone. Now he lives with his wife and seven children in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

For more than ten years now, Alie has been selling both food and non-food items like cigarettes, mints, laundry soap, bathing soap, batteries, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business both in terms of size and quality. He will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy more items like cigarettes, mints, laundry soap, bathing soap, batteries, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Talanesu Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu S., Hawa S. and Hawa K. of the "Talanesu" group. Talanesu is a Temne term meaning "Believe in us". They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo small town, near Freetown.

They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to improve their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently, they will make better profits and improve their standard of living.

Kadiatu S. is the leader of this group. She is thirty years of age and was born in a place called Benguma, near Waterloo. She is married to a businessman and they have four children.

Kadiatu sells market food such as onions, pepper, salt, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice and palm-oil (the country's favorite cooking oil) and has been a businesswoman for four years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy more cooking ingredients like palm-oil, rice, onions and pepper.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah on the left, handing over the loan).

loans.use: To buy more cooking ingredients to sell like palm-oil, rice, fish, onions and pepper

loans.name: Sapa Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sapa” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are petty-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, pictured on the left, handing over the loan.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is  Hawanatu T.. She was born about twenty-five years ago in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with one child.

Hawanatu has been selling cooking ingredients – onions, salt, palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), pepper, tomatoes, etc., for eight years now. With this loan, she will buy more bags of the above mentioned items to sell.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions, salt, palm-oil, pepper, tomatoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Together As One Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Together As One II” group. They are small scale businessmen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. These gentlemen are seeking a loan of  1,200,000 leones each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further strengthen their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Abass B. who is age 25. Abass was born in Songo village. He is married with one child who is not of school-going age. Abass sells radios and mobile phone accessories. He has been doing this business for three years now. With the help of this loan, he will buy radios and mobile phone accessories to add to his current ones.

Also included in the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, pictured on the left handing over the loan.

loans.use: To buy radios and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Cry For Help Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Cry for Help” group. They are small scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 2,200,000 leones. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. 

The leader of this group is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in Yoni, a village in Northern Sierra Leone. She is 45 years old, married to a businessman and they have four children. Isatu sells household utensils like dishes, pots, stoves, rubber bowls, etc. She has been in this business for eight years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will be able to buy her goods wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy household utensils like dishes, pots, stoves, rubber bowls, etc.

loans.name: Men Of Action Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businessmen from the small town of Waterloo, Western Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones (SLL) each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of 800,000 SLL, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales and more profit. 

Alhajie K. is the leader of this group. He was born in Lunsar, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 25 years old. He is married and has two children. Alhajie sells house-building materials and has been doing this business for ten years now. With this loan, he will buy locks, padlocks, paint, cement, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: To buy locks, padlocks, paint, cement, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: God's Grace Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “God’s Grace” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, making more sales and better profit. 

Munda T. is the leader of this group. Munda was born in a town call Matru Johng, in Southern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years of age, married to a businesswoman, and they have two children who are attending primary school. 

Munda sells house-building materials. He has been in business for five years now. With the help of this loan, he will buy house-building materials like cement, iron rods, paint, etc. wholesale to add to his business. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement, iron rods, paint, etc.

loans.name: Tainratha Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesspeople in Magburka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 4,200,000 for the entire group in order to enable them to expand their businesses. With  this loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. 

Memuna K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. She was born in a small town called Lunsar, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately thirty-nine years of age, married, and has six children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – four in secondary school and two in primary school. 

Memuna sells fresh fish. She has been in the fish business for many years now. With her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000), she will travel to Freetown and buy cartons of fresh fish and sell them retail in Magburaka's town market. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: Buy cartons of fresh fish to sell retail

loans.name: Umaru J.'s Group

texts.en:
