In the photo above are members of the staff of the Kankalay Isamic Primary School Madina village. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 10,800,000 in order to help them pay school fees for their children or invest in business or buy pieces of furniture, or a plot of land, etc. Kankalay Isamic Primary School Madina was founded in 1997 in Madina village. The school is staffed with 11 teachers and has 350 pupils. 

Umaru J. K. is the leader of this group. He is a 54-year-old man. He is married to a teacher and they have six children – five in primary school and one in secondary school. Umaru will use his share (SLL 1,200,000)  of this loan to invest in his business. 

Umaru has served the teaching profession for 28 good years, but for 10 years now, he has backed up his teaching work with some petty trading. In this way, he is able to get additional funds to supplement his meager monthly salary as a school teacher.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Women Of Progress Group

texts.en:
Marion W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Women Of Progress'. She is 40 years old, married and has four children who range from 18 months to 10 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling. 

For 3 years, she has been selling bread and crushed rocks in ELWA Rock Hill Community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour. She describes herself as jovial.

Her dream is to improve her business, build a shop and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Juana Doribel

texts.es: Juana Doribel tiene 47 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, ubicada en su vivienda pues con mucha ayuda de su esposo y empeño propio ha progresado, ella ha obtenido muchas experiencias y todas le han enseñado cosas muy importantes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, refrescos y jugos.
texts.en:
Juana Doribel is 47 years old and works in a grocery store. It has been more than two years since she has been working in this business which is located in her home. With her husband's help and her own determination she has been able to progress.Through many experiences she has gained much knowledge. The loan is for the purchase of goods such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, sodas, and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of goods such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Leila Rosa

texts.es: Leila Rosa tiene 37 años, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues fue con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros y también con la ayuda de de su esposo que siempre le ha proporcionado ayuda cuando más la ha necesitado. Pues siempre se levanta temprano a las 7 de la mañana para tener todo listo hasta los quehaceres del hogar. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa interior entre otras.
texts.en:
Leila Rosa is 37 years old, and she runs a corner shop. She started this activity more than 7 years ago, funding it both with her savings and thanks to the aid of her husband, who has always helped her out when she needed it the most. She always wakes up very early, at 7 am, to have it all ready, including her housework. Then loan she is requesting will be used to buy various products, among which basic grains, cosmetics and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Brenda Maria, tiene 30 años. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, Ella ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó en ese tiempo debido a que su compañero de vida era quien le apoyaba a que siguiera adelante con su actividad, pues ha sido importante para sufragar los gastos del hogar.  Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un restaurante grande ubicado en un local muy bonito y que pueda expandirse más su negocio.
texts.en:
Brenda Maria is 30 years old. She runs a general store and she has been dedicating herself to this activity for 3 years. She started back then because her partner suggested she kept her activity running as it was important to provide for the house expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core products. She has always dreamed of opening a big restaurant in a very nice location and for her activity to grow even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group 'Shalom', and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Dominga is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling yucca (a potato-like root that is a Dominican staple) and plantains by purchasing more of both. She will use the profit to purchase notebooks for her children and to cover basic necessities. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: yucca and plantains for resale

loans.name: Hada Francis

texts.es: Hada Francis tiene 46 años. Es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues no es la primera vez que tiene la oportunidad de financiamientos. Y al encontrarse en la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos es que sigue con este negocio. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de pinturas de unas, pinturas de labios, bolsos, sabanas, toallas. Desea llegar a tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Hada Francis is 46 years old. She is a tenacious and responsible woman, and the activity she dedicates herself to is running a general store. She has been working in this field for more than 5 years, and this is not the first time she has had the chance to ask for a loan. Willing to increase her earnings, she keeps on running this activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy nail polish, lipsticks, handbags, bed sheets, towels. She wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pants, T-shirts, underwear, skirts and shirts and plantains, flour, oil, eggs and other supplies for a fried food stand

loans.name: Doris Elisa

texts.es: Doris Elisa tiene la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 3 años que inicio este negocio pues con mucho esfuerzo es que ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos, pero con el paso del tiempo y los financiamientos es que ha mejorado su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts y trajes. Sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Doris Elisa has been dedicating herself to the general store activity for more than 3 years, and she has succeeded in keeping it running with much effort. She has a wide variety of customers asking for different products, but in the long run and with some loans she has succeeded in improving her shop. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts and suits. She dreams of opening a clothes shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married to an Arabic teacher, who is also actively participating in the business, and she has one child. She sells foodstuffs at the central main market in Makeni. Memunatu began her business when one of her relatives offered her business capital of 300,000 leones. She started her business on a small scale at her residence. As the business grew, she moved to the central main market where she sells now. Memunatu has been in this business for more than ten years. She understands the environment around her business very well, her business skills are good, and she has been making process in this business.

Memunatu has been receiving loans from ARD for quite some time now. She has a very good credit rating and is determined to continue repaying her loans on time. 

Memunatu needs a loan to pay rent for her store and to buy more stock. She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to educate her child to university and support her pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: To buy additional food stock and pay the rent for her store

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es: Blanca Estela, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, las cuales son menores de edad y le ayudan a trabajar en el negocio. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, Ella ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó en ese tiempo debido a que su compañero de vida era quien le apoyaba a que siguiera adelante con su actividad, pues ha sido importante para sufragar los gastos del hogar.  Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un restaurante grande ubicado en un local muy bonito y que pueda expandirse más su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela is 28 years old, she is married and has 3 young children who help her working in the shop. She has a general store and she has been dedicating herself to this activity for 3 years. She started back then because her partner suggested she kept her activity running as it was important to provide for the house expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core products. She has always dreamed of opening a big restaurant in a very nice location and for her activity to grow even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Adriana Victoria

texts.es:
La joven Adriana vive en la capital de Managua en el barrio San Judas, tiene la edad de 27 años, madre de dos hijos, desde hace dos años se ha dedicado de ebanista pues hace años aprendió el oficio en un taller de carpintería. 
En donde inicia luego sola, logrando un trabajo en su casa, lo que es para ella una gran sastifacion ya que puede cuidar a sus hijos de cerca y hacer su trabajo.
En estos momentos tiene poca madera lo que se ha parado en hacer sus trabajos. Es por eso a través del financiamiento lograra comprar madera variada como: cedro macho con setecientas pulgadas,  circular de mano, taladro trupper con el objetivo de poder aumentar la producción y ayudarse económicamente ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su compañero por que es madre soltera
texts.en:
Adriana lives in the country's capital, Managua, in the San Judas neighborhood. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children. For the past two years, she has worked making furniture, since she learned this profession years ago in a carpentry shop. Later, she started working alone, in a workshop within her home. This gives her great satisfaction, since she can take care of her children and be close to them while doing her work. Currently, she does not have much wood, whcih has stopped her from working. For this reason, thanks to the loan she will be able to buy a range of materials including 700-inch cedro macho wood, a circular hand saw, and a Truper drill, so that she can increase her production and help herself economically, since she is a single mother and does not have help from her partner.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, a circular hand saw and a drill to increase her production

loans.name: Mallana Group

texts.en:
Anthony F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Mallana. He is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. He was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of support. For 3 years, he has been selling light bulbs in West Point, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He describes himself as very reliable.

Anthony plans to use his 18,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 90,000 LRD group loan to buy more light bulbs. His dream is to expand his business, build a house and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more light bulbs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Bedding, bedclothes, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Antonia es una mujer dedicada al comercio, tiene la edad de 41 años, madre soltera de tres hijos, desde hace varios años vende productos de papas, fritas, manzana, algodones de azúcar, palomitas, que vende de forma ambulante junto con su hijo mayor para lograr vender y sacar el diario de su alimentación.
En su casa aun falta hacer muchas mejoras, como repellar paredes, embaldosar por es de tierra, lo que hará en un futuro ya que no cuenta con dinero para estas mejoras ya que lo primordial es lograr ayudar a sus hijos y poder pagar los gastos básicos.
Con este financiamiento podrá comprar: quintal de papas, galón de mayonesa, salsa de tomate, queso, platos desechables para servir las papas fritas, tres canastos de manzanas, quintales de maíz, para preparar las palomitas, y lograr aumentar su inventario.
En este momento hay poca venta y la que tenía la anda mi hijo mayor vendiendo. 
Contenta ya que podrá seguir con la inversión de su negocio mediante estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia is a businesswoman. She is 41 years old and the single mother of three children. She's been selling fried potatoes and apples, candy apples, cotton candy, and popcorn for several years. She sells on foot, along with her eldest son, in order to be able to earn enough for their daily sustenance. Her home still needs many improvements, such as repairing walls and tiling the dirt floor. She will do this later because she does not have the money. Her priority is to help her children and pay for basic necessities. This loan will allow her to buy 100 kilograms (kg) of potatoes, a gallon of mayonnaise, tomato sauce, cheese, and paper plates on which to serve the fried potatoes, three baskets of apples, and 100 kg lots of popping corn. This will allow her to increase her inventory. At this time her sales are low and her eldest son makes those that she has. She is happy that she will be able to continue investing in her business through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Nahima Isvelia

texts.es: Nahima Isvelia tiene 19 años, su actividad es la venta de electrodomésticos y cafetín. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, pues fue su Papa quien le enseño a ser comerciante y para que aprendiera a manejar el negocio, y al mismo tiempo que se independizara para que le sirviera en un futuro. Pues siempre le ha gustado hablar con sus clientes y proporcionarles lo que ellos le solicitan. El deseo de ella es tener su propia tienda de electrodomésticos y ofrecerlo a sus clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y así comprar abanicos, planchas, televisores, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Nahima is 19 years old. For work, she sells appliances and runs a cafe. She has had this business for 5 years. Her father taught her how to be a merchant and how to manage the business, so that she would be able to do so independently and benefit from it in the future. Nahima has always enjoyed talking with her clients and providing them with what they request. She hopes to one day have her own appliance store to offer to her customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials and to buy fans, irons and television sets, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of meat and meat products

loans.name: La Confianza 1,2 Group

texts.en: Eulalia is the coordinator of her group La Confianza (The Confidence), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. Eulalia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and is excited to invest in her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling breakfast by purchasing salami, ham, beef, plantains, bananas, oranges, tamarinds, limes and disposable plates and silverware. She will use the profits to invest in her home by repairing her roof. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Salami, ham, beef, plantains, bananas, oranges, tamarinds, limes and disposable plates and silverware

loans.name: Lesbia Esperanza

texts.es: Lesbia Esperanza tiene 48 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es así que tiene esta actividad, en donde recuerda que su primer año le fue difícil pero conforme pasaba el tiempo pudo nivelarse y posteriormente sus ganancias aumentaron. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que ha logrado, es por ello que en el futuro espera obtener su propia tienda, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos como también mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Lesbia Esperanza is 48 years old. Her business is clothing sales, a business she started more than 25 years ago. She remembers that her first year was very difficult, but with time things leveled out and her earnings grew. Lesbia feels very satisfied with what she has accomplished. In the future, she hopes to have her own store. With this in mind, she commits to being punctual in her payments. With this loan, she will invest in merchandise with the goal of increasing her income and also bettering her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Batey Nuevo 3 Group

texts.en: Nelson is the coordinator of his group Batey Nuevo 3 (New Batey), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. His group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children. Nelson is excited to be taking his eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying goats and selling the meat in his butcher shop. He will use the profits to improve his business and become a successful farmer. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy goats and sell the meat in his butcher shop

loans.name: Marta De La Cruz

texts.es: Marta De La Cruz tiene 50 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 que tiene este medio de vida. Su esfuerzo por salir adelante fue creciendo, pues tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijas que actualmente laboran de manera independiente. Pues su negocio inicio fue creciendo por sus clientes que día a día llegan a su pulpería en busca de los diferentes productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas y productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Marta De La Cruz is 50 years old. Her business is a small grocery shop. She has had this livelihood for more than 4 years. Her efforts to get ahead increased because she had to support her three daughters who currently work independently. Since her business began it has grown because each day her customers come to her shop looking for the different products that she offers. The financing she is applying for is for the purchase of basic materials such as detergents, bulk grains, sweets, and household products.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: Maria Amparo tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de camarones. Ella dio inicio como ayudante en el negocio de una amiga pues anteriormente su marido trabajaba en la pesca y fue así que aprendió este negocio, pero ya no siguen juntos por lo que a cómo pueden tratan de proporcionarle a sus 2 hijos los estudios necesarios. Los clientes son lo que más le han ayudado a incrementar nuevos clientes por la fama de obtener muy buenos ingresos. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pescado, chuleta, camarones y punches.
texts.en:
Maria Amparo is 44 years old. She sells shrimps for a living. She started by helping out at a friend's business. Her husband used to work in fishing, which helped her learn about the business. However, they are no longer together and she is now trying to get her 2 children through school. Her customers have helped her the most when it comes to getting new customers thanks to the reputation of her good prices. She wants to use the loan to purchase raw material such as fish, chops, shrimps and crabs.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Mosoc Killa Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” actualmente se encuentra en el VII ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, elaboración de proyectos, preparación de torta, venta de productos de belleza, venta de ropa, venta de artesanía y venta de muebles. Otros socios son por ejemplo son mecánicos y  empleado del viejo bar. 
 
Florentina, tiene 46 años, es casada  y es natural del Cusco.

Florentina nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Mosoc Killa”  somos 16 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Todos mis compañeros del banco comunal son personas, amigables, responsables y sobre todo puntuales al momento de pagar sus cuotas. Yo tengo mi restaurante donde vendo comida, y mis clientes les gusta lo que cocino, el préstamo que requiero es para comprar un saco de arroz pues me está haciendo falta para poder expender mis ricos platos de comida.  Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar los estudios de mis hijos e hice mantenimiento de mi casa. 

(Los socios Julia, Marco y Elena no están en la foto por que llegaron tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mosoc Killa” is currently in the VII cycle and is shaped by hard working and entrepreneurial people who are looking for opportunities at every moment to get ahead and with their daily efforts they are delivering a better future for their children. The communal bank's meetings are monthly in the central office of the Arariwa Association. The business activities of some of the members are for example, project development, cake making, sale of beauty products, sale of clothing, sale of craftwork and sale of furniture. Other members are for example mechanics and an employee from the old bar. Florentina, is 46, married and is a native of Cusco. Florentina tells us - In my communal bank “Mosoc Killa” there are 16 members and they chose me as the representative of the communal bank to give my testimony of my business activity. All my fellow members of the communal bank are friendly, responsible people and above all are punctual in paying their instalments. I have my restaurant where I sell food, and my customers like what I cook, the loan that I require is to buy a sack of rice as I need it to be able to sell my rich plates of food. It has already been several years that I have worked with the Arariwa Association and it has gone very well for me. With the loans that they have given me and the profits that I obtained I could pay for my children's studies and do maintenance around my house. (The members Julia, Marco and Elena are not in the photo because they arrived late to the meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro José, cuenta con un negocio de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos, refrescos, cosméticos y otros productos. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y con este financiamiento surtirá con más productos su negocio, para poder aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ganancias. Es señor es casado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar, la pulpería es atendida por su esposa y él se dedica a realizar trabajos propios como en la albañilería, obteniendo otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Jose operates a general store from his house. He sells everyday foodstuffs, cold drinks, cosmetics and other products. He started the business with his own funds and he will use this loan to stock more products for the store, products that will allow him to increase his sales and generate a larger income. Sr. Pedro Jose is married and has two children, one of whom is school-aged. His wife tends the store and he works at other jobs, such as construction, to cover the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Camino al Exito” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. helados, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, venta D. mochilas escolares y venta D. golosinas. Otros socios brindan servicios D. cocina, llamadas local y nacionales, recepcionista D. u hotel turístico y  empleado D. una pollería. 

Claudia, tiene 54 años, es divorciada y tiene seis hijos D. las cuales todos ya son independientes.   

Claudia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Camino al Exito”  somos 12 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. 

Su actividad económica principal D. la señora Claudia es la venta D. artesanía y librería D. forma ambulatoria, ella recorre la ciudad del Cusco a pie y se dirige a hoteles, restaurante, centros arqueológicos y paraderos turísticos en busca D. turistas para vender artesanías. Ella también venD. en la entrada y salida D. un colegio útiles escolares como por ejemplo lapiceros, borradores, cartucheras y  muchas cosas más. Ella empieza a vender útiles desD. las siete la mañana hasta la una D. tarD. aproximadamente. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Claudia es socia nueva en el banco comunal y su amiga Victoria le invito a participar en el banco comunal,  ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como lapiceros, reglas borradores, cartucheras y etc.
texts.en:
The Camino al Exito (Road to Success) community bank is now in its fifth round of funding. The members of the group are hard-working business people who just want a chance to get ahead in the world and create a better future for their children. The group meets every thirty days at the main Asociacion Arariwa office. Members operate a range of businesses: cosmetics sales; ice cream sales; clothing sales; food sales; sales of school backpacks; and candy sales. Other members proviD. various services: cooking; operating a phone call center; working as a receptionist at a tourist hotel; and working in a chicken processing plant. Claudia, 54, is divorced and has six children all of whom are now independent. She tells us, "My community bank, Camino al Exito, has 12 members and they chose me to proviD. an example of the businesses we operate". She works as a street vendor and her main source of income is from sales of crafts, pens, paper, etc. She works around Cusco, on foot, going to hotels, restaurants, archaelogical sites and tourist spots, looking for tourists who might want her craft products. She also works at local schools selling pencils, erasers, pen cartridges and a lot more. She works selling school supplies from seven in the morning to one or so in the afternoon. She has done this kind of work for twenty years and it's going well. Claudia is a new member of the community bank. Her friend, Victoria, invited her to join the group. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as pens, rulers, erasers, pen cartridges, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Raquel tiene la edad de 32 años, madre de dos hijos, casada, esta trabajando como promotora para dar lo necesario a sus hijos, como también cubrir los gastos, su esposo trabaja de conductor y ambos se esfuerzan por lograr un equilibrio y poder ajustar con los gastos.
A través de estos préstamo ha logrado las mejoras a su casa, lo que le sastiface ya que se avanza. Lo que hará con esta inversión es un anexo de cuarto y hará el baño que para ella es de gran necesidad, ya que lograra poder tener mejor aseo personal, mejores condiciones de higiene para comenzar comprara material como: quinientos bloques, ocho quintales de hierro, dos metro de arena, cemento, estribos, zinc, perlines para comenzar  a construir.
texts.en:
Dona Raquel, 32, is married and the mother of two children. She is working as a promoter so that she can provide her children with the things they need. Her husband works as a driver and they both strive to make enough to cover all the needs of their household. Thanks to these loans, they have been able to make improvements to their house, something that greatly pleases them because it has made their lives better. They will use this loan to add a room and build a much-needed bathroom. The bathroom will provide them with a cleaner and healthier space for a toilet. To build the bathroom, they will use the loan to buy construction materials: five-hundred cement blocks; eight quintales (a local unit of measure) of iron; two meters of sand; cement; flooring, roofing, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build bathroom.

loans.name: Arlen Ivette

texts.es: La señora Arlen Ivette, es dueña de una tienda de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Es casada, tiene dos niñas las que se encuentran en el preescolar y primaria, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia como transportista brindando el servicio de taxi. La señora necesita de este financiamiento para aumentar su tienda, comprar más ropa y poder atender los encargo de sus clientes, y de esta manera poner generar mejores ganancias y darle mejores condiciones a sus hijas, como también la educación.
texts.en:
Arlen Ivette is the owner of a store that sells clothing for men, women and children. She is married and has two daughters who are in preschool and primary school. Her husband works as an independent driver providing taxi services. Arlen Ivette needs this financing to expand her store, buying more clothing so that she can fill her customers' orders, and thus generate greater profits and provide a better quality of life for her daughters and pay for their education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Qoriwasi Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Qoriwasi” actualmente se encuentra en el X ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta y compra de oro, crianza de animales menores, venta de medicamentos, venta de artesanía y venta de muebles. Otros socios son por ejemplo docentes de jardín y colegio, empleados de la municipalidad de Wanchaq, policía, asesor de compañías mineras y  guía de turismo. 

Augusta, tiene 48 años, es natural del Cusco y es soletera.   

Augusta nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Qoriwasi”  somos 15 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Todos mis compañeros del banco comunal son personas, amigables, responsables y puntuales al momento de pagar sus cuotas. Yo soy profesora y me encanta enseñar buenos valores y a mis alumnas.

La señora Augusta  se dedica a  es la enseñanza y trabaja en el colegio nacional de señoritas de “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a enseñar y le gusta su profesión. Su actividad económica complementaria es administrar su tienda de abarrotes.  Augusta requiere el préstamo para comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y etc. 
Karina también es socia del banco comunal, es natural de la provincia de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco y tiene 26 años de edad. Karina se dedica a enseñar y trabaja en el jardín llamado “Talemtum” y trabaja desde el año 2009 hasta ahora y le va muy bien gracias al trabajo y responsabilidad que le pone al trabajar. Karina requiere el préstamo para gasto personal como por ejemplo pagar alimentación, deudas y pasajes.
texts.en:
The community bank “Qoriwasi” is currently in their tenth loan cycle and is made up of hard working and enterprising people who look for opportunities in every moment to get ahead and give their children a better future through their daily efforts. The community bank holds a meeting every month in the main office of the Arariwa Association. The group members are involved in different fields of work such as buying and selling gold, raising small animals, selling medication, artesanal products and furniture. Other members work as kindergarden and school teachers, Wanchaq council employees, mineral company assessors and tourist guides. Augusta is 48 years old, single and comes from Cusco. She tells us that ‘in my communal bank “Qoriwasi” there are 15 members and they chose me to be the representative of the community bank to give my testimony about the work I do. All of my associates at the community bank are very friendly and responsible people, and very punctual when it comes time to making their repayments. I am a teacher and I Iove to instil good values in my students’. Augusta works as a teacher in the national girls college “Clorinda Matto de Turner” in the city of Cusco. She has been teaching for 25 years and she likes this profession. She also complements her income from teaching by running a grocery store. Augusta needs this loan to buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta and so on. Karina is also a member of the community bank. She is 26 years old and comes from the province of Quillabamba in the department of Cusco. She has taught in a kindergarden called “Talemtum” since 2009 and thanks to this job and the responsibility that she demonstrates at work she has been going very well. Karina needs a loan to cover personal expenses such as groceries, debts and travel fares.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as rice, sugar and pasta

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José tiene un negocio que es un taller de soldadura ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 9 años. Rolando realiza trabajos fuera de su casa cuando algún cliente lo solicita, realiza la compra de sus materiales de contado y sus ventas son de contado y al crédito. Por lo que ha demostrado que es una persona muy responsable y además siempre paga sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a su negocio y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Rolando recibe ayuda de su esposa la cual trabaja como directora de un colegio, el señor vive de manera moderada y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Rolando José has been running a soldering workshop in a room in his house for 9 years. He works out of home at his clients’ request and purchases materials in cash and sells for cash or credit. He has demonstrated that he is a very responsible person and always makes his repayments on time and in full. With this loan he would like to maintain his business adequately and obtain the most income possible, and he is very happy with the loan terms he has been offered. Rolando is supported by his wife who works as the director of a college. He lives moderately and has all the basic services he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristo Asencion De Rumichaca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca” actualmente se encuentra en el VIII ciclo y está conformado por 11 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca. La comunidad se encuentra a una hora y veinte minutos de la Cuidad del Cusco como quien se dirige a visitar las ruinas de Ollantaytambo de la ciudad de Urubamba. En cada reunión tres socias coordinan para preparar una comida para todos los integrantes del banco comunal.
      
Las actividades económicas de los algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta de chicha, venta de ropa, venta de arboles de eucalipto, venta de artesanía, venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y venta de hortalizas. Otros socios brindan servicios de albañilería, carpintería, transporte urbano y  empleado de un hotel. 

Ermitaña, tiene 45 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos, nació en la comunidad de Rumichaca y vive en Pintacha en Urubamba.  

Ermitaña nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca”  somos 11 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. 

Su actividad económica principal de la señora Ermitaña en la venta de chicha de jora, ella tiene una picantería que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ella empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano preparando la chicha y después empieza a vender a las 10 mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ella vende de lunes a viernes y a sus clientes le gusta lo que prepara la chicha. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ermitaña requiere el préstamo para maíz para elaborar jora y también requiere para comprar cerveza.
texts.en:
The “Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca” community bank is currently in its 8th loan cycle and is made up of 11 hardworking entrepreneurs who are always looking for opportunities to grow. Through their daily work, they are building a better future for their children. The bank's meetings take place monthly in the community of Rumichaca. The community is an hour and 20 minutes from Cusco city, traveling along the same route as if you were visiting the Ollantaytambo ruins from Urubamba city. At each meeting, 3 members prepare food for the whole group. The members sell chicha, clothing, eucalyptus trees, handcrafts, groceries, and vegetables. Other members raise small livestock (guinea pigs), or provide services such as bricklaying, carpentry, public transportation, and hospitality. Ermitaña is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She was born in the community of Rumichaca and now lives in Pintacha, Urubamba. She tells us: "In my bank, Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca, there are 11 members. They have chosen me to represent the group and talk about my work." Ermitaña sells chicha de jora (fermented beverage made from yellow maize). She has runs a picantería (restaurant serving shared plates, like a Peruvian tapas restaurant) in her home. She begins to work very early each day, preparing chicha and selling it from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Ermitaña sells Monday through Friday and her customers love the chicha she makes. She has been running this business for many years and it is going well. Ermitaña needs a loan for maize and beer to make the chicha.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize and beer to make chicha de jora.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 25 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Dina se mantiene sola desde los 21 años, su sueño era  tener su propia tienda, pero por cosas del destino, se dedicó en la producción y comercialización de ladrillos de manera artesanal, desde entonces le va muy bien este negocio, dándole muchas satisfacciones económicas, actualmente los vende en la localidad de Pichari, ya que es una localidad que esta en constante crecimiento económico y poblacional; por tanto tiene compradores potenciales, debido a la calidad y tiempo de entrega que lo ofrece a sus clientes. Generalmente trabaja en compañía de su pareja, logrando ser un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en ocasiones necesita de más gente a la que contrata para realizar en menor tiempo la producción. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma planta de elaboración, es por ello que espera contar con una movilidad propia de carga, con la finalidad de pueda trasladar sus ladrillos hacia los distintos puntos de distribución, así logrará minimizar tiempo y ampliar su mercado. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y eficiente, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por los beneficios que otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos para que pueda  fabricar en mayor volumen, y obtener mayores ingresos que en meses anteriores.
texts.en:
Dina is 25 years old, she lives with her partner and they have a daughter. The live in their own wooden house in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Dina provides for herself since she was 21: she dreamed of having her own shop, but as fate had it, she has dedicated herself to the production and sales of artisanal wood bricks instead. Since she started, this activity has been very profitable, and it has given her many economical satisfactions. She currently sells her bricks in the town of Pichari, which experiences a constant population and economic growth; she has potential buyers there, thanks to the quality of the product she offers and the delivery times she guarantees to her customers. She generally works together with her partner, and they are a good working team, but sometimes she needs more people, and she hires workers to carry out the production more quickly. Her retail outlet is located in her production factory, and for this she hope to have a vehicle of her own, in order to deliver her bricks to the different distribution outlets, and thus succeeding in reducing the delivery time and increase her market share. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she commits to keeping on repaying in a punctual and proficient way; she is also satisfied with her communal bank for the benefits it grants. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials and components to produce a higher quantity of bricks, hoping to beat the earnings of the previous months.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and components for the production of wood bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy core ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Heriberto Esteban

texts.es:
Heriberto de 61 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). El es confeccionista, desde joven el cocía ropa para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente. 

Desde joven el trabajo con ropa por eso que cuando se caso el continuo con este trabajo pero ahora con ayuda de su esposa, el horario de trabajo es variado ya que trabaja en su casa. Para asegurar el futuro de el y su esposa el quiere construir mejor su casa con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques.   

En el futuro el quiere seguir con salud para seguir trabajado alado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 61 years old, he lives in Guayaquil, near the motorway known as La Perimetral (a periurban zone whose green areas are being reinstated). He is a tailor: ha started in his youth, sewing clothes in order to economically help his family. Working with clothes in his youth, after he got married he kept on working in this field with his wife’s help. Working hours vary as he works in his home. In order to grant a future to his wife and to himself he wants to ameliorate his house. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cement and bricks. He hopes to be still in good health in the future in order to keep on working alongside his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace años logro tener su propio negocio alquiler de sillas y mesas, tiene la edad de 52 años, junto a su esposo siguen apoyando a sus hijos.
Las mejoras a su casa la ha ido mejorando  poco a poco, con el crédito anterior logro hacer la cocina, y divisiones   a su  casa lo que esta contenta. Con este préstamo quiere comprar las puertas de su cuarto, para poder dormir en mejores condiciones ya que por falta de dinero no lo ha hecho. 
Sus planes a futuro es captar más clientes en su negocio, para lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda, como la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a hard-working woman, who established her own shop – chairs and tables rental – many years ago. She is 52 years old and she and her husband keep on providing for their children. Little by little she has succeeded in improving her house more and more. With her previous loan she was able to build the kitchen and partition walls, and she is happy about it. This current loan will be used to buy doors for her bedroom because she wants to sleep in safer conditions, and she lacks the required amount to buy them. For the future she plans to attract even more customers for her shop, in order to reach better living conditions and to provide for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wooder doors for her room and improve her safety conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy core ingredients for her meals and Claro recharge cards.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

La señora Juana, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es vender hortalizas y verduras como por ejemplo maíz, cebolla, orégano, papa y lizas. Sus actividades económicas complementarias es confeccionar chompas de lana, chullos, guantes, etc. También  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más cereales y lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is a half hour from the city of Cusco and one hour from the city of Urubamba. The people of Rayanniyoc work at farming and livestock production. Sra. Juana, 52, is married and has four children. Her main source of income comes from selling produce from her farm and garden: maize, onions, oregano, potatoes and "lizas". She supplements her income by making and selling wool sweaters, hats, gloves, etc. and by raising animals. Sra. Juana belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc community bank, a group attached to Asociacion Arariwa. She has been a member of the community bank for some years and has proven to be a responsible borrower, with a record of repaying her loans on time. She will use this loan to buy grains and alpaca wool.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Don Adolfo es padre de familia de cuatro hijos, casado, desde hace varios años, se dedicaba al acarreo pues tenia un vehiculo propio, que había comprado con ahorros, 
Debido a la falta de ganancias decide cambiar de negocio vende el vehiculo y compra un carro para trabajarlo como taxi, lo que lleva varios años en este negocio con ayuda de su esposa ya que también vende nacatamales que ella misma prepara para ayudar  a sus hijos ya que los cuatro están estudiando, y a veces la carreras de taxi están malas pero día a día se trabaja y se gana.
Con los financiamiento logra dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo lo que es para el de gran importancia ya que es su medio de trabajo. Con este préstamo reparara el sistema eléctrico del taxi y poder dar un buen servicio
texts.en:
Don Adolfo is married and the head of a family of four children. He used to own a vehicle with which he hauled goods, a vehicle that he bought with savings. That business didn't pay, though, so he decided to sell the vehicle and buy a car so that he could start a taxi business. He's worked at the business for some years and his wife helps because she operates a business making and selling nacatamales (a local dish), food that she prepares with help from their children (who are still in school). Working as a taxi driver is often tough but Don Adolfo works at it day in and day out to earn the money he needs. He will use this loan for car maintenance, a requirement of the utmost importance because he needs the vehicle to operate his business. He will repair the taxi's electrical system so that he can continue to provide a good service.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance for taxi business.

loans.name: Doris Agripina

texts.es:
Doris de 58 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). Ella tiene un local de carnes, comenzó con mucho esfuerzo vendiendo unas libras de carnes, hasta que pudo tener su propio local.

Ella vende carne, pollos, embutidos en su local con la ayuda de sus hijos, desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. Como ha estado trabando desde joven no ha podido revisar su salud durante mucho años, y ahora tiene un problema en la columna, por eso con el préstamo ella quiere el préstamo para poder ir al medico. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Doris, 58, lives in Perimetral, a peripheral zone of Guayaquil (an area where the ecology is being rebuilt). She has a meat shop. She started out working very hard, selling a few pounds of meat, until she was able to own her own store. From early in the morning until sunset, she sells meat, chicken, and sausages in her store with the help of her children. Because she has had to work since she was quite young, she hasn't been able to take care of her health for many years. Now she has a problem with her back. For this reason she is requesting a loan, so she can go see a doctor. Her plan for the future is to continue working on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To see a doctor

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

La señora Luciana,  tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es vender verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, zanahorias, papas, etc. Ella lleva sus productos a las ciudades de Pisaq, Huancalle y Cusco y su actividad económica complementaria es confeccionar chompas, chullos, guantes de lana de alpaca. 

Luciana pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más cereales y lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is about a half hour from Cusco and and hour from Urubamba. The residents of Rayanniyoc make a living through farming and raising cattle. Luciana is 42, married, and has has four children. She makes a living mainly by selling vegetables such as onions, carrots. potatoes etc. She takes her goods to the cities of Pisaq, Huancalle and Cusco. She complements this activity by making sweaters, knit caps and gloves from alpaca wool. Luciana is part of the Arariwa Asociation's Villa Rayanniyoc community bank. She has been a part of the community bank for several years and it has gone well for her since she is responsible and punctual with her payments. She needs this loan to purchase more grain and alpaca wool.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more grain and alpaca wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams, lotions, shampoos

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

La señora Paula tiene 54 años y es soltera. 

Su actividad económica principal vender verduras en los mercados de Casparo y Vino Canchón y su actividad económica complementaria es confeccionar chompas, chalinas, guantes, frazadas y bolsas 

Paula pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas, abono, cereales y lana de alpaca.  

Paula se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The town of Rayanniyoc is located half an hour from Cusco and an hour from Urubamba. The population of Rayanniyoc earn their living through farming and cattle rearing. Paul is 54 years old and single. Most of her income comes from selling vegetables at markets in Casparo and Vino Canchón, and she supplements this income by making jumpers, scarves, gloves, blankets and bags. Paula belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. She has been involved in the communal bank for several years and it is going very well because she is a responsible person who makes her payments on time. She requires the loan to buy more seeds, fertiliser, cereals and alpaca wool. Paula is very grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and is committed to repaying the loan within the required timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertiliser, cereals and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería.

Saturnina, tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores y la venta de hortalizas y verduras. Ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de Wanchaq los días jueves y sábados.   

Saturnina pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales críos como por ejemplo ovejas  que cuestan 150 soles o 180 soles y después los engorda para venderlos en las ferias de las comunidades.  

Saturnina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is found a half hour from the city of Cusco, and an hour away from the city of Urubamba. The residents of the city of Rayanniyoc work in agriculture and livestock production. Saturnina, 50, is married and has 3 children. Her main economic activity is raising small animals and selling vegetables and produce. She takes her products to the city of Cusco to the Wanchaq market each Thursday and Saturday. Saturnina belongs to the communal bank "Villa Rayanniyoc," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She has already participated in this communal bank for a number of years, and it is going very well because she is a responsible person who is punctual with her payments. She needs a loan to buy animals to raise such as sheep, which cost 150 to 180 Peruvian soles. Later she fattens them to sell in the markets in the community. Saturnina is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals to raise, for example, sheep

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc”, tiene 40 años y tiene dos hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de cereales, verduras y hortalizas. Luisa lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de Huancaro los días sábados y al mercado de Wanchaq los días lunes. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como por ejemplo cereales como quinua, tarwi, trigo, etc. Ella vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Los pobladores de la comunidad se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank. She is 40 years old and has two children. Her main economic activity is selling grains and vegetables. Luisa takes her products to the city of Cusco, to the Huancaro market on Saturdays, and to the Wanchaq market on Mondays. She needs the loan to buy more products, for instance grains such as quinua, tarwi [a kind of lupin], wheat, etc. She lives in the community of Rayanniyoc, in Taray district, Calca province, Department of Cusco. The inhabitants of this community raise livestock and work in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products including grains such as quinua, tarwi, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Teresa Marlene

texts.es:
Teresa de 27 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Ella vende productos de uso personal Yambal (empresa que ayuda a mujeres a trabajar con productos por catalogo a un bajo costo). 

Empezó vendiendo productos desde que un familiar de ella le hablo que podía trabajar desde su casa y ganar dinero para que ella pueda pasar con su hijo de tres años, poco a poco ser vendedora le ayudo a mejorar la economía de su hogar. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo productos de uso personal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere comprar una casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Teresa is 27 years old and lives in Paraíso in Guayaquil (a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem). She sells personal use products manufactured by Yambal, a company that creates work opportunities for women by providing them catalog products at a low cost.

She started selling products after talking with a relative because she wanted to work from home and earn money to support her three year old son. Over time, her work as a seller helped her improve her family’s finances.

Teresa wants to use this loan to buy personal use products such as perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants. In the future, she wants to buy a cement house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, and deodorants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire cattle for meat and milk production

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, D. 36 años D. edad, convive con su pareja y fruto D. ellos tienen dos hijos, Jorge y Sofía que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en L. localidad D. Quimbiri, ubicada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, donD. tienen su propia casa. Elena emprendió en un nuevo negocio, que es L. venta D. ropa para  todas L. edades según a los gustos y preferencias D. sus clientes. Nunca espero que le resultara tan rentable este trabajo, tener que caminar y ofrecer sus productos D. puerta en puerta a sus clientes, asimismo realiza promociones a nuevos clientes insatisfechos. En tanto su esposo tiene su propio negocio que es un Bar – Recreo, permitiéndole tener los ingresos necesarios para L. familia, pero Elena aspira a tener su propio negocio, es por ello que mantiene su trabajo y confía que más adelante piensa tener su propia tienda ropas, con el propósito  D. que pueda exhibir su producto. Por lo general trabaja en las localidades D. Quimbiri y San Francisco desD. las 9:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 8:00 D. L. noche, durante L. semana, excepto los domingos que es el día que descansa y pueD. pasar más tiempo con su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera puntual, además, agradece a su grupo comunal por los beneficios que éste le otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en L. compra D. mercadería para que así pueda cumplir con sus compromisos D. entrega hacia sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Elena is 36 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, Jorge and Sofía, who are of school age. Together they resiD. in their own house in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. Elena started a new business selling clothing for all ages according to the likes and preferences of her customers. She never thought this type of work would be so profitable. Elena travels door to door offering her products to her customers, as well as promoting to potential customers who are dissatisfied with what they have. Her husband has his own business operating a bar and recreation center, which allows them to have the necessary income to support their family. However, Elena hopes to have her own business where she can continue to work and establish a clothing store for exhibiting her merchandise. She usually works in the towns of Quimbiri and San Francisco from 9am until 8pm every day except Sunday, which is the day she takes to rest and spend free time with her family.

This is her first loan with MFP. Elena commits to submitting her payments on time. She is grateful to her Communal Bank for the benefits it provides. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise so that she can fulfill her delivery commitments to her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to fulfill her outstanding orders

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La comunidad de Rayanniyoc está ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad Cusco, esta de camino a la ciudad de Pisaq. Los pobladores de la comunidad se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.

La socia Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc”, tiene 30 años y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es la crianza, compra y venta animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Luisa lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de “Huancaro” los días sábados y al mercado de “Cascaparo” los días lunes. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Ella vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
The community of Rayanniyoc is located 30 minutes away from Cusco is on the road going to the city of Pisaq. The residents of this community engage in livestock breeding and agriculture.

Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Villa Rayanniyoc”. She is 30 years old and has four chidren. Her main business activity is raising, buying, and selling small animals such as guinea pigs. Luisa brings her products to the city of Cusco to sell at the Huancaro Market on Saturdays and the Cascaparo Market on Mondays. She needs a loan to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs. Luisa lives in the community of Rayanniyoc in the district of Taray, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Hipólita, tiene 43 años, está casada, tiene dos hijos (Mariluz de de 22 años y Yudith tiene 2 años) y viven en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es vender tarwi en el mercado de Calca los días sábados. Ella siembra y cosecha alimentos principales para el autoconsumo y también para el intercambio a menor medida para la venta. Ella también se dedica a la ganadería como por ejemplo a la crianza de vacas, gallinas, chanchos, etc. Algunos animales sirven para ayudar a la siembra y otros para la alimentación de la familia. Hipólita pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios ciclos que participa y le gusta que le incentiven a ahorrar. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar una vaca que cuesta aproximadamente 850 nuevos soles y el resto del prestamo para sus productos como tarwi.  

(En la fotografía la socia está acompañada de su hija Yudith).
texts.en:
Hipólita is 43 years old, married, and has two children (Mariuz, age 22 and Yudith, age 2). She lives in the community of Rayanniyoc in the district of Taray, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Hipólita’s main business activity is selling tarwi beans at the market in Calca on Saturdays. She also grows and harvests her own food for home consumption and also for bartering and selling. In addition, she raises livestock such as cows, chickens, pigs, etc. Some of the animals are used to help with farming, while the others are used to feed the family. Hipólita belongs to the Communal Bank “Villa Raynniyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has already participated in several loan cycles and enjoys having the incentive to save. Hipólita needs a loan to buy a cow that costs approximately 850 PEN. (In the photograph, Hipólita is accompanied by her daughter Yudith.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La señora Fidelia, tiene 33 años y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Rayanniyoc se encuentra ubicada no menos de media hora de la ciudad del Cusco. Los pobladores de la comunidad se  dedican a la ganadería y a la agricultura siendo estos sus principales fuentes de ingresos económicos. 

Su actividad económica principal de Fidelia es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cría gallinas, cría cuyes y muchos más. Los días sábados lleva a vender sus cuyes a la feria que se implosiva de forma ambulatoria en la avenida del Ejercito de la ciudad del Cusco. Fidelia también se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Rosaspata de la ciudad del Cusco.     

Fidelia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le encanta las actividades que se realiza en cada reunión. Actualmente, Fidelia tiene 14 gallinas y desea aumentar el capital por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar más gallinas de color blanco.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 33 years old, and she has four children. She lives in the Rayanniyoc rural community in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department. Rayanniyoc is one half hour from the city of Cusco. The inhabitants of the community work with livestock and in farming. These are the main sources of income. Fidelia’s main economic activity is raising small animals. For example, she raises chickens, guinea pigs, and a lot more. On Saturday she takes her guinea pigs to sell at the fair. They are sold in an itinerant way on Ejercito Avenue in the city of Cusco. Fidelia also sells vegetables in the Rosaspata market in the city of Cusco. Fidelia belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank of the Arariwa Asociación. She has participated in her communal bank for many years. She really likes the activities at each meeting. Fidelia currently has 14 hens, and she wants to increase her capital. That is why she needs a loan to buy more white hens.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more white hens

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Pualina pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc”, tiene 56 años y tiene  cinco hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de cereales como por ejemplo la quinua, tarwi y también vende hortalizas y verduras.   Ella desde su comunidad campesina lleva los productos a vender a la ciudades de Cusco, Calca y Urubamba. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar papa, tarwi, abono y semillas. 

La socia nos explica como es el procedimientos para obtener papa helada, se extiende la papa en los campos en las noches de heladas y se cubre la papa con paja y se deja caer la helada, este producto solo se hace  en el mes de mayo, junio y julio en al ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Paulina is part of the Villa Rayanniyoc community bank, is 56 and has five children. Her main income comes from selling grains such as quinua and tarwi as well as vegetables. She takes the products from her rural village to the cities of Cusco, Calca and Urubamba. She needs the loan to purchase potato, tarwi, fertilizer and seeds. Our partner explains the process of making "papa helada" [freeze-dried potato] by laying the potatoes in the fields on freezing nights covering it with straw, and allowing it to freeze. In Cusco this product can only be made in May, June and July.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato, tarwi, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios ciclos que participa y le va muy gracias a la responsabilidad y puntualidad de sus pagos. Víctor tiene tres hijos de las cuales Ademir vive a su lado, Saúl y Abel viven a lado de su ex pareja. 

Víctor es un hombre trabajador y responsable que se desempeña como peón en la bloqueteria de la ciudad de Sarahuaylla. Ya son varios años que trabaja por que su jefe confía en su capacidad y su inteligencia. Víctor también tiene una pequeña chacra en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc donde siembra y cosecha.  

Víctor requiere el préstamo para comprar animales críos que comprará de la feria de combapata y Inquilpata para hacerlos engordar y después venderlos en las mismas ferias.
texts.en:
Víctor belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Cusco. He has already had several loans from this field partner, which have had good results thanks to his sense of responsibility and his punctuality in making payments. Víctor has three children. Ademir lives close by, while Saúl and Abel live near his former partner. Víctor is a responsible and hardworking person, who pays his debts by working as a labourer in a concrete block factory in the town of Sarahuaylla. He has worked for several years in this job, since his boss trusts in his ability and intelligence. Víctor also has a small plot of land in the rural community of Rayanniyoc where he sows and harvests crops. Víctor needs the loan to buy young livestock at the markets held in Combapata and Inquilpata, which he will fatten and later sell at the same markets.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young livestock

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Miguel L. S., tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la de un equipo para soldadura. Desea comprar herramientas y máquinas para trabajar en soldadura.Cuenta con experiencia en el trabajo, sabe utilizar adecuadamente las herramientas y la maquinaria. El desea ser más eficiente en su trabajo, cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de actualizar su herramientas de trabajo para desempeñarse de la mejor manera con su trabajo, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como trabajador.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel L. S., age 20, is single and lives with his parents. He wants this loan for welder's equipment. He wants to buy tools and machines to work as a welder. He has experience in this work, and knows how to properly use the tools and the machinery. He wants to be more efficient in his work. He has very good customers, so he sees the necessity to upgrade his work tools to do the best job, and also to earn better income for his household. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the opportunities they offer him. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue to grow as a person and as a worker.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: welding equipment

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, tiene 33 años,  es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Angélica participa en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa y su primer crédito fue de 100 dólares que utilizo para incrementar su negocio. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de chanchos y cuyes en la feria de Inquilpata en la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Ella también se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y lleva sus productos a vender a los mercados de las ciudades de Calca y Cusco.  

Angélica requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 cuyes y una vaca y también comprará abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Angélica, age 33, is a responsible and hard-working woman who lives in the rural community of Rayanniyoc, in the Taray district, Caldca province, in the Cusco department. She has three children. Currently, Angelica is a member of the Asociacion Arariwa "Villa Rayanniyoc" community bank. Her first loan was 100 dollars which she used to expand her business. Her main activity is the sale of pigs and guinea pigs in the Inquilpata market, in the Anta province of the Cusco department. She also sells vegetables and brings her products for sale in the markets of the cities of Calca and Cusco. Angelica needs this loan to purchase 20 guinea pigs and a cow, and also to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase 20 guinea pigs and a cow, and also fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 47 años y tiene un hijo.   Yo vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc de la distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  

La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en llevar y vender verduras en los mercados de  la ciudad del Cusco como por ejemplo a Huancaro, Wanchaq, etc. Mi segunda actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos, ovejas,  etc. Al principio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar y así mejorar nuestros negocios. Ya son varios años que participo en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” y mis compañeras confían en mi responsabilidad y puntualidad de mis pagos por ese motivo requiero el crédito para aumentar el capital de mi negocio y deseo comprar más cereales como por ejemplo tarwi, quinua, maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Catalina is 47 and has one child. I live in the rural community of Rayanniyoc, in the Taray district of the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. The majority of the villagers work in agriculture and ranching. I have a small business which consists of growing and selling vegetables in the markets of the city of Cusco, such as Huancaro and Wanchaq, etc. My second activity is the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, sheep etc. In the beginning it was a bit difficult since I did not have much capital, and then I was given the opportunity to belong to the Arariwa community bank, which offered us support with loans. This way many of us were able to start and improve our businesses. For several years I have participated in the "Villa Rayanniyoc" community bank and my peers trust my responsibility and punctuality of my payments. For this reason I request this loan to increase my business' capital. I want to buy more grains such as tarwi, quinoa, corn, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more grains such as tarwi, quinoa, corn, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ready made items

loans.name: Ángel Horacio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Ángel Horacio O. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
