This is the first loan that they have taken from the Cooperativa San José. Maria is a housewife. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs. Her dream is that her business is successful. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en: Joselita has owned a Brazilian clothing store for more than five years. She is well known in the Brazilian community and has a good client base. Her son speaks English very well and has helped her improve her business. He assisted her in working with ACCION USA to get a loan. This will be Joselita’s third loan with ACCION USA. Her previous two loans had an almost perfect repayment history. She qualified for her third loan to buy more inventory for the summer and refinance her previous loan. Her store mainly sells dresses, shirts, jeans, shoes and perfumes. Joselita hopes that during the summer months her sales will increase and she wants to have enough products to meet the demand. Her busiest months have always been during the summer and around the holidays. ACCION USA’s loans have helped Joselita tremendously in growing her business. Since her first loan in 2007, Joselita has consistently expanded her inventory and clientele. She has always imported most of her products directly from Brazil, which is very appealing to her customers. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and proviD. employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more inventory: shoes, shirts, jeans and perfumes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda C. G. tiene 43 años. Vive soltera con sus 2 hijos, Eduardo y Génesis, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Yolanda es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Yolanda trabaja en el negocio de panadería. Hace las compras en Bucay semanalmente. 
Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio de panadería. Su sueño es prosperar en su negocio. 

Le gusta escuchar música en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Yolanda C. G. is 43 years old. She lives on her own with her two children, Eduardo and Génesis, in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar province. Yolanda is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa," which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 18 members in all, and the majority of them have their own businesses. This is the first loan that they have taken from the Cooperativa San José. Yolanda works in a bakery. She makes purchases in Bucay twice a month. She is requesting this loan to increase her bakery's business. Her dream is to have a successful business. In her free time, Yolanda likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her bakery business

loans.name: Laura Dalila

texts.es:
Laura Dalila D. Q. tiene 26 años.  Es  soltera y vive con su hija, Emily de 9 meses, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Laura es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Laura se dedica a la venta de comida: tiene un restaurante propio. Hace las compras cada día en el comisariato El Ahorro de Bucay

Solicita el préstamo para ampliar su restaurante e invertir en mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es  que su negocio crezca cada día más y llegar a hacer una gran empresaria con éxito. Enfrenta desafíos para mejorar el negocio y ser mejor que la competencia. 

Quisiera agradecer la Cooperativa San Jose por ayudarles con los créditos, para mejorar sus negocios y cumplir sus sueños de tener sus negocios propios.
texts.en:
Laura Dalila D. Q. is 26 years old. She is single and lives with her daughter Emily, who is 9 months old, in the Chillanes canton of Bolivar province. Laura is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa," which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 18 members in all, and the majority of them have their own businesses. This is the first loan that they have taken from the Cooperativa San José. Laura sells food; she has her own restaurant. She makes purchases every day in the "El Ahorro de Bucay" cooperative store. She requests a loan to expand her restaurant and invest in merchandise for her business. Her dream is to see her business grow each day, and to become a successful businesswoman. Laura would like to thank the Cooperativa San Jose for their support with the loans, so that her group can improve their businesses and accomplish their dreams of having their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand her restaurant and invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 40 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en su haber, Ángel y Patricia de 9 y 3 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva, a pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir. Hace mas de 5 años trabaja de forma independiente, desde entonces vende ropa para el público en general, y considera que este trabajo lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron, pues gracias a la clave de su éxito, que es la calidad y el precio de sus productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo, siendo su punto de venta en el mercado de su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar, es por ello que piensa tener su propia tienda en la avenida principal de su localidad, con la finalidad de vender toda variedad de ropa, según lo gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su decimoquinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además reconoce que pertenecer al grupo comunal, le esta dando muchas ventajas.Con el crédito que solicita,  piensa invertir en adquirir mayor cantidad de ropa de última generación, con la finalidad de estar a la par con la modernidad y el estilo cambiante de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children, Angel and Patricia, 9 and 3, respectively. They live together in the community of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house. María is described as being a woman of character and very competitive. Despite mishaps a long the way, she has been able to overcome. She has been working independently for more than five years and during that time she has been selling clothes to the general public. She believes that this job is benifitting her in a positive way. Her sales have increased, thanks to the quality and price of her products. Usually, she works on her own, but at times, her son helps her. Her point of sale is in the market of the same community. She is aware that she a lot more to acheive. That is why she is planning on having her own store on the main avenue of her town. The idea is to have every type of clothing, according to the tastes and preferences of her customers. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She also recognizes that belonging to the communal group is giving her a lot of advantages. With the loan that she is asking for, she plans on investing in a larger quantity of the lastest clothing, in order to be up to date with the changing styles of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing with modern designs

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Vicentina;  ella tiene 51 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 16 años de edad; la socia se dedica a comercio minorista ella compra al por mayor yeso y vende en su casa, La socia vende yeso para los tarrajeos de las casas y los acabados finales,  La socia es jubilada ella es docente de profesión. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra al por mayor yeso para los tarrajeos y acabados de las casas. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Vicentina belongs to the communal bank "Arcangel Gabriel." She lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. Vicentina is 51 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 25 and 16. She works in retail trade, buying plaster at wholesale and selling it from her house. She sells material that is used to plaster the walls of homes and provide finishing touches to the home. She is a retired teacher. She is requesting this loan to buy more plaster at wholesale. Vicentina appreciates and is infinitely thankful for the loan that was granted, which will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She pledges to make each of her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plaster at wholesale to sell at retail

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, tiene la edad de 62 años, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio un salón de belleza, con ayuda de sus hijos que están en el extranjero los cuales aun aportan con remesas.
La iniciativa comienza para lograr mejores condiciones en su vida, además ya cuenta con más edad, lo que se le hace difícil, poder trabajar
Ala empresa privada. 
 Contenta por que a través de sus trabajos ha logrado captar sus clientes, también da trabajos  a dos jóvenes que son auxiliar y trabajan juntas, ya que hay día que el salón esta lleno.
Con el financiamiento logro pintar unos cuartos que alquila que son otras entradas para lograr pagar los gastos básicos.
Con este préstamo cambiara el techo que esta viejo y quiere mejorar esta condición por que cada que llueve se le pasa el agua.
Para esto comprara zinc nuevo, perlines, golosos, pintura de aceite para pintar los perlines, cener entre otos productos para mejorar el techo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a very hardworking woman. She is 62 years old. Several years ago she opened her own beauty salon, with the help of her children who live abroad and send remittances to her. She would like to make some improvements in her home because she is older, which makes it difficult to work in her business. She is happy because through her work she has secured her clients. She also provides work for two young people who help out and work together because there are days when the salon is full. With this loan she will paint some rooms that she rents out for additional income, which she uses to pay basic expenses. With this loan she will also change the roof, which is old, because every time it rains, water gets in. She will buy new tin roofing, metal beams, bolts, paint for the beams and bolts, and other products for improving the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New tin roofing, metal beams, bolts, paint for the beams and bolts, and other products for improving the roof of her house

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Alcira;  ella tiene 40 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, La socia está en el rubro da la construcción, ella es profesora de profesión en el distrito de Huarocondo en la provincia de Anta, desde el año 2001, La socia alternando su trabajo ella trabaja junto a su hermana en el área de construcción, ella también vende yeso. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería y aumentar sus ingresos. 
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Alcira is a member of the loan group “ARCANGEL GABRIEL” and lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province, Cusco departent. Alcira is 40 years old, married with a child. She works in the construction sector as has been a vocational teacher in the Huarocondo district in the Anta province since 2001. On top of this she also works with her sister selling plaster for construction purposes. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock and improve her income. This member is extremely grateful for the loan because it will enable her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She is commiitted to paying the loan back in the stipulated term.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plaster to increase her stock.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Nilda;  ella tiene 39 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de  7 años y el otro de 9 meses;  La socia es docente de profesión en el colegio Abraham Lincon; ella enseña a la primaria, La socia desea el préstamo para poder hacer pago de una mensualidad de su hijo en el colegio, esto debido a que ella designo por urgencia su sueldo de este mes en la compra de medicamentos para los bronquios de su menor hijo. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar una mensualidad e su menor hijo en el colegio. 
 
La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Arcangel Gabriel” Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac district of Cusco province, in the Cusco region of Peru.
39-year-old Nilda lives with her partner and 2 children, aged 7 and 9 months. Nilda works as a teacher at the Abraham Lincoln School; she is a primary school teacher.
Nilda is requesting this loan to pay for her son’s monthly school fees because she has had to put her salary towards paying for her younger son’s bronchial medication.
Nilda appreciates this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her son's monthly school fees

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis F. Sandí, tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 10 y 6  años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Luis F. Sandí is 36 years old and married. He has two children, and they are his greatest priority. They are ten and six years old. He wants the loan to buy some calves and feed for them. He wants to give the cattle adequate maintenance in order to get the greatest possible income when he sells them. He wishes to increase the number of animals he has, and he wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has the ideal area for keeping and raising the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan. José has worked with cattle for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic security. He wants to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Sergio Roger

texts.es:
Sergio es un joven de 26 años de edad, casado, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua Jocote Dulce.
Aun vive en la casa de sus padres, pero ya tiene el comienzo de su pequeña casa que no ha continuado la construcción por falta de dinero ya que los ahorro que tenia proveniente de su trabajo como operador de Enacal. Los gasto todo para lograr el comienzo de su casa.
A través de este financiamiento lograra la culminación de paredes, para avanzar más y seguir poco a poco ya que todo esta a altos costos y se es difícil construir de un solo.
Comprara piedra, arena, cemento, tablas para seguir esta obra.
Y poder en futuro estar en su propia casa. Lo que es para el de gran beneficio este medio de financiamiento que hará posible su objetivo.
texts.en:
Serio is a 26 year old young man, and he is married. He lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua Jocote Dulce. He still lives in his parents’ house, but he has already started a small house. He has not continued the construction because he does not have the money. He used all of his saving from his job as an operator for Enacal to start his house. With this loan he will finish the walls to make more progress and continue little by little. Everything is expensive, and it is difficult to build it alone. He will buy rocks, sand, cement, and boards to continue this work. In the future he will be able to be in his own house. This loan is of great benefit to him and will make it possible to achieve his objective.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement and boards to finish the walls of his house

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Luz Marina;  ella tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y es estudiante de enfermería, La socia tiene planes de terminar su carrera y ponerse a trabajar para ganar experiencia y después poner su propia botica, ella dice que después de todo esto ya decidirán tener un hijo con su conyugue, La socia está muy entusiasmada en terminar su carrera. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar sus estudios de enfermería. 
 
La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, el cual le permitirá seguir estudiando, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, “Arcangel Gabriel,” or Archangel Gabriel. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco. The member is Luz Marina; she is 27-years-old and is married and is a nursing student. She plans to finish her degree and go to work to gain experience. Afterward, she would like to open her own pharmacy. She says that after all of this she may decide to have a child with her husband. She is very excited to finish her degree. She is requesting the loan to pay for her nursing studies. As a member, she values and is thankful for the loan offered through this medium which will allow her to continue studying. She commits to make the payments in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her studies.

loans.name: Felipe Hernaldo

texts.es:
Don Felipe es padre de familia de dos hijos, es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor de su propio negocio.
Una vulcanización con muchos años de experiencia pues ha hecho su medio de ingreso. Los trabajos hay semanas que están bajos y que apenas logra sacar el diario para la alimentación de su familia, a como hay días buenos.
Los planes que tiene es lograr comprar un engrasador, y comprar aceite de vehiculo para lograr vender y a si poder ayudarse y equilibrarse ya que la situación económica es critica.
A través de estos financiamientos a futuro espera hacer el local del negocio de concreto ya que es de madera y zinc, para tener mejor seguridad de sus piezas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felipe has two children. He is a hard-working and enterprising man with his own business. A tire repair business with many years of experience has been his form of income. There are weeks when there is little work, and he is barely able to feed his family everyday. There are also good days. The plan that he has is to buy a grease gun and automotive oil to sell. That way he will be able to help himself. He will also be able to stabilize his current critical economic situation. He hopes that by using these loans in the future he will make his business location from concrete. It is now made of wood and zinc, and he wants to have greater security for the items that he works on.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a grease gun and automotive oil to increase sales and stabilize his economic situation

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, D. 29 años, es viuda y tiene una hija. Juntas residen en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en L. localidad D. Quimbiri, donD. tienen su propia casa. María es una persona estratégica cuando se lo propone, desD. luego, que inició con una pequeña tienda, como todo primer negocio, tuvo sus primeras caídas, pero supo salir adelante. Es así que su tienda empezó a crecer D. manera ostentosa, asimismo abrió una fuente D. soda, todo ello con L. finalidad ganar a L. competencia y por enD. le genera ingresos extras. A pesar D. que tiene mucha demanda, por L. buena atención que lo ofrece hacia sus clientes, elL. aspira ampliar su negocio, insertando nuevos productos que estén al alcance D. sus clientes, así como tener un espacio propio para su fuente D. soda. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. su hija. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además esta conforme con su grupo comunal por L. transparencia y honestidad  a L. hora D. tomar decisiones. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en L. compra D. productos para abastecer su tienda y poder cumplir con L. demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 29 years old. She is a widow, and she has a daughter. Together they resiD. in their own house in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. María is a determined person when she sets her mind on something. After a while she started a small store. Like all first businesses, she had her defeats, but she knew how to get ahead. Her store started to grow a lot. She also opened a soda fountain. She did this to beat the competition and generate extra income. In spite of having a lot of demand because of the good service she offers her customers, she wants to expand her business. She wants to carry new products for her customers, and she wants the soda fountain to have its own space. She generally works by herself, but her daughter occasionally helps her. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she pledges to continue making her payments on time. Also, she is satisfied with her communal bank because of their transparency and honesty when making decisions. She will use the requested loan to buy products to stock her store and be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es soltera y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 estudia, vive en casa alquilada, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Gloria vende comida por las tardes de manera ambulatoria en la Av. Arenales.
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y solicita un crédito de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gloria son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is single and has five children, of whom only one is studying. She lives in a rented house. Gloria has a stall in the market where she sells general grocery items every day. Additionally, Gloria sells food in the afternoons as a mobile seller in the Avenue Arenales. Gloria is a member of the “Banco Comunal Lirio,” or the Iris Community Bank, and is requesting a loan of 1600 soles. The money will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Gloria's dream is to buy a piece of land in order to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Bicycle Parts (tires, intertubes, manifolds, locks, aluminum brake handles)

loans.name: Anastasio

texts.es:
El señor Anastasio tiene  33 años y tiene tres hijos.  Anastasio trabaja como porteador,  es el de llevar durante todo el viaje del camino Inca al Santuario de Machupicchu el equipaje del grupo ( carpas , cocina , utensilios , guía , alimentación , equipo , sillas , mesas , etc.). 
El recorrido se hace durante cuatro noches y tres días, él carga aproximadamente 20 kilos de carga y 5 kilos de carga personal. Muy temprano por la mañana sale de su casa para dirigirse al kilómetro 82 donde se encontrara con el equipo profesional de viaje. Para luego dar inicio a la caminata. El primer día llegará al complejo arqueológico de llactapata, lugar donde almorzará para luego continuar hasta el primer campamento en Wayllabamba en donde pasaran la noche después de una reparadora cena. El segundo día después de desayunar darán inicio a la parte más difícil de la caminata pero no imposible, en donde caminaran hacia el punto más alto del Camino que esta aprox. a 4,200 m.s.n.m. Después almorzarán para luego continuar descendiendo hasta llegar a Pacaymayo en donde cenarán y pasarán la noche. El tercer día después de desayunar empezaran a caminar hasta ascender  al complejo arqueológico de Runkarakay y al complejo arqueológico de Puyupatamarca, donde almorzarán, después de un breve descanso continuaremos con la caminata hasta llegar al último campamento Wiñay Huayna (siempre joven) y cenarán y pasaran la última noche. Cuatro día después de desayunar, continuaran con la caminata muy temprano para llegar a Machupichu. 
Anastasio pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la asociación Arariwa y requiere el préstamo para implementar su casa.
texts.en:
Anastasio is 33-years-old and has three children. Anastasio works as a porter, carrying luggage on the Incan Trail to the Machu Picchu Sanctuary for groups (tents, kitchen utensils, guide, food, equipment, chairs, tables, etc.)... The tour is for four nights and three days, he carries approximately 20 kilos of cargo and five kilos of personal items. He leaves his house very early in the morning to go to kilometer 82 where he meets with the professional team for the trip. Then they begin the walk. The first day they arrive at the Llactapata archaeological complex, the place where they eat lunch before continuing to the first campsite in Wayllabamba where they pass the night after a refreshing dinner. The second day, after breakfast, they begin the most difficult (but not impossible) part of the walk where they walk to the highest point of the trail that is approximately 4200 meters above sea level. After lunch, they continue descending until they arrive in Pacaymayo where they eat dinner and pass the night. The third day, after breakfast, they begin to ascend toward the Runkarakay and Puyupatamarca archaeological complexes where they eat lunch. After a brief rest, they continue walking to the final campsite, Winay Huayna (Always Young) and eat dinner and pass the final night. On the fourth day, after breakfast, they continue walking early in the morning to arrive in Machu Picchu. Anastasio belongs to the communal bank “Villa Rayanniyoc” of the Arariwa association and he needs the loan to build his home.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Gregoria tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Nazarenas en donde vende jugos que ella prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 dela mañana, Gregoria también tiene otro puesto en donde vende frutas surtidas. Gregoria y su esposo tienen equipos de sonido que alquilan para diferentes compromisos y eventos.
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licuadora y extractor para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
Los sueños de Gregoria son construir su casa de material noble, porque tiene una casa de material rustico y que su hija sea una cantante profesional.
texts.en:
Gregoria is married and has five children, four of whom are students. She has a stall in Las Nazarenas market where she sells homemade juices from 6am to 11am every morning. She also has another stall where she sells different sorts of fruit. Gregoria and her husband also own sound equipment which they rent out for celebrations and events. She is a member of the Lirio Community Bank and is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to buy a blender and a juice extractor to improve the quality of her products. Her dream is to build a house made of decent material (her current one is a rudimentary structure), and see her daughter become a professional singer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a blender and a juice extractor

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio.
Prudencia es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella en una casa alquilada, Prudencia tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días, hace algunos años viajaba a las ferias a comprar la carne, dejo de realizar los viajes porque no tiene ninguna ayuda.
Prudencia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne.
Los sueños de Prudencia son salir adelante y comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Prudencia is a member of the Lirio Community Bank. She is a single mother and has two children who live with her in a rented house. She has a stall in the Magdalena market where she sells meat on a daily basis. She used to travel to markets to buy the meat but she stopped several years ago as she had no one to assist her. Prudencia needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy meat. Her dream is to get ahead in life and to buy a piece of land on which to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es casada, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella y estudian, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, animales menores, que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también de casa en casa, en algunas oportunidades cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de gallina, chancho y cereales.
Maria sueña con construir mas ambientes en su casa  y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has seven children, six of whom live with her and are students. She travels around to different markets in the area to buy cereals and young animals which she then sells in the Ayacucho markets as well as door-to-door. Sometimes her husband helps her. Maria is a member of the Lirio Community Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy chickens, pork, and cereals. Her dreams are to build more rooms on to her house and to see her children get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, pork and cereals

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 23 años y tiene dos hijos. Yo vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc de la distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  

La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en vender ganado como por ejemplo vacas y toros y también me dedico a la crianza  de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Yo compro animales críos en la ferias agropecuarios de las ciudad Combapata y Inquilpata, después los alimento los hace engoradar para luego venderlos en las mismas ferias. Al principio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar y así mejorar nuestros negocios. Ya son varios años que participo en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” y mis compañeras confían en mi responsabilidad y puntualidad de mis pagos por ese motivo requiero el crédito para aumentar el capital de mi negocio y deseo comprar más animales críos.
texts.en:
Sofia is 23 years old, and she has two children. She lives in the Rayanniyoc rural community in the Taray district, Calca province, Cusco department. Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock. She has a small business, which consists of selling livestock like cows and bull. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She buys the baby animals in the agricultural fairs in the cities of Combapata and Inquilpata. Then, she feeds them to fatten them in order to later sell them at the same fairs. In the beginning, it was a little difficult for her because she did not have much capital. Then the opportunity presented itself to belong to the Arariwa communal bank. It offered support with loans, and many of the members could start and improve their businesses. She has participated in the Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank for several years. Her colleagues have faith in her responsibility and the punctuality of her payments. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business. She wishes to buy more baby animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby animals

loans.name: Sussy Liliana

texts.es:
Sussy es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Sussy viaja a las diferentes ferias de la region en donde vende helados y chupetes, que ella misma prepara en su casa con la ayuda de su esposo, actividad que realiza todos los días y de las ferias compra cereales que luego comercializa en el mercado.
Sussy pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones, Sussy solicita un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra de palitos, colorantes y esencias.
El sueño de Sussy es implementar su heladería con una maquina heladera.
texts.en:
Sussy is married and has two children that are in school. Sussy travels to different fairs in the area where she sells ice cream and lollipops that she prepares in her home with the help of her husband. She does this every day and at the fairs she buys grains that she later sells en the market. Sussy belongs to the “Banco Comunal Lirio” (Iris Community Bank) and what she likes about it most are the trainings. Sussy is requesting a loan of 800 soles for the purchase of sticks, colorings, and flavorings. Sussy's dream is to open an ice cream shop with a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sticks, coloring, and flavors.

loans.name: Ynocencio

texts.es:
Ynocencio tiene 51 años es casado y tiene tres hijos, él vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc donde los mayoría de los pobladores son agricultores y ganaderos. Ynocencio tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en llevar, distribuir y vender verduras a las vendedoras del  mercado San Pedro de la Ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ynocencio requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

(En la fotografía el Sr. Ynocencio está acompañado de su hijo Daniel que tiene 7 años de edad).
texts.en:
Ynocencio is 51-years-old, married, and has three beautiful children. He lives in the community of Rayanniyoc where the majority of the residents are farmers and ranchers. Ynocencio has a small family business that carries, distributes, and sells vegetables to the vendors in the San Pedro de la Ciudad de Cusco market (Saint Peter of the City of Cusco). Now he has worked in this business for 15 years and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Ynocencio needs this loan to build his house. (In the photo, Ynocencio is accompanied by his son Daniel who is seven-years-old.)

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ynocencio needs the loan to build his house.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es: Silvestre C. G. es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo en cual le dieron una plaza de Jefe de sucursal en una empresa de refrescos, que se encuentra en esta ciudad por  lo que tuvo que cambiar de residencia. Para poder vivir cómodamente el adquirió una vivienda de interés social por lo que quiere ponerle protecciones para ofrecer a su familia una mejor seguridad. La esposa del señor C. aun sigue radicando en la otra ciudad ya que tiene que esperar que sus hijos terminen su ciclo escolar y así vivir juntos.
texts.en:
Silvestre C. G. is a gentleman who is so dedicated to his work that he was offered a position as branch manager for a soft drink company. Since his new job is located in the city, he had to change residences. In order to live comfortably, he acquired a home through a government subsidy program. Now he wants to install protection so that his family will have better security.

Sr. C.’s wife still lives at their old location while she waits for their children to finish the school year. After that, they will be able to live together.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security for his new home

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro y L. enseñanza D. valores.
Andrea es casada y tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con elL. y están estudiando, Andrea tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, leña, también condimentos que elL. misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además los días lunes venD. mazamorras en L. feria D. las Nazarenas.
Andrea necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que invertirá en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y jabones.
Andrea sueña con comprar un carro para viajar a las ferias y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). What she enjoys most about her group is that they encourage her to save and teach her values.

Andrea is married and has eight children, three of whom live with her and are enrolled in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, firewood, and condiments that she prepares herself. Her business is open every day. In addition, she sells “mazamorra” (corn porridge) at the Nazarene Fair on Mondays.

Andrea needs a loan of 1800 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and soap. She dreams of making improvements to her home and buying a car so that she can travel to the fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and soap

loans.name: Patricia Pilar

texts.es:
Patricia es conviviente y tiene un hijo que estudia, Patricia vive en la casa de sus padres y su mayor sueño es construir su casa, Patricia tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, condimentos que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Además Patricia trabaja en una empresa de transportes como administradora.
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz y aceite.
texts.en:
Patricia is in a common law marriage and has a son who is in school. She lives in the home of her parents and her greatest wish is to build a house of her own. Patricia has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, and condiments that she prepares herself. Her business is open every day from 6am until 10pm. In addition, Patricia works at a transportation company as an administrator.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris) and needs a loan of 2600 PEN to invest in the purchase of milk, sugar, rice, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
El señor Cayetano tiene  38 años y tiene tres hijos.  Cayetano trabaja como porteador, es el de llevar durante todo el viaje del camino Inca al Santuario de Machupicchu el equipaje del grupo (carpas, cocina, utensilios, guía, alimentación, equipo, sillas, mesas, etc.). El pertenece a la Asociación de porteadores de Rayanniyoc. 
El recorrido se hace durante cuatro noches y tres días, él carga aproximadamente 20 kilos de carga y 5 kilos de carga personal y le pagan aproximadamente 170 soles por viaje, el realiza de cuatro a tres viajes durante el mes. 
Cayetano muy temprano por la mañana sale de su casa para dirigirse al kilómetro 82 donde se encontrara con el equipo profesional de viaje. Para luego dar inicio a la caminata. El primer día llegará al complejo arqueológico de llactapata, lugar donde almorzará para luego continuar hasta el primer campamento en Wayllabamba en donde pasaran la noche después de una reparadora cena. El segundo día después de desayunar darán inicio a la parte más difícil de la caminata pero no imposible, en donde caminaran hacia el punto más alto del Camino que esta aprox. a 4,200 m.s.n.m. Después almorzarán para luego continuar descendiendo hasta llegar a Pacaymayo en donde cenarán y pasarán la noche. El tercer día después de desayunar empezaran a caminar hasta ascender  al complejo arqueológico de Runkarakay y al complejo arqueológico de Puyupatamarca, donde almorzarán, después de un breve descanso continuaremos con la caminata hasta llegar al último campamento Wiñay Huayna (siempre joven) y cenarán y pasaran la última noche. Cuatro día después de desayunar, continuaran con la caminata muy temprano para llegar a Machupichu. 
Cayetano pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la asociación Arariwa y requiere el préstamo para implementar su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Cayetano is 38 years old and has three children. He works as a porter who is responsible for transporting necessities (tents, kitchen utensils, guide books, food, equipment, chairs, tables, etc.) used for group hiking trips to the Incan sanctuary of Machu Picchu. Cayetano belongs to the Rayannioc Association of Porters.

The hiking tour lasts four nights and three days. Cayetano is in charge of approximately 20kg of cargo and can bring 5kg worth of personal belongings. He is paid approximately 170 PEN for each trip and is assigned to work 3-4 trips per month.

Cayetano leaves his house early in the morning to travel 82km to meet up with the professional travel team. From there they begin the hike. On the first day, the group arrives at the archaeological site of Llactapata to have lunch. Afterwards they continue to the first camp at Wayllabamba and spend the night after having a filling dinner. The second day of the hike begins after breakfast and consists of the most difficult part of the trip. Hikers must walk to the highest point of the trail, which is 4200 meters above sea level. After having lunch, they descend to Pacaymayo where they eat dinner and spend the night. The third day, after breakfast, begins with a hike that ascends to the archaeological sites of Runkarakay and Puyupatamarca. There they have a brief lunch and continue to the last campsite at Wiñay Huayna (which means “Forever Young”) where they have dinner and spend the final night. The following morning begins with an early breakfast before proceeding on to Macchu Pichu.

Cayetano belongs to the Communal Bank “Villa Rayanniyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He needs a loan in order to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La señora Sara M. L. desde hace  8 años se dedica a la venta de pan que ella elabora, tiene variedad  como lo son las empanadas de calabaza y panques esto lo distribuye entres sus amistades, mini súper, misceláneas y tiendas de abarrotes a un bajo precio de acuerdo a la situación económica de sus compradores. Sara es una mujer emprendedora pero para poder comprar la materia prima ella necesita tener capital y así crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
For the past eight years, Sra. Sara M. L. has been selling baked goods that she produces herself. She makes a variety of products ranging from pumpkin turnovers to cupcakes and distributes them among her friends, mini-supermarkets, and grocery stores at a low price depending on the financial situation of her buyers. Sara is an enterprising woman, but she needs capital in order to buy ingredients and eventually grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio y durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser responsable, puntual y a ahorrar.
Honorata tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, gaseosas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. eventual D. su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
Honorata espera solucionar sus problemas familiares.
texts.en:
Honorata is part of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris). During her time as a member she has learned how to be responsible, punctual, and a diligent saver.

Honorata has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and soft drinks. Her business is open every day and she has the occasional help of her husband. This loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

Honorata hopes to resolve her family problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, and oil

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: Severo U. R. se dedica a la reparación de lavadoras y refrigeradores profesión que realiza desde hace 8 años. Este ingreso que percibe es para sostener los gastos de su familia, solo que en este momento el no cuenta con un automóvil para dar mejor servicio a su negocio es por ello que el desea comprar una camioneta para no tener que pedir a otra gente que le preste un carro para llevar alguna maquina descompuesta. En este momento una persona le esta ofreciendo una camioneta a un bajo precio; por lo que el quiere aprovechar la oferta para no tener que dar molestias.
texts.en:
Severo U. R. has been repairing washing machines and refrigerators for the past eight years. The income he earns goes toward covering his family’s expenses. At the moment, he does not have a vehicle that will allow his business to provide better service. For this reason, he is would like to buy a truck because he has to ask other people if he can borrower their vehicle for transporting broken machines.

At the moment he has one person who is offering him a truck at a low price, so he wants to take advantage of this offer so that he does not have to bother anybody.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a truck for his repair business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 37 años y es soltera. Yo vivo en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, yo cuento con una pequeña sastrería, el cual consiste en arreglar pantalones, faldas, camisas y muchas cosas más. Ya son varios años que participo en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” y mis compañeras confían en mi responsabilidad y puntualidad de mis pagos por ese motivo requiero el crédito para comprar una máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Teodora is 37 years old and single. She lives in the rural community of Rayanniyoc in the district of Taray, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Most of the residents engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Teodora has a small tailoring shop where she mends trousers, skirts, shirts, and other articles of clothing. For several years, she has been part of the Communal Bank “Villa Rayanniyoc” and her fellow group members rely on her to be responsible and prompt with her payments. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Delia tiene  una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada hasta la noche, cuenta en algunas oportunidades con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, leche, bebidas.
Delia sueña con construir su casa de material noble pues ahora vive en una casa de material rustico y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Delia is married and has two children who are in school. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and beverages. Her business is open every day from dawn until nightfall. On a few occasions, her children help her with running the business.

Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Lirio” (Iris) and requests a loan for 1000 PEN to be invested in the purchase of rice, milk, and beverages. She dreams of building a house made of solid materials since her current home is comprised of basic components. In addition, she hopes to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Carugmanan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 40 years old. Virginia is married and has four school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is now requesting her fourth loan from HSPFI, for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mr. Saroem R. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokhem Kong, is 29 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter. The family lives along National Road No. 5, approximately 20 kilometers from the capital city of Cambodia, Phnom Penh. Saroem was not in the photo; instead, his wife is shown.

Saroem has been operating a motorbike-washing business in his village since 2007. His wife assists her husband in the business. He is a fisherman as well.

Saroem is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to build a shelter where he will operate his motorbike washing and cleaning business.

loans.use: To build a place where he can operate his washing and cleaning motorbike business.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun U., age 31 and his wife, Mrs. Sophois Dam,age 28,(pictured together) have been married since 1998 and have one daughter who is attending school. They live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Saroeun and his wife are garment factory workers. He wants to build a concrete brick room and organize and fix the house where he lives, but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $800 to use for his purpose.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room and organize and fix the house where he lives.

Cheda has asked for a Kiva loan through Maxima once before and she used the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She now is applying for her second loan in the amount of $500 to purchase additional silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 34-year-old taxi driver. He transports local passengers (teachers, tailors, night guards, etc.) from his town to their destinations. He has been in this business for just two months and his biggest business challenge is security since people can pose as clients and turn out to be thieves.

He is married and has three children, two boys and a girl who range from 9 months to 9 years old.  In addition to his taxi business, Samuel and his wife generate income by selling repair parts for bicycles.  Before having his car, he had a motorcycle taxi business.

Samuel plans to use the 70,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase car parts to upgrade his new taxi. He has successfully repaid two previous loans of 20,000 and 50,000 Shillings.

In the future, he hopes to have a successful car business and own a large fleet of vehicles so that he can take care of his family and educate all his children.  In five years, he dreams of having a car-rental business with his own fleet of cars.  He is also considering opening a poultry-selling business.

Samuel describes himself as very hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To purchase car parts to upgrade his taxi

loans.name: Teofisto

texts.en:
Teofisto B., from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 48 years old and single. To make a living, Teofisto owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teofisto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Teofisto''s fourth loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store. loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is a 28-year-old motorbike taxi driver, using his motorcycle to transport passengers to various destinations around town. He has been in business for a year and has one employee. The primary business challenges he faces are the risk of accidents and many competitors. In addition to his motorbike taxi business, he has a second job as a butcher.

Nahashon is married and has a son 5 years old and a daughter 1 year old.

Nahashon plans to use the 20,000 Kenya shilling loan to purchase another motorbike. He is hoping to expand his business to achieve a better living standard. In five years, he sees himself purchasing a vehicle for his business.

Nahashon describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Esterlita

Esterlita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling mango shake in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 32-year-old woman who owns a business that makes metal window frames. She has one employee and her biggest business challenge is local competitors.

Jane is married and has a daughter who is 2 years old. Her husband is self-employed. 

Jane plans to use the 40,000 Kenya shilling loan to purchase another welding machine for her business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 shillings.

Jane hopes to expand her business and, in five years time, she sees herself as “the CEO of my own welding company”. She describes herself as hardworking, self-motivated, and humble.

loans.use: To purchase another welding machine

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun R. is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Soy (they are pictured together), is 33 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of the children attends school and other two are still young.

Mrs. Savoeun R. has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market and other places. Her husband has been a construction worker for twenty years.

Savoeun is asking for her first loan of $200 to purchase more silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy more silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a 35-year-old woman who sells general household products like sugar, salt, tea and cooking fat. She sells to her neighbors from a kiosk at her home. She has been in this business for five years and has one employees. Before having her own kiosk, she sold tomatoes and fish.

Phanice’s primary business challenge is having enough money to stock her shop. In addition to her food kiosk, she generates income from three motorbikes she owns which are used in a motorcycle taxi service.

Phanice is married and has three children: 2 sons and 1 daughter, from 5 to 12 years old. Her husband works at a law firm.

Phanice plans to use the 40,000 Kenya shilling loan to expand her kiosk structure and increase her inventory of products (sugar, cooking fat, etc.). She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 shillings.

In the future, Phanice hopes to own a large supermarket. In five years, she dreams of purchasing a plot of land, building a home, and owning a supermarket. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To expand her kiosk structure and increase her stock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Describing herself as hardworking, focused, and self-driven, Catherine is a 50 year-old green grocer who sells fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, potatoes, avocados, pineapples, bananas, apples, and beetroots) to local customers near a transportation hub in her town. Shortages of fruits in the market represent her biggest business challenge. In addition to her green grocery business, she generates income by selling sheep and goats.

Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 Shillings, Catherine is requesting a 45,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area. In the future, she hopes to grow her business in order to supply more schools and hotels in her town. In five years, she dreams of having a wholesale business so that she is in a position to supply other green grocers.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce (tomatoes, leafy green vegetables, etc.) to supply to the schools around the area

loans.name: Sokkunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Sokkunthea C. (was in the photo), age 28 and his wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Yin, age 30, have been married since 2002 and have no children yet. He also has his elderly mother is living with him.  

Sokkunthea is a fisherman. His wife is a garment factory worker. Besides of the business, the couple also grows rice on their farmland in the village. Sokkunthea is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M., from Biasong, Dipolog City, is 51 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials, she is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Emmily

texts.en:
Emmily is a 42-year-old woman who sells fruit and vegetables to local residents, students and travelers in a high traffic area near the town center. The main challenge she faces is competition from other green grocers. She has been in this business for 18 years and has one employee. Emmily is married and has 10 children: six sons and four daughters. She describes herself as visionary, hardworking, and flexible.

Emmily plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to purchase fresh maize to sell to customers. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES. In the future, Emmily hopes to improve her living conditions by expanding her business and eventually owning a big restaurant in Kakamega.

loans.use: To purchase fresh maize

loans.name: Rottanak

texts.en: Mr. Rottanak S., 24 and single, lives with his widowed mother and three brothers and three sisters on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  A motorcycle repairer since 2009, Rottanak operates the business at his shop in front of his house. He is now applying for a loan of $300 to help finance his mother's purchase of silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To help finance his mother's purchase of silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:

To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

loans.name: Sousdey

texts.en:
Mr. Sousdey S. is 41 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreynak Sum, is 28 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have one son who is in school.

Mr. Sousdey S. has been a PM (Military Police) since 1993. His wife has been selling fruit for four years. Currently, they live with their parents and they want to live in their own home. However, they do not have the money to build their own house. Hence, Sousdey is applying for his first loan in the mount of $1,100 to use for his project. 

In the photo, Mr. Sousdey S. and his wife are standing in front of their parents’ house.

loans.use: To build his own house for his family to live in

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Jocelyn F. is from the barangay (village) of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years of age, is separated from her husband, and is blessed with two children: one is still an infant and the other is now of school age. She receives support from her live-in partner, Niljun Comeson, who is a driver. Jocelyn is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been engaged in this kind of business for two years already and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She, as an active member under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a micro-finance program of PMPC, has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is now requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to add to the capital of her sari-sari store business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future use, especially for future business expansion and for her children’s education. loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak S. (shown in the photo), is 33 years old. His wife, Mrs. Sima Sam-rach, is 28 years old. They have been married for 12 years and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about seventeen kilometers from the city.  

Sophak has been a policeman for 17 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. The walls of his house, as well as other parts of the house, are old and in need of repair. He is requesting his first loan of $600 to repair the house where he lives. He also will use a part of the loan to pay for school fees for his sister who is learning tailoring skills.

loans.use: To repair his house and pay for school fees

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en:
Mrs. Samrith A. (featured in the picture), age 25, and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Phat, age 31, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married for four years and have two daughters who are currently attending school.

Samrith has been selling food in a market near a garment factory for five years. Her husband is a garment factory worker. Samrith spends a lot of money on rent each month to operate her business in the market. For this reason Samrith is asking for her first loan in the amount of $800. With this money she will purchase space in a shop, where she can operate her food selling business and avoid high rental fees.

loans.use: To buy space in a shop where she sells food

Leah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan S. (pictured above), age 27, and her husband, Mr. Phal Soeur, age 28, live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001, and they have two sons.

Lan has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Her husband has been a teacher for 3 years. Lan is asking for her first loan in the amount of 200 USD in order to assist her brother, a garment factory worker, with the purchase of a motorbike to use for getting to work.

texts.en:

Latifan is a daughter of Ghulam Mohammad. She is 53 years old and the leader of her group. Her credit behavior is very good, and this is her fourth year to be with Asasah.

Latifan has given birth to five children, and all of them are male. Two of her sons are involved in a furniture polisher business. Another son helps his father in the grocery shop. Her other two sons are enrolled in a school to receive an education.

With the loan amount, her husband will buy groceries in bulk.

Note: In the photo, Latifan is showing her domestic sewing business.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

Farrah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years, and she earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Sarun

Therefore, Panha is applying for a loan in the mount of 1,000 USD to add to her own money in order to build a house.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
