Today, María's business is very well known in her town and she has many regular customers. The key factor has been the good service she offers, as well as the exotic drinks she serves. Sometimes, she hosts graduation or birthday parties, or any other type of event, as her establishment is well-designed for these types of parties. Two young women work for María, helping to serve the customers with efficiency and effectiveness. Her schedule is from 10:00 in the morning to 3:00 the next morning. For this reason, she feels happy with her work, as she has achieved good economic results. Nevertheless, in time she hopes to open her own clothing store, with the goal of diversifying her business. This is María's eighteenth loan with Microfinanzas Peru. She promises to continue to comply with her repayment schedule. She is also satisfied with the good work of her communal group. With this loan, she plans to invest in improvements to her bar/recreation space. She will buy tables, chairs, and local handicraft decorations, to give her business a more innovative and cozy style.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and local handicraft decorations, to make her business a cozier place

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vecinas está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Maritza del Socorro O. G., coordinadora del grupo quien 1980 inicio con el comercio de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene nueve hijos de los cuales el mayor de 30 años es el que le ayuda en el negocio y los cinco menores que están a su cargo y estudian ellos tienen 9, 13, 15, 19 y 23. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Elizabeth del Socorro Mercado quien vende ropa desde hace 20 años y María Estavana L. comercializa pipián, ayote, cebolla y tomate.
texts.en:
The Las Vecinas ("The Neighbors") Group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them is Ms. Maritza del Socorro O. G., who coordinates the group. In 1980, she began selling fruits and vegetables. She has nine children, five of whom are still in her care. They are 9, 13, 15, 19, and 23 years old. Her fellow group members are Elizabeth del Socorro M. O., who has been selling clothing for 20 years, and María Estevana L. G., who sells pipián and ayote [types of squash], onions, and tomatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetable crops

loans.name: Abdullayeva

texts.en: Abdullayeva A. is a 47 year old woman who breeds cattle.  She has been in this business since 2003. She is married and has three children. She breeds cattle for meat products and cows for milk and milk products. Her monthly income is 150-200 AZN which is not enough to cover family needs. A. is requesting a loan for 1000 AZN to purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Tiessiri  4 Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI 4 est un groupe de six femmes mariées du village de NITOLOSSO dans la préfecture de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, 4 enfants, et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SALI D. compte utiliser  son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Tiessiri 4 is a group of six married women from the village of Nitolosso in San prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 30 and have four children, and they grow peanuts. Looking to make their farming more profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After paying off previous loans, they are now asking for their third seasonal loan, Sali D. plans to use her loan to buy as many peanut seeds as she needs, plus small tools and fertilizer. at the big market in Kimparana. . After the rainy season, the produce is warehoused long enough for its value to increase, before selling it at the big market in Kimparana. and other nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the members of the group hope to make a profit of 35,000 FCFA each to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seeds and tools.

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus M. is a married man with a year old child. He rents a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent. Chrispinus has been operating his mobile banking business for the last two years. He sells retail to Safaricom Mobile subscribers. He earns his other source of income from his side job working as a house agent. Chrispinus faces the major challenge of theft. He hopes to open another retail shop in the  future. His main aim in working with Yehu is to get a loan to expand his business. 

M-Pesa is a completely electronic banking service (no buildings) that lets average people do banking by mobile phone. They also provide loans. M-pesa has transformed the lives of Kenyans and the role of mobile phones in remittances and money circulation. M-Pesa is a joint venture between Vodafone and Safaricom (the local mobile operator ) with the backing of Citibank and Commercial Bank of Africa. M-PESA allows users to make four basic types of transactions i.e transfer from person to person, transfers from individuals to businesses, cash withdrawals at designated outlets with a profit and loan receipt or repayment.

loans.use: To increase the funds available to lend to his customers.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar K. is a 39-year-old trader who sells fruits and vegetables. He started his business in 2009. Before, he used to work in a bazaar but his rent was higher than in his new place.

Yashar’s profit is 200-300 AZN a month and he trying his best to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose he applied for a 700 AZN loan which he will use to purchase more products to sell. In future, he wishes to be able to open his own food market.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir A. is 48 years old and sells seasonal  fruit and vegetables. He started his business this year as additional source of income but it already bringing profit as a main source. Tahir is a foreman and did not have a  permanent job before his new business. Tahir`s monthly profit is 200 AZN and he is going to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN. He says that selling fruit and vegetables in an open-air stall is not easy as it is very hot so he wishes to save enough money to build his own shop by next summer.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Asunción; ella tiene 41 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 13, 7, 3 años de edad, él socio tiene una panadería, el socio es panadero y trabaja en familia con sus hijos y conyugue, ellos también venden los panes a sus clientes, El socio desea en un futuro cercano implementar su panadería y hacer un cafetín para el público en general. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la panadería (harina, manteca, leña para el horno, levadura). 

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Archangel Gabriel Communal Bank. He lives in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. His name is Mr. Asunción. He is 41 years old and lives with his partner and four children, ages 14, 13, 7, and 3 years old. Asunción runs a bakery. He is a baker and works as a family with his children and partner. They also help with selling the bread to customers. In the near future, Asunción hopes to expand his bakery and to open a cafe for the general public. He is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for baking (flour, butter, firewood for the oven, and yeast). Asunción values and is infinitely grateful for the loan extended to him, as it will allow him to grow his business and to improve his quality of life. Likewise, he promises to comply with his repayment schedule according to the terms agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking (flour, butter, firewood for the oven, and yeast)

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad A. is a 32-year-old farmer who raises fruit and vegetables in Agsu city. He is married and has two children. Rashad's monthly income is about 300 AZN and his main customers are local bazaar merchants and local people. He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN and dreams of expanding his business via growing new sorts of fruit trees.

loans.use: buy new sorts of fruit trees to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 50 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Hace mas de 25 años, que empezó a trabajar, primero dedicándose a la agricultura, tendiendo entonces una pequeña parcela, donde solo le servía para sostener a su familia. Hoy posee una tienda, que le esta generando buenas ganancias económicas, de esa manera tiene dos ingresos importantes para su familia. Considera que para alcanzar lo que ha logrado, le ha tomado tiempo, dedicación y mucho ahínco a su trabajo, es por ello que procura que su tienda este muy abastecida de productos, con la finalidad de que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con el producto que compra. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de su familia y ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su decimoquinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos, como en anteriores oportunidades, además se siente agradecido con su grupo comunal por el buen clima organizacional que existe. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, para que pueda abastecer a su tienda con la seguridad de captar mayor clientela y aumentar su margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Marina, who is 50, is married and has six children of school age. They live together in the town of Quimbiri, located at the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own house made of wood. She has worked for more than 25 years. First she worked in agriculture, tending a small parcel which only served to sustain her family. Now she has a store, which is generating good earnings for her. In this way she has two important incomes for her family. She realizes that to reach what she has achieved, it has taken time, dedication, and much tenacity to her work. For that reason, she tries to keep her store well stocked with products, with the goal that her customers feel satisfied with the products that they purchase. In general, she works there herself, but on occasion she receives help from her children. Her plan for the future is to construct a house of high quality material, with the aim of improving the quality of life for her family and offering more comfort to her customers. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to continue complying with its terms, as she has done on her previous opportunities. Furthermore, she is thankful to her community bank for the good organization climate that exists there. With the credit that she is applying for, she is thinking of investing the majority in merchandise, so that she can stock her store and be certain to attract more customers and increase her sales margin.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her store

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Efrain; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; él socio es abogado de profesión, él tiene una oficina en pleno corazón del Cusco en San Andrés, él socio desea implementar su sala de espera, para que sus clientes estén cómodos mientras él los atiende, El socio desea comprar un televisor y algunos cuadros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor y cuadros para su oficina.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the comunal bank “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”. He lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The member is Efrain. He is 40 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He is a lawyer and has an office in the heart of Cusco in San Andrés. He wishes to set up his waiting room, so that his clients are comfortable while he sees to them. He wants to buy a television and some paintings. He is soliciting the loan to buy the television and paintings for his office. He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan given, since it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Moreover, he commits to making the loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a television and paintings for the waiting room of his office

loans.name: Nueva Alternativa Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”

La Sra. Rosa es una D. las participantes D. la alcancía “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” que tiene trabajando tres años con EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD, cuenta con ocho personas que pertenecen a un mismo barrio. El grupo se formó gracias a una vecina del mismo barrio que sugirió a las demás vecinas sobre la organización D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

El nombre D. la alcancía comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” surgió con la idea D. la Sra. Maria, ella decidió proponer este nombre debido a que le trajo buenos resultados en el pasado, ella es la tesorera del grupo.

La Sra. Rosa es la presidenta tiene un año con ese cargo en la alcancía comunal y se siente muy a gusto en el puesto que tiene, siendo uno D. sus pilares D. mando la puntualidad y honestidad.

Rosa esta casada y tiene un niño D. un año D. edad, su negocio es tener una bodega. La idea D. bodega, surgió por que en la zona en donD. vive, recién se esta urbanizando y no había lugares D. compra inmediata por el cual decidió invertir en la bodega convirtiéndose en corto plazo en el monopolio D. la zona, también posee una pequeña librería, ubicado en el mismo local, anteriormente se dedicaba ha alquilar computadoras con Internet pero no le fue muy bien, con el tiempo decidió cerrar las cabinas D. Internet. A su vez se dedica a alquilar sus celulares, locutorio ambulante, para que el público haga llamadas y en su casa saca tiene una fotocopiadora con la que ofrece el servicio D. copias. 

Rosa y su esposo están pagando la construcción del segundo piso, su madre le ha regalado los aires D. su casa para que construyan el segundo piso, aparte rosa participa en una asociación para obtener su carro que es uno D. sus sueños que quiere cumplir ya desD. hace mucho tiempo. Rosa ahorra para los estudios D. sus hijos y su esposo se encarga D. pagar los gastos D. la casa como luz, agua, teléfono, etc. 
“Si tuviera una gran suma D. dinero a la mano pondría una pastelería  por que mi madre me enseñó desD. pequeña a como preparar tortas, kekes, pasteles, etc. este es uno D. sus sueños principales.

El préstamo que se la sido otorgado lo usará para comprar mas mercadería para su bodega y recargar con mas línea D. llamada sus celulares para poder alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” Rosa is one of the participants of the communal bank “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”, which has been working with EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD for three years. It has eight members who belong to the same neighborhood. The group was formed thanks to a resident of the same neighborhood who told the other residents about the EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD organization. The name of the communal bank, “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”, was the idea of Maria. She decided to propose this name because it has brought her good results in the past. She is the group's treasurer. Rosa is the president. She has been in this position for a year in the communal bank and she is very happy with it, since punctuality and honesty are some of her basic principles. Rosa is married and has a one year old child. Her business is a small store. The idea for the store came about because the area she lives in is only reently becoming developed and there were no places to shop nearby. She decided to invest in a store and for a short time had a monopoly in the area. She also has a small bookstore in the same locale. Previously, she rented out computers with the internet but it didn't go so well for her and after a time she decided to close her internet booths. She also rents out cell phones as a street vendor, so that the puiblic can make calls and at her house she has a copier with which she offers a copying service. Rosa and her husband are paying for the construction of a second floor. Her mother has given them the space above her house so that they can build it. Rosa also participates in an association to obtain a car, which she has dreamt of for a long time. Rosa is saving for her children's studies and her husband takes care of paying the household expenses such as electricity, water, telephone, etc. “If I had a large quantity of money on hand I would open a pastry shop because my mother taught me how to make cakes, pastries, etc." This is one of her biggest dreams. . The loan has been granted to be used to buy more merchandise for her store and to purchase more time for her cell phones to be able to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy oil, milk, rice, sugar, etc. to fill her store.

loans.name: Abel Agripino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. ABEL; él tiene 43 años de edad y  es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos  él socio es abogado de profesión y tiene su oficina en San Andrés a una cuadra de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco. Él socio  también se dedica a la compra y venta de bienes raíces y a todo los papeleos legales que estos contemplen. Él socio desea comprar unos muebles para su oficina. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles de sofá para la oficina.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ARCANGEL GABRIEL community bank. He lives in Huanchac in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sr. ABEL. He is 43 years old, partnered and the father of 2 children. He's a lawyer with an office on San Andres, a block from Cusco's main square. He also buys and sells real estate and processes the associated paperwork. He wants to buy furniture for the office so he is applying for a loan to buy an office sofa. The member is very grateful for the help the loan provides because it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Office furniture for law and real estate practice.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Ramiro; él socio tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero él socio es abogado de profesión, él también tiene una pequeña empresa de fabricación y arreglo de calzados, él socio los fines de semana se dedica a administrar su empresa, Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la empresa, el socio desea aumentar y mejorar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the ARCANGEL GABRIEL community bank. He lives in Huanchac in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. The member's name is Sr. Ramiro. He is 39 years old and single. He is a lawyer and operates a small business making and repairing shoes. He spends weekends managing the business. He is now applying for a loan to buy materials for the business because he wants to expand and improve it. The member is very grateful for the loan because it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for shoe business.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa, de 34 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su techo propio. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, no fue un obstáculo para ella, ya que a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, supo sobresalir. Recuerda que empezó con un pequeño negocio de bebidas, y con el pasar del tiempo fue creciendo de a poco, hasta que decidió elevar el segundo piso de su casa con el ahorro que tenía consigo. Hoy tiene otra casa en la localidad de Quimbiri, a la vez está dedicado a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao, en donde lo viene generando buenos ingresos económicos. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de cosecha recibe la ayuda de sus peones, por otro lado su pareja trabaja como transportista, de esa manera genera otros ingresos para su canasta familiar. Normalmente su producto lo vende a un buen precio, en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Sus planes a futuro es abrir un taller de motos, con la finalidad de que su pareja, quien estudió  mecánica, pueda atender las necesidades de sus clientes. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente fortalecido con su grupo comunal, por la honestidad que existe en  cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materiales como: cementos, tierra fina, ladrillos, para el acabado de su casa, ya que tiene planeado construir un hotel, considerando que le será muy rentable este negocio.
texts.en:
Santa, 34, lives with her partner and their two school-aged children. The live in a house they own in San Francisco, a town in the beautiful Cusco countryside. Santa didn't finish elementary school, but that hasn't been an obstacle for her because she works hard and knows how to overcome the barriers in her way. She remembers starting with nothing more than a small store, selling cold drinks, and building it bit by bit until she saved enough to add a second floor to her house. Now she has another house in the town of Quimbiri. She also earns money from farming and, specifically, from growing cocoa, now her main source of income. Normally, she tends the crop herself but she hires laborers to help her during the harvest season. Her partner works as a driver and generates an income that goes to paying the family's bills. Santa's crop usually sells for a good price at her town's local warehouse. For the future, she would like to open a motorcycle repair shop because her partner, who studied to be a mechanic, can run it. This is Santa's eighth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying this one on time, just as she has past loans. She gains strength from the other members of the community bank and values the honesty of the group. With this loan, she will buy various construction materials--cement, sand, bricks--to finish the work on her house because she has plans to operate a hotel, a business that will be very profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a hotel.

loans.name: El Alto Cenepa Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “EL ALTO CENEPA”

La Sra. Flora pertenece a la alcancía “EL ALTO CENEPA” que tiene trabajando cuatro años con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, conformada por ocho personas que pertenecen a una misma urbanización. El grupo se formó gracias a una vecina del mismo barrio que sugirió a las demás vecinas sobre la organización D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

El nombre D. la alcancía “EL ALTO CENEPA” surgió con la idea D. Flor, ella decidió proponer este nombre debido a que la zona en donD. viven se llama “El Alto Cenepa”.

Flor es la nueva presidenta D. la alcancía  “EL ALTO CENEPA” y durante esta nueva faceta en el cargo D. presidenta ha demostrado una excelente gestión. 

Flor tiene experiencia en  confección por mas D. 15 años, durante este lapso D. tiempo decidió independizarse formando su propia Mype dedicada exclusivamente en servicio D. confección el cual actualmente tiene el nombre D. “Confecciones Vane”, esta empresa se enfoca solamente a confeccionar ropa para adultos (pantalones, poleras, casacas, sacos, etc.), así cumpliendo su sueño adorado D. tener su propia empresa para educar, alimentar y mantener mejor a sus hijos.

Flor se dedica solamente a la confección, ella considera que es su negocio principal, con el tiempo le ha generado buenos frutos, y ha mejorado la calidad D. estuD. D. sus hijos. Con los ingresos que tiene por la confección D. ropa cubren sus gastos básicos D. luz, agua, teléfono, y también paga puntualmente sus deudas.

Sus planes a futuro son la D. ver a sus hijos profesionales, ese es el móvil D. su razón D. ser D. la Sra. Flor, y quiere poner su tienda para ofrecer su producto como marca propia. El préstamo otorgado lo va usar para comprar mas materia prima y aumentar su capacidad D. producción.
texts.en:
The communal bank “EL ALTO CENEPA”. Sra. Flora belongs to the group "EL ALTO CENEPA". It is maD. up of eight members that live in the same area. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for four years now. The group was formed thanks to one of their neighbors that suggested they join the organization EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD. Flor came up with the name "EL ALTO CENAPA", named after the region where they live. Flor is the new president of the group and as president she has done an excellent job. Flor has more than 15 years of experience as a seamstress. She decided to start her own business that focuses solely on making clothing for adults (pants, shirts, jackets, coats, etc.), thus fulfilling her dream to have her own business so that she can educate, feed and give her children a better life. It is called "Confecciones Vane". Flor is a dedicated seamstress and this is her principal occupation. Over time it has produced good results and it has even helped to improve the quality of her children's education. Her income covers her basic expenses such as electricity, water and telephone. She is punctual with her payments. Her future plans are to see her children become professionals. This is her motivation and her raison d'être. She wants to be able to have a store that offers her own brand name products. She will use this loan to buy the materials she needs to increase her production capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric, etc

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Javier; El socio tiene 42 años de edad y el socio es casado y tiene 1 hijo, el socio es abogado de profesión, él socio se considera a sí mismo independiente, debido a que él no tiene una oficina establecida pero ejerce su carrera de forma independiente y es que a él,  la gente en su barrio y amigos lo conocen y lo buscan para tomar sus casos, El socio  solicita el préstamo para incrementar sus ahorros y junto a estos poder comprar un auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con sus proyectos y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "ARCANGEL GABRIEL". He lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco in the department of Cusco. Sr. Javier is 42 years old, married and has 1 child. He is a lawyer by profession. He considers himself a freelancer due to the fact that he doesn't work in an established office, but practices independently. His neighbors and friends request his services. He is asking for a loan to increase his savings and to buy a car. He values and infinitely appreciates the loan since it will allow him to grow with his projects and improve his quality of life. He is committed to repaying his loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his savings and to buy a car

loans.name: Ignacio Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Fredy; el socio  tiene 47 años de edad y el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. El socio se dedica a la venta de materiales de calzados, y a la venta de calzados ortopédicos en el mercado de Huanchac el socio tienen un stand desde hace 2 años, El socio trabaja con su conyugue y ambos fabrican estos calzados y los venden al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas comerciales. Él socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y de este modo seguir con su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Fredy is the member. He is 47 years old, and he is in a common law marriage. He has two children. Fredy sells footwear materials and orthopedic footwear in the Huanchac market. He has had a stand for two years. He works with his life partner, and they both make footwear. They sell it wholesale to different stores. The member is requesting a loan to buy materials. This is how he will continue with his business. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. The loan allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. He pledges to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to continue with his business

loans.name: Juan Obispo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan; el socio  tiene 38 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, él socio tienen una tienda de abarrotes, el se dedica a la atención diaria de este su negocio, Él socio apoya a su conyugue con sus estudios de enfermería, este socio es muy alegre y lleno de energías y sueños, El desea comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes y otros para implementar su mercadería para este mes, él socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Arcángel Gabriel Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Juan is the member. He is 38 years old. The member is in a common law marriage, and he has two children. The member has a grocery store, and he works in it everyday. The member supports his life partner with her nursing studies. The member is very happy and full of energy and dreams. He wishes to buy rice, sugar, noodles, detergent, and other products to stock his merchandise this month. He is requesting the loan to stock his store with groceries. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. The loan allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. He pledges to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store with groceries

loans.name: Yossy

texts.es: Yossy, D. 24 años D. edad, convive con su pareja. ElL. vive en L. casa D. su pareja, ubicada en L. hermosa selva cusqueña, específicamente en L. localidad D. Quimbiri. Yossy, reconoce que para realizar un negocio propio, tiene que pasar por varias etapas en el plano laboral. Por el momento se encuentra trabajando en una entidad pública, reparando computadoras y con el sueldo que percibe trata D. apoyar a su pareja, es así que genera ingresos económicos considerables para L. familia. Su horario D. trabajo lo realiza a partir D. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 6:00 D. L. tarD.. Sus planes a futuro es tener su propia tienda D. heladería y  pastelería, ya que en su localidad no existe ese tipo D. negocio, es por ello que lo ve como un buen prospecto a ejecutarlo. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma D. pagos, además se siente cómoda con su grupo comunal, por los buenos beneficios que le otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar un juego D. sillas, D. esa manera emprender el negocio que tiene en manos.
texts.en:
Yossy is 24 years old, and she lives with her life partner. She lives in his house, which is in the beautiful Cuscan jungle. Specifically, she lives in Quimbiri. Yossy realizes that in order to have her own business she needs to go through various stages in the work plan. At the moment she is working for a public entity repairing computers. She tries to help her life partner with the salary she receives. That is how she generates considerable income for her family. Her work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Her plan for the future is to have her own ice cream and pastry store. This type of business does not exist in her area. That is why she views it as a good prospect to follow through on. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She pledges to continue making her payments on time. Also, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because of the good benefits they proviD.. She will use the requested loan to buy a set of chairs. That way she can undertake the business that she has planned.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs to undertake her pastry and ice cream business

loans.name: Sagitario Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “Sagitario” esta ubicado en Huachipa, en el distrito de ate, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Justina y conformada por 10 socios que radican en dicha zona. La señora Justina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 19 y 15 años  de edad, los dos últimos en edad académica, el negocio al cual se dedica es la crianza de porcinos desde hace 17 años.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 1 año, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de comida rápida en los mercados, otros socios a la venta de jugos, golosinas y otros socios a la venta de ropa; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, la señora Justina pagara la matricula de educación de sus hijo, ya que su gran sueño es que sea profesional, todos los demás socios incrementaran su capital para así obtener una mayor productividad, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayores clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Sagitario" is located in Huachipa, in the Ate district. The group is represented by Justina, and has 10 members who are from this area. Justina is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children, aged 26, 24, 19 and 15 years. The youngest are school-aged. She has been in the business of raising pigs for 17 years. This group has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for a year. The members are devoted to different activities such as the sale of fast food in the markets, the sale of juices, snacks and clothing. With the loan that was recently granted, Justina will pay school fees for her child, since her greatest dream is to see him become a professional. The other members will increase their capital so that they can have higher productivity, improve their position in the market, and attract more customers. The members of the group have big dreams and goals, and they are very grateful to the institution for all of the support provided. They pledge to make their payments, and to continue working so that they will not let down the lenders.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Srta. Mariza; ella tiene 33 años de edad y La socia es soltera,  La socia es docente de profesión, ella trabaja en la zona rural enseñando en quechua y castellano a los niños de las comunidades alto andinas, ella es una mujer muy amable y con muchos valores, La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales para llevar a los niños porque son de escasos recursos y ella desea aportar voluntariamente con esto y parte del préstamo es para cubrir sus pasajes hasta que le depositen su sueldo mensual.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, el cual le permitirá cumplir con sus deseos, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Arcangel Gabriel" and lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cuso department. The member is la Señorita Mariza. She is 33 years old, single, and a teacher. She works in rural areas, teaching the children in the high, Andean communities in Quechua (language of the indigenous people of Peru) and Spanish. She is a very friendly woman with strong values. The member requests the loan to buy materials for the children because there is a shortage and she wishes to voluntarily contribute. She will also use some of the loan proceeds to pay her travel expenses until her monthly salary is deposited. The member values and is grateful for this loan, which will permit her to realize her wishes. In addition, she is committed to making timely repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials for the children and pay travel expenses until her monthly salary is deposited

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, D. 47 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene cuatros hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en L. localidad D. San francisco, ubicada en L. ceja D. L. selva peruana, donD. tienen su propia casa. Hace mas D. 20 años, se dedica a vender comida criolL. y típica D. L. selva, en donD. sus clientes gustan mucho D. L. sazón D. sus platos. Un tiempo atrás instaló en el segundo piso D. su casa, un negocio D. entretenimiento, que es el juego D. billar, D. esa manera obtiene otro ingreso extra para su familia. Pero el trabajo que más disfruta es L. preparación D. comida, no obstante, los ingresos que tiene lo está ahorrando, ya que piensa abrir un recreo turístico, siendo un negocio que dentro D. su localidad es escasea. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. su esposo y su rutina diaria es a partir D. las 7:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 9:00 D. L. noche D. lunes a domingo, siendo su punto D. venta, frente a un mercado. Este es su decimoséptimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar D. manera oportuna y responsable, además está satisfecho con grupo comunal, por los beneficios que lo otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en el acabado e inhalación para el nuevo terreno que compró, por que piensa tener un campo deportivo. Un negocio que lo considera muy rentable.
texts.en:
Zonia is 47 years old, married, and has four children to her credit. The family lives in their own home in the town of San Francisco, located on the ceja (eyebrow) of the Peruvian jungle. For more than 20 years she has sold the food typical of her country and of the jungle. Her customers enjoy very much the taste of these dishes. Some time ago she installed on the second floor of her home pool tables, which became another source of income for her family. But the work that she most enjoys is food preparation. She is saving a portion of her income because she thinks of opening a recreation area for tourists; there is a shortage of recreation areas in her town. She generally works by herself but occasionally is helped by her husband. Her work day begins at 7am and lasts until 9 at night, from Monday to Sunday, these being the hours that her market site is open. This is her seventeenth loan from MFP; she is committed to making payment in a timely and responsible manner. Also, she is satisfied with her communal bank because of the benefits it provides. She thinks she will invest this loan in the development of a new plot of land that she purchased. She wants to build an athletic field, which she believes to have great commercial potential.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an athletic field

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Unidos por el Éxito” se encuentra ubicada en el Asentamiento Humano D. el Agustino, representada por  Vilma, quien actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta D. la alcancía,  tiene 45 años, con 4 hijos, quienes ya son independientes y han formado su familia.
La alcancía trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace dos años y seis meses, esta  conformada por 10 socios emprendedores quienes desempeñan diferentes tipos D. actividades en su mismo domicilio y en forma ambulante como: venta D. comida y frituras, venta D. ropa D. vestir, venta D. abarrotes, servicio D. confecciones D. polo, confección y venta D. sabanas, crianza D. porcinos, venta D. productos D. belleza y servicio D. limpieza en hogares.
El destino del reciente préstamo será para la adquisición D. mercadería para surtir sus productos e insumos y materiales para sus negocios. Sus expectativas son tener mayores ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida, así como también tener una economía más estable para ir mejorando la educación D. sus hijos. Los socios nos encontramos muy entusiasmados y agradecidos y D. poder trabajar con la institución y nos comprometemos a no defraudarlos.
(En la foto niña hija D. la socia).
texts.en:
The “Unidos por el Éxito” (United for Success) communal bank is located in the Agustino settlement. It is represented by Vilma, 45, who is the bank president. She has four children who are independent and have formed their own families. The communal bank has collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last two-and-a-half years. It has 10 enterprising members that are in a variety of commercial activities in their homes and door-to-door. Some of the activities are: sale of prepared meals and fast food, clothing sales, grocery sales, clothing manufacturing, manufacturing and sales of bed sheets, pig raising, beauty products sales and home cleaning services. The recent loan will be destined to buy merchandise to stock their businesses as well as for ingredients and materials. Their expectations are to have higher income in order to proviD. their families with a better quality of life as well as having a more stable income to improve their children’s education. The members are excited and grateful to be able to work with the institution and pledge to meet their obligations. (A member’s daughter appears in the photo)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items, ingredients and merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin C. S., tiene la edad de 40 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su compañera y  3 hijos de 12,9 y 2 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Marvin también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Marvin C. S., 40, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and three children, aged 12, 9 and 2, who are his greatest priority. The loan he wants will help him with his farm, specifically, with the cultivation of coffee. The idea is to buy organic and chemical fertilizers. He wants to give his cultivations appropriate care so that he can have better quality products and obtain the highest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very satisfied with the ease of payments they are providing him. Don Marvin has also worked for a number of years in agriculture. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Rev. Mois T. (pictured right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rev. Mois was born in Matru Jong, a town in southern Sierra Leone. He is sixty-eight years of  age.  He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children. For over eight years now, Rev. Mois has been selling stationery and office equipment. 

This is first loan that Rev. Mois and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Rev. Mois will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business; he will buy A4-size paper, stamp pads, books, etc. to add to his shop inventory.

loans.use: Buy A4-size paper, stamp pads, books, etc. for resale

loans.name: Sayie Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Mohamed S., is a 47-year-old and is married with seven children. He was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is a businessman who sells shoes and ready-to-wear clothes. He has been running this business for twenty years now. 

Mohamed and his colleagues in the group have come together to form a group in order to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, each of these entrepreneurs will be able to add more goods to his/her business, make more sales, more profit and consequently improve their living conditions.  Mohamed will use his share of the loan to buy shoes and ready-to-wear-clothes wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy shoes and ready-to-wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Tamuyeneh Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tamuyeneh” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Gbassay B. is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children – three in primary school and one in secondary school. Gbassay has been a businesswoman for three years now, she sells market foodstuffs like onions, peppers, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With her share of this loan, Gbassay will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy onions, pepper, salt, Maggi cubes, etc.  wholesale

loans.name: José Joaquín

texts.es: José Joaquín C. D., tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y  4 hijos de 32,26,21 y 17 años de edad, son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José Joaquín también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Joaquín C. D. is 66 years old, married, and has four children aged 32, 26, 21 and 17. His family is his top priority. He needs this loan to help with his farm, or more specifically with growing coffee, for which he needs to buy fertilizer. He wants to look after his coffee crop well in order to improve the quality and generate as much revenue as possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with Kiva Field Partner, FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with this credit facility. Don José Joaquín has worked as a farmer for several years. He looks forward to a future where he can provide his family with a better standard of living and greater economic stability, in addition to being able to continue his development as a person as well as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help with his coffee crop

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God is Great” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a  small town in western Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Fatmata D.. Fatmata was born in a town called Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone. She is forty-one and is married with four children. Today, Fatmata, her husband, and her children live in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. 

In this small town of Waterloo near Freetown, Fatmata makes a living through selling lace, cottons, etc. With ten years of experience in business, Fatmata wants this loan in order to buy bales of cotton and lace fabrics, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy bales of cotton and lace fabrics for resale

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Talapsu” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo small town in western Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva of SLL 2,800,000 for the entire group in order to improve their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Maseray K.. She was born in Waterloo small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. She is age twenty-seven, is married to a motor mechanic, and they have two children.

Maseray makes a living through selling clothes. With twenty years of experience in business, she wants this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Faith” group from Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are women with small businesses who have come to SMT/Kiva in order to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu J.. She was born in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. She is thirty-seven years of age and is a divorcee with three children.

For more than ten years now, Isatu has managed a “cigarettes box” where she sells cigarettes, matches, batteries, pens, pencils, etc., as well as provisions – milk, sugar, cocoa, mayonnaise, butter, bread, etc.

With the help of this loan, Isatu will buy more batteries, books, pens, pencils, cocoa, sugar, etc., to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy batteries, books, pens, pencils, cocoa, sugar, etc., to add to her stock

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio C. B., tiene la edad de 65 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Manuel Antonio también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio C. B., 65, is married and lives with his wife, who is his main priority. The loan he wants is for helping with his farm, specifically, with the cultivation of coffee; the idea is to buy organic and chemical fertilizers. He wants to give his cultivations appropriate care so that he can have better quality products and obtain the highest income possible at harvest time. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very satisfied with the ease of payments they are providing him. Don Manuel Antonio has also worked for a number of years in agriculture. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops

loans.name: Rustan Paul

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero sin hijos maneja una mototaxi amarilla de propiedad de su madre,su pareja vende en una zapateria. El destino del credito es para necesidad personal
texts.en:
The borrower is single and has no children. He drives a yellow mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that belongs to his mother. His significant other is a salesperson in a shoe store. The loan will be used for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: By God In Power I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “By God in Power I” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 4,700,000 for the entire group to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Lamrana B. who is age thirty-one. She was born in Waterloo, near Freetown. She is married to a businessman and they have three children.

For fifteen years now, Lamrana has been selling vegetable oil, rice, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy more oil, rice and Margi wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more oil, rice and Margi wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
La alcancía  comunal “Jehová Jire”; esta conformada por 9 socios, ellos  tienen como afinidad, vivir en el asentamiento humano Manuel Corza, son vecinos y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, esta ubicado, departamento de Lima.

Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 5 años, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta la señora Elsa, de 49 años de edad, es casada y se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortas, queques, crema volteada, pie, bocaditos, leche asada, chocotejas, desde hace 3 años, además también vende ropa como polares chompas pantalones para niños y adultos. Los socios desempeñan diversas actividades, una de ellas a la venta prendas de vestir y accesorios, 2 prestan servicio domestico, 2 venden comidas, la otra presta servicio de  azafata, 2 se dedican venta de golosinas, una presta servicio de limpieza y la otra vende abarrotes en general.
Con el reciente préstamo otorgado Elsa lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir de material  polar para vender; su gran sueño es poner una dulcería en su casa.
(Niño en la foto, hijo de la socia).
texts.en:
The “Jehová Jire” communal bank has 9 members. What they have in common is that they all live in the Manuel Corza settlement. They are neighbors and have known each other for a long time. It is located in Lima department. They have collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 5 years. Currently, Elsa, 49, is group president. She’s married and she makes and sells various regional food items like: tortas (sandwiches), cakes, pies, custard, snacks, etc. She’s been in this line of work for 3 years. She also sells clothing like sweaters and pants for children and adults. The other group members are in a variety of commercial activities. One of them sells clothing and accessories. Two others are domestic employees. Two sell prepared meals and one is a hostess. Two sell sweets, another is a cleaning lady and the other sells groceries. Elsa will use the loan to buy assorted winter clothing; her great wish is to set up a candy store in her home. (The little boy in the photo is a member’s son)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tol buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Kalomp Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Kalomp” group. They are men with small-scale businesses in the small town of Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,600,000 from SMT/Kiva in order to improve on the size and quality of their businesses.

Mohamed K. (pictured right) is the leader of this group. He was born in Masiaka village. He is thirty-eight years of age, is married to a businesswoman, and they have three children.

Mohamed sells lace, shoes, slippers/flip-flops, and sandals and has been managing this business for twenty years now. With the help of this loan, he will buy footwear in large quantity to improve the size and quality of his business.

loans.use: To buy footwear in large quantity to improve on the size and quality of his business

loans.name: Perseverance Group

texts.en:
These are people with small-scale businesses in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They have come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to enable them expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living.
 
Augustine K. is the leader of this group. He was born in Moyamba, in southern Sierra Leone. He is age thirty-five, is married, and has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending schools: two in secondary school and one in primary school.

For seventeen years now, Augustine has sold CDs and tapes. With the help of this loan, he will buy more CDs and tapes of popular local and international artists to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy CDs and tapes of popular local and international artists to add to his stock

loans.name: We Don Cam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Don Cam” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata S. (who is pictured in the middle, back row). Fatmata is age thirty-two, and she was born in Makeni. She is married with three children. Her husband is a professional worker and one of her children is in secondary school, the other is in primary school and the last is still a baby. 

For eleven years now, Fatmata has been selling market food – rice, groundnuts/peanuts, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggii (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc.  With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, groundnuts/peanuts, palm oil, Maggi cubes, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Akala Ya Wunie Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Akala Ya Wunie” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Ibrahim C. (pictured in the middle, back row). Ibrahim was born in a village called Mala, in northern  Sierra Leone. He is age thirty-five, married with four children. His wife is a businesswoman and two of his children are attending secondary school, another is attending primary school, and the youngest is still a baby.  

In Makeni city, Ibrahim makes a living through selling used clothes. With many years of experience in selling used clothes, Ibrahim wants this loan in order to buy bales of used clothes to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy bales of used clothes to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Wilfredo Dante

texts.es:
El señor Wilfredo Dante N. A. tiene 38 años de edad y vive en el barrio La Florida de la ciudad de Tarija. Wilfredo es casado con la señora Celsa Bejarano Aldana de 37 años de edad con quien tiene 2 hijos y viven en casa de su cuñado.

Wilfredo se dedica a realizar trabajos en su Metalurgica que tiene  y su esposa se dedica a la venta de alimentos, ambos vienen desarrollando sus actividades desde hace muchísimos años. 

Wilfredo tiene la necesidad de comprar material para realizar su trabajo, es por eso que la presente solicitud es para la compra de más material, para de este modo poder incrementar sus ingresos familiares.       
                                                                                                                                                                                             Wilfredo nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darle a su familia toda la comodidad posible. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Dante N. A., 38, lives in Tarija’s La Florida neighborhood. He’s married to Celsa Bejarano Aldana, 37, and they have two children. They live in his brother-in-law’s house. Wilfredo is a metal worker and his wife sells food. Both have been in these businesses for several years. Wilfredo needs to buy raw materials for his work. He is asking for this loan to buy more materials so that he can increase family income. Wilfredo tells us that his greatest dream is to be able to provide is family with every possible comfort. He also tells us that the next loan he requests will be used to buy tools for work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Bernaldo

texts.es:
El señor Bernaldo R. A. empezó con la actividad de cultivo de banano hace 6 años atrás, anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero y se le presento la oportunidad de comprarse un lotecito de 4 has para poderlo trabajar, para su suerte correspondía a una zona bananera que contaba con una buena organización en cuanto a la infraestructura como cable vía y empacadoras, lo que le permitió desarrollar más, actualmente cuenta con casi 8 has de de las cuales está con 4 has en producción. 

Tiene 4 hijos a los que mantiene y cuida con dedicación, su producto lo comercializa por medio de la asociación 25 de julio a las empresas exportadoras de banano, quienes lo llevan hasta los mercados chilenos y argentinos, el mantenimiento de sus cultivos lo realiza con fumigación con avioneta, agrupándose con sus vecinos, el trabajo de campo es más familiar y algunas veces contrata hasta dos jornaleros eventuales mas para que le colaboren en el trabajo de rosado de las plantaciones. El solicitante es una persona con muy buenas perspectivas de seguir creciendo y seguir mejorando sus plantaciones de banano.

Lo que necesita Bernaldo es capital para poder comprar insumos para el cultivo de banano y asi poder cultivar este producto en todo su terreno y asi mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Bernaldo R. A. started farming bananas 6 years ago. He used to be employed as a day laborer. He had the opportunity to buy a small, 4 hectare, lot in a banana growing area that fortunately had the entire necessary infrastructure in place, like conveyor belts and packers that allowed for more development. He currently has almost 8 hectares four of which are in production. He has four children that he supports with care and dedication. He sells his crops through the 25 de Julio association, one of the banana exporting firms that take the cops to Chilean and Argentinean markets. He and his neighbors group together to have their crops aerially fumigated. The field work is more family oriented and sometimes he hires up to two day workers to help with watering. He is a person with good prospects for future growth and continued improvement of his banana crops. Bernaldo needs capital to buy supplies for banana crops so that he can produce bananas on his entire property thereby improving his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for banana crops.

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.es:
El señor Vitaliano tiene 55 años está casado con la señora Arnés Claudina tienen 6 hijos de (18, 16, 14, 10,7 y 2) años, en la visita realizada se pudo ver que son una familia de muy escasos recursos económicos, tanto que en su pequeña casa solo hay dos habitaciones donde no entran todos los hijos y alguno duermen en un patio cubierto de ladrillos.

Don Vitaliano vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Vilomilla, trabaja en un empresa constructora el cargo que ocupa es SERENO, este cargo es muy duro para la edad que tiene don Vitaliano por lo tanto el desea cambiarse de cargo y ser albañil para poder descansar mejor en las noches, la esposa se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda actualmente cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero y de esta manera incrementa su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es cambiar de cargo y que espera con ansias que si le puedan dar el cargo de albañil, su sueño más importante es ampliar y realizar una nueva construcción de su casita para que sus hijos estén más cómodos.
texts.en:
Vitaliano is 55 years old. He is married to Arnés Claudina and has 6 children (aged 18, 16, 14, 10, 7 and 2 years old). It is a family that survives on very scarce resources. Their home has only two bedrooms, which not all of the children fit into. Some sleep in a roofed brick patio. Vitaliano lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Vilomilla region. He works for a construction company as a night watchman, which is a very difficult job given his age. Vitaliano would like instead to become a bricklayer, so he can rest better at night. His wife works in the milk-production business and has five dairy cows. She sells the milk from these cows to a company that produces dairy products. The loan will be used to buy another dairy cow, which will be used to produce more milk and improve the family's income. Vitaliano dreams of changing his job and is very anxious to see if he can secure a job as a bricklayer. His greatest dream, however, is to build an extension on his small house, so that his children can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: San Jose De Chupaca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal San José D. Chupaca ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chupaca, distrito D. Acoria en Huancavelica, el cual inicia su segundo ciclo con 12 socias, las cuales se dedican a diferenctes actividades comerciales y agricolas en la Región.

Gladys es socia y Presidenta del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, todos varones, quienes se dedican a estudiar, pues anhelan ser profesionales. Gladys se dedica a la venta D. ganado, los cuales compra pequeños y los hace crecer fuertes y robustos, los cuales venD. en las ferias. Gladys, ahora que pertenece a Finca se siente más motivada a continuar trabajando. Gladys solicita un nuevo préstamo, con el cual quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, comprando mas ganado. El sueño D. Gladys es que su negocio sea granD. y rentable y tener una tienda en su casa.

Bertha es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 02 hijas, las cuales ya van a la escuela. Bertha se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, tienda que abrió hace 06 años y era la única en su comunidad, ahora su comunidad cuenta hasta con una feria. A Bertha le gusto la idea D. ahorrar y saber que siempre pueD. disponer D. ellos con Finca, se siente muy contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo comunal. El próximo préstamo que reciba Bertha lo invertirá en mercadería para su negocio. Bertha quiere tener la tienda mas granD. y con mas variedad  D. su comunidad.
texts.en:
The San José D. Chupaca communal bank is in Chupaca, Acoria, in Huancavelica. It’s starting its second cycle with 12 members who are in a variety of commercial and agricultural activities in the region. Gladys is a member and the president of the communal bank. She’s married and has four sons who are students because they want to become professionals. Gladys raises cattle. She buys them young and makes them grow strong and robust. She sells them at the livestock markets. Now that Gladys is a member of Finca she feels more motivated to continue working. She is asking for a new loan to invest in her business buying more cattle. Gladys’s dream is that her business be large and profitable and to have a store in her home. Bertha is a member and treasurer of the communal bank. She’s married and has two daughters who are in school. Bertha sells groceries in a store she opened 6 years ago when it was the only one in her community. Now, her community even has a market. Bertha liked the concept of savings and she knows that with Finca she can always count on them. She is happy to be part of a communal bank. The next loan Bertha receives will be used to buy stock merchandise for her store. Bertha wants to have the largest, best stocked store in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Frutos De Vida Group

texts.en:
This communal bank of 14 members is called “Frutos de Vida.” This is the second time that the Group has a loan published on Kiva. The members are from the city of Temuco (see below **) and dedicate themselves to the sale of various goods such as used clothing, fast food (hot dogs, French fries, and empanadas), charcoal, firewood, dry food goods (like rice and pasta), desserts, metals, recycled goods, and the production and sale of spurs.

The group’s treasurer, Jessica, was interviewed for this profile. In the picture she is seated in the first row wearing a white sweater.

Jessica prepares and sells fast food. Her mother, María Magdalena, who is also part of the bank and is as the group’s president, helps her with this business. They sell by special order and home-delivery.They are currently completing construction of a kiosk in their home from which they will sell the food they prepare.

Jessica and María Magdalena will invest this loan in potatoes, oil, and materials to finish the interior of the kiosk; if they have extra money left over they will save it and use it to cover the other expenses they may have when they open the kiosk for business, like a display case for the food, “window protection” (which refers to iron bars people often put up on the windows of their kiosks to dissuade thieves), and promotion of the business.

Jessica’s goal is to get her water and energy bills paid off, to arrange her teeth, and to treat a back pain provoked by a deviated disk. Her motivations are her two children, who are 12 and 1.

Jessica has enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza, especially the fact that the bank meetings are a good distraction and allow her to interact with other people which keeps her in good spirits. For Jessica, the loans are a great help and they give her hope to advance her business, as the income from it is her family’s primary support.

** Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 km south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community lives; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, oil and construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas ["dynamic Women"] Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Mujeres Dinámicas” está conformado por 9 socios emprendedores, quienes viven en la zona D. Virgen del Carmen, distrito D. Ate, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace un 13 años.
Juana asume el cargo D. presidenta desD. hace 6 años, tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 8 y 14 años D. edad. Se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, galletas, chocolates y gaseosas, desD. hace 3 años, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Juana cubre los gastos D. servicios, alimentación y el pago D. la academia D. su hija, su gran sueño es tener un taller D. confecciones en su hogar, el reciente préstamo obtenido lo utilizará en la compra D. mercadería, para así poder satisfacer la demanda D. clientes.
Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos. (Niño en la foto hijo D. la socia).
Socia en la foto pequeña no pudo asistir al desembolso por motivos D. trabajo, llego mas tarD..
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Dinámicas” ["Dynamic Women"] communal bank is maD. up of 9 enterprising members, who live in the area called Virgen del Carmen, in Ate district, Department of Lima. They have been working with EDAPROSPO Prosperity for about 13 years. Juana took over the position of president of the group 6 years ago. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 14. For the past three years, she has worked selling snacks, cookies, chocolates and soft drinks. With the effort of her daily work, Juana is able to pay for the family's food and services, as well as the school fees for her daughter. Her great dream is to have a tailor's workshop in her home. She used the funds from this loan to buy merchandise so she can satisfy her customers' requests. The members of this group have great dreams and goals, and they are very grateful to the institution for all of the support provided to them. They are committed to making their payments, continuing to work and not defrauding anyone. The boy in the photo is Juana's son. The member in the small photo was not able to attend the loan distribution because she was working, so she arrived later.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 37 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Félix, es una persona que se la pasó todo el tiempo trabajando, es por ello que fruto de su esfuerzo supo sacar adelante su negocio, que es una tienda. Ahora que su pareja esta a cargo del negocio, él está abocado al trabajo como albañil y los ingresos que percibe, le servirá para cubrir  su canasta familiar, es por ello que considera una oportunidad más, para que pueda ampliar su tienda y pueda captar mayor clientela. Desde luego que sus ventas fueron incrementándose con el pasar de los meses. Por lo general trabaja en su centro de labor desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:30 de la tarde, pero los domingos trata de apoyar a su pareja en la atención de los clientes que acuden a su tienda. Este es su crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas pactadas, además confía en que llegará muy lejos con su grupo comunal, ya que lo traen muchas ventajas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra al por mayor de productos para que pueda abastecer su tienda, de esa manera no tener ningún inconveniente en cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
