Félix, 37, and his partner have five school-aged children. They all live Quimbiri in the Peruvian backcountry where they own their house. Félix is a person who has spent his entire life working and has managed to have a successful store after all this time and effort. Now that his life partner is in charge of the store he has been working as a bricklayer and the income he makes is used to pay for the family’s basic needs. He is considering an additional opportunity to expand his store and acquire more customers. As time went by, his sales increased. He works at his job every day from 8am until 5:30pm but on weekends he helps out in the store. He pledges to repay this loan with MFP in a timely fashion and he is also confident that he will get far with his communal group which produces many advantages. He will use the requested funds to buy stock items at wholesale for his store so that he will be able to easily meet all his customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es:
La señora Jimena S. O. tiene 32 años es madre soltera con dos hijos Abigail y Lorena de 15 años y el pequeño Juan de 2 años. Viven en su casa propia  en la zona de barrio 30 de agosto en la zona sud del plan 3000 una de las zonas pobres de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. 

La señora trabaja en una empresa de transporte en el área de despacho de cargas es una de las personas mas responsable que trabaja en dicha empresa pero sus ingresos son muy  bajos. La señora Jimena requiere el dinero par poder ampliar su casa ya que es muy pequeña y así poder darle un mejor ambiente a sus hijos en el cual puedan vivir y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Jimena S. O. is a 32 year old single mother, with 2 fifteen year old daughters, Abigail and Lorena, and a little boy, Juan, who is 2. They live in their own house in the 30 de Agosto district, in the area south of Plan 3000 - one of the poorest areas in Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Jimena works for a dispatch company. She is a very responsible person and although she works, her income is very low. She needs the money to be able to extend her home, which is currently very small. That will mean she can give her children a better place to live and so improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a dwelling

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina Fernández tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la zona de la Maica Central parada 6, zona ubicada en la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, zona rural, ubicada en la periferia de la ciudad.

La señora Alejandrina es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años que estudia en una escuela de la zona, el padre del niño nunca lo reconoció, los abandono desde que se entero que Alejandrina estaba embaraza. La señora se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno, desde hace 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad; que le exige mucho esfuerzo, tiempo y dedicación, pues día a día debe trabajar desde muy temprano e ir a ordeñar las vacas, llevar la leche a los tanques de enfriamiento para que no se agrie su producto, y se pierda su producción, y los lugares donde realiza todas sus labores, no cuentan con un transporte adecuado pues sus tachos de leche de 30-40 litros, los carga en la espalda. Este esfuerzo lo realiza todos los días, además debe dedicarse al pastoreo, aprovisionamiento de los insumos para su ganado. Son actividades que demandan mucho esfuerzo y tiempo, esfuerzo que Alejandrina con ayuda de su hijo lo realizan todos los días. Además debe cuidar de su padre de 83 años de sufre de múltiples malestares típicos por su edad, sordera, dolor  de huesos, malestares estomacales, y muchos otros más. Pero es un abuelito cariñoso que pasa sus últimos días junto con su hija y  su único nieto.

Alejandrina tiene el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, dar a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida, que su hijo pueda terminar el colegio, estudie veterinaria que es uno de sus mayores sueños. 
Es así que la Señora Alejandrina solicito el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, de este modo incrementar su producción y poder tener más ingresos, que le permitan poder ahorrar para el momento en que su hijo necesite para sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Fernández, 34, lives in the Maica Central area, stop #6, in Cercado province, Cochabamba department, a rural area on the outskirts of town. Alejandrina is a single mother of a 12 year old son who goes to the local school. Her son’s father never acknowledged him; he abandoned them when he found out Alejandrina was pregnant. She is a raw milk dairy farmer. He has five cows. She’s been in this line of work for 13 years. It requires much effort, time and dedication because she must work from very early in the morning every day milking the cows and taking the milk to the cooling tanks so that it won’t spoil and she lose her production. The places where she works lack adequate transportation services so she must carry her 30-40 liter milk cans on her back. She toils like this every day. In addition, she grows pasturage to have feed for her cattle. These activities demand much effort and time, effort that Alejandrina does daily with help from her son. In addition, she must care for her 83-year-old father who suffers from many age-related ailments: deafness, bone pain, stomach problems and many others. But, he’s an affectionate grandfather who spends his remaining days with his daughter and only grandson. Alejandrina wants to improve her quality of life, to give her son better living conditions, that her son finish high school and study veterinary sciences is one of her greatest dreams. Alejandrina has requested funds to buy another dairy cow so that production will increase and she can have more earnings that will allow her to have some savings for when her son needs funds for higher education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby, de 38 años, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su techo propio. Hace mas de 3 años empezó vendiendo ropa en un pequeño puesto que se encuentra en el interior de un mercado dentro de su localidad. Desde entonces sus clientes siempre acuden a su puesto a comprar algún producto nuevo con actuales modelos y diseños. Es por ello que cada quincena se va a la ciudad de Lima a comprar mercadería con la finalidad de reducir costo, además trae ropa de vanguardia para todo tipo de público, según su estilo y preferencia. A pesar de que su negocio le está resultando rentable, no se queda contenta con lo conseguido hasta ahora, es por ello que espera tener su negocio en la avenida principal de su localidad, con la finalidad de que pueda exhibir toda la mercadería que tiene al público en general. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por el compromiso que tiene cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías, con el propósito de que pueda abastecer su tienda de ropa, para que pueda cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gaby, 38, lives with her significant other and they have three school aged children. They live in Quimbiri in the Peruvian backcountry in their own home. Over three years ago she started selling clothes in a small stall inside her local market. Since then, her customers always come by her stall to buy something new with current styles and designs. Because of this, she goes to Lima every two weeks to buy merchandise so that she can keep her prices low. She also brings back cutting edge items for all kinds of customers according to their style and preferences. Despite her business being profitable she isn’t satisfied with her accomplishments to date and wants to have a store on the town’s main avenue so that she can display her wares to the general public. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is satisfied with her communal group because each of her fellow members is committed. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise in order to stock her store with clothes so that she can meet all customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Soraya Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia tiene 24 años de edad vive en el kilometro tres y medio a la carretera a Sacaba una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella vive con su madre y con su abuelita, estudio Fisioterapia trabaja con personas de escasos recursos en hospitales de la ciudad.

Cecilia mantiene a su madre  y su abuelita que son personas mayores, el papá de Cecilia les abandono cuando ella tenía tres años de edad y se quedo con su madre y su abuela, ella se puso a trabajar desde muy niña para poder estudiar y poder ayudar a su madre en la enfermedad de su abuelita la cual tiene reumatismo, ella trata de ayudar  en todo lo que puede a su abuela ya que el tratamiento con el traumatólogo es muy caro las consultas y los medicamentos para calmar los dolores que tiene.

Cecilia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de trabajo con los cuales puede realizar sus terapias ya que ella tiene un consultorio en su  casa donde realiza las terapias, de la misma manera ella va realizar sus trabajo a domicilio de sus pacientes, trata de trabajar lo mas que puede para tener más ingresos con los cuales ayudaría mucho los gastos que tienen en casa, Cecilia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.

Ella en futuro quiere tener una clínica con la cual ayudara a todas las personas que vayan a necesitar fisioterapias y tratamientos en los cuales ella pueda realizarse como profesional, ella sueña con brindarle mejor vejes a su madre ya que es la persona que siempre está con ella y que siempre tuvo su apoyo tanto moral como económico, Doña Delina quiere que su hija tenga un futuro mejor que la que tuvo ella que pueda encontrar una persona con la cual realice su  vida y pueda tener familia y ser muy feliz.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old, and lives with her mother and grandmother on the outskirts of the Sacaba district of Cochabamba. She studied Physiotherapy and works with people of limited resources in the hospitals around the city. She looks after her mother and elderly grandmother; her father abandoned them when Cecilia was three years old. She has been working since she was very young to be able to help her mother, who is sick, and her grandmother, who suffers from rheumatism. Cecilia tries to help her grandmother however she can, because the visits to the specialist, and the medicines she has to take for the pain, are very expensive. Cecilia is seeking the loan to buy materials for her therapy work. She already runs a clinic at home where she can treat patients, just as she does when she visits them at their homes. She is trying to work as much as possible and maximise her income so she can help as much as she can with the household exprenses. Cecilia is a very responsible, hard-working woman. In the future, she would like to have a surgery where she can help everyone who comes needing physiotherapy treatment. She dreams of offering her mother a better old age, because she is always there for her and gives her moral support as much as economic support. Her mother, Doña Delina, says she wants her daughter to have a better future than she had. She hopes Cecilia will meet someone to spend her life with, have a family and be very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medical supplies for physiotherapy

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario C. tiene veinte ocho años de edad, vive en Maica Sud parada diez que es una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba de la provincia Cercado,  Rosario tiene dos hijos de cinco y tres años su esposo se encuentra trabajando en el Chapare que es una provincia de nuestra ciudad, ella se dedica a la producción de leche ya como hace ocho años atrás y sus esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Rosario solo estudio la primaria porque su madre murió cuando ella tenía dos años ella es la única mujer entre sus hermanos a ella le toco la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hermanos porque sus padre les dejo y no saben donde se encuentra no hay ningún rastro del lugar donde lo puedan ubicar ella solo se dedica y a que sus hermanos puedan salir adelante y poder terminar una carrera ya que ella no pudo realizarlo, Rosario trabaja desde muy temprano ella producción de leche ya que ella tiene que realizar el trabajo sola de ordeñar  a las vacas y poder entregar la leche al modulo de la Maica en la mañana y en la tarde y al mismo tiempo se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.

Rosario  requiere el crédito para la compra de una vaca para poder aumentar su producción de leche y poder tener mayores ingresos y de esa manera darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y a sus hermanos a los cuales tiene que ayudarlos todavía para que ellos terminen el colegio.

Rosario es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora de la cual su esposo se encuentra muy orgullosa de ella, Rosario sueña con un futuro mejor que el de ella para sus hijos ya que sueña con que su hija pueda estudiar una carrera en la cual pueda ayudar a las personas de la zona Rosario es una persona muy querida en la Maica por ser muy buena vecina con todos y ella ayuda a todas las personas que puede.
texts.en:
Rosario C. is 28 years old and lives in Maica Sud, outside the city of Cochabamba, in Cercado province. Rosario has 2 children, age 5 and 3. Her husband is working in Chapare, which is part of our city. She has been dairy farming for 8 years now, and her husband also works in agriculture. Rosario only finished primary school, because her mother died when she was 2 years old. Being the only girl among a family of brothers she took on the responsibility of bringing up her brothers after the father left them. They had no idea how or where to find him, so Rosario went out to work so that her brothers could get by and could finish their education although she could not. Rosario starts work very early at the dairy, on her own. Morning and evening, she has to milk the cows and take the milk to the vats in Maica. At the same time she looks after her children. Rosario needs the loan to buy a cow, to increase her milk production and her income. In this way she hopes to provide a better future for her children and her brothers, whom she still has to help out until they finish college. Rosario is a very responsible and hard-working woman, for which her husband is extremely proud of her. Rosario dreams of a better future for her children. She hopes her daughter will have the opportunity to study for a degree and, with it, be able to help local people. Rosario is much-loved by people in Maica for being such a good neighbour who is always ready to help anyone in need.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija, Anel de 8 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Anteriormente trabajaba en el municipio de San Francisco, luego de muchos años de labor, decidió dedicarse de lleno al negocio, que es un Recreo Turístico, que conjuntamente lo realiza con su pareja,  desde entonces le ha resultado muy rentable, puesto que en la semana recibe una mucha gente, fieles a la sazón incomparable que le pone a sus comidas exóticas que prepara, es así que sus ingresos económicos va aumentado a paso lento y seguro. Normalmente su rutina diaria es a partir de las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 de la noche dependiendo de la cantidad de gente que tiene que atender. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su recreo turístico, con la finalidad de aumentar la capacidad, para que puedan recibir más turistas en su campo recreacional. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente contento con su grupo comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que toman. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de mesas y sillas, con el propósito de que sus clientes se sientan cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Irma is 39 years old. She lives with her partner and their daughter Anel, who is 8 years old. They live in a place called Quimbiri, where they have their own house, in the beautiful forest around Cuzco. Irma used to work in the town of San Francisco, and after many years of hard work there decided to work full time in her own business, a tourist restaurant, which she set up with her partner. It has become a very profitable business, with many people coming during the week for the incomparable flavour of the exotic dishes she cooks, and so their income has increased slowly but steadily. A typical day for Irma lasts from 9am to 12 midnight, depending on the number of people she has to serve. Her great longing is to grow the business and increase its capacity, so they can receive more tourists. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP; she promises to keep making her payments on time. She also says she is happy with the communal bank, thanks to the good decisions they take. She intends to invest the loan buying tables and chairs, so that her customers will be comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs so she can improve her service to her customers.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías, de 40 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Isaías es una persona que le gusta compartir sus enseñanzas a todo el que se lo pida, no se guarda secretos, ni mucho menos es conservador, le gusta ser libre y eso lo transmite a sus alumnos, no por algo tuvo 15 años trabajando de maestro, ahora mucho de sus exalumnos están en la universidad, del cual se siente muy orgulloso. A pesar de que no percibe buen sueldo, él lo hace por amor a su carrera, ya que según Isaías dice que “con la plata no se compra el conocimiento, sino se logra con mucha dedicación y amor propio al estudio continuo”. Normalmente trabaja en su institución educativa desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 1:30 de la tarde, a parte de ello dicta clases extras a otros alumnos que provienen de diferentes colegios, en donde ese ingreso económico le permitirá cubrir su canasta familiar. Paralelo a este trabajo, posee una tienda, que conjuntamente trabaja con su esposa, donde ella se encarga de la atención de los clientes, es por ello que desea ampliar su tienda y abastecerla de variados productos, de esa manera estabilizar su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente satisfecho por las facilidades que le brinda dicha institución. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de más productos con la finalidad de que pueda abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Isaías, who is 40 years old, lives with his wife and two school-aged children. They all live together in their own home in Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Cusco jungle. Isaías is a person who likes to share his knowledge with all those who ask; he doesn't keep secrets nor is he stingy with his teachings. He likes to be free, and has passed that on to his students. There's a reason he worked as a teacher for 15 years! Many of his former students are now at the university, about which Isaías feels very proud. In spite of the fact that he doesn't receive a good salary, he teaches because he loves his profession. As Isaías says, "money can't buy knowledge; it is only gained through dedication and the love of continuous study." He normally works in his educational institution from 8:00 in the morning until 1:30 in the afternoon, after which he gives extra classes to students who come from different schools. This extra money allows him to cover his family's food allowance. Parallel to this work, he owns a store that he runs jointly with his wife, who takes care of the customers. He wants to expand his store and stock up on various products to stabilize his business. This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to paying his installments on the pre-set dates. In addition, he is pleased with the other opportunities that the institution offers. With the requested loan, he plans to invest in the purchase of more products with the purpose of stocking up his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy zinc, nails, wood, and pay for  labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 44 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Mary recuerda que empezó desde abajo hasta llegar lo que tiene ahora, que es una librería, pero al inicio tuvo sus primeras recaídas, pero le sirvió de experiencia para mejorar, es por ello que son muchos lo clientes que recurren a su establecimiento, debido a la calidad y el buen servicio que brinda, eso le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su negocio con la finalidad de que pueda introducir mayor cantidad de productos, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando como en anteriores ocasiones, además está conforme con grupo comunal, ya que todos los presentes son responsables y puntuales. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías para abastecer su librería.
texts.en:
Mary, age 44, is divorced and has three children at home. They live together in the Quimbiri area, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. They have their own house there. Mary remembers that she started from the bottom until she came to have what she has now, a bookstore. When she started she had her first losses. But, the experience helped her to improve. That is why so many customers frequent her establishment. It is due to the quality and the good service that she offers. This has generated good income. She usually works on her own, but sometimes her children help her. Her plan for the future is to expand her business so that she can introduce a greater quantity of products. She will do this according to the likes and preferences of her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She pledges to keep making her payments as she has in the past. Also, she gets along well with her communal bank. All of the members are responsible and punctual. She plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise to stock her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and goods to stock her bookstore

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cement, sand, stone, zinc and wood

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana T. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por el sector de Narancay Bajo a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca siendo característica de este lugar la agricultura, muchos de sus habitantes han migrado a varios lugares del mundo para obtener mejores ingresos para  sus familias. Nuestra socia es comerciante hace 30 años, se dedica a la venta de jeans los días miércoles, sábados y también en las expo ferias que existen en la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijas quienes se encuentran de 33, 31 y 23 años, sus dos hijas son casadas y viven de manera independiente, su segunda hija es soltera  y trabaja  para solventar sus gastos, su esposo es comerciante  de ropa, y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y ha sido una amiga del bankito quien le ha invitado a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería, su meta es ayudar a su hija para que realice la tesis.
texts.en:
Ana T. is a member of the Siempre Amigas (Always Friends) Communal Bank. She lives in the Narancay Bajo area, which is ten minutes from the city of Cuenca. This is a farming area, and many of the inhabitants have migrated to various places in the world in order to get better incomes for their families. Ana has been a merchant for 30 years. She sells jeans on Wednesdays and Saturdays. She also sells at the expo-fairs in the city. She is 49, married, and has three daughters. Her daughters are 33, 31, and 23 years old. Two of them are married and live independently. Her second daughter is single and works to pay her expenses. Her husband is a clothing merchant. Thanks to their combined work, they have managed to build their own home. She is in her third cycle. It was a friend from the communal bank who invited her to be part of this group of tenacious and enterprising women. She will use her new loan to buy more merchandise. Her goal is to help her daughter complete her thesis.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 38 años, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Desde hace varios años se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, es por ello que tiene una tienda, además el haber instalado este negocio fue de mucha ventaja ya que en su localidad nadie ofrece este servicio, hoy le rinde buenas rentas económicas. Generalmente de 6 a p de la mañana es cuando hay más concurrencia de gente, en donde sus hijos la ayudan en la atención de la clientela. Normalmente los productos que vende son de primera necesidad para el hogar, es por ello que se siente contenta y satisfecha por lo que viene realizando. Su punto de venta lo realiza en el primer piso de su propia casa, a un precio módico. Sus planes a futuro es vender al por mayor, ya que ello le generaría mayores ingresos económicos, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo banco comunal, ya que le otorga buenos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para que pueda abastecer su tienda y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38-years-old, divorced, and has two school-aged children. They live in Cusco's beautiful jungle, in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house. For several years she has sold essential products in her shop. Establishing this business was much to her advantage because in her town nobody offers this service. Today she has a good economic income. Generally from 6 to 9 in the morning is when her store is the busiest, and her children help her in attending to customers. Normally the products that she sells are essential household items--that's why she feels very pleased and satisfied by the way her business is going. Her store is in on the first floor of her own house, and she sells at a reasonable price. Her plan for the future is to sell wholesale because that would generate more income and improve her family's quality of life. This is her 5th loan with MFP, which is why she's committed to paying in a punctual manner. Furthermore, she feels satisfied with her community bank group because they offer her good economic benefits. With this loan she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise so that she can stock her store and satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Esther Galud

texts.es:
La Señora. Esther L. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la comunidad de Cochapamba la misma que es reconocida por sus belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura mucha de su población joven ha emigrado en busca de mejores días para sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda hace 12 años y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 26, 25, 24 y 12 años, sus dos hijas mayores son casadas, la primera vive de manera independiente y su segunda hija vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos y los quehaceres de su hogar, su último hijo se dedica a los estudios, con su esfuerzo y su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la confección de pantalones, labora desde su casa sin un horario fijo ya que tiene que entregar a tiempo sus obras. Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, y  los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en la compra de telas e hilos, su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de tela para fabricar ropa de bebe.

Su sueño es tener un taller de costura mas grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Esther L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Amigas” (Friends Forever). She lives in the community of Cochapamba, which is known for its natural beauty. The people earn their living raising animals and farming. Most of the younger residents have emigrated in search of better days for their families.

Esther is 46 years old and has been a widow for 12 years. She has four children who are 26, 25, 24, and 12 years of age. The two older daughters are married with the first one living independently while the second one lives in her house and shares in the expenses and the household chores. Her youngest child is dedicated to his studies. With great effort and work, she was able to build her own home.

Esther earns a living by manufacturing trousers. She works from home without a fixed schedule, so she has plenty of time to complete her orders. This is her third loan cycle and her previous loans have been a great help with acquiring fabrics and thread. Her new loan will be used to invest in the purchase of fabrics for making baby clothes.

Her dream is to have a larger sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for making baby clothes

loans.name: Ruth Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth Ordóñez es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la comunidad de Cochapamba la misma que es reconocida por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población joven ha emigrado en busca de mejores días para sus familias.

La Señora Ruth tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo labora como albañil, tiene casa propia la misma que le han construido gracias al esfuerzo de los dos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la costura, actividad que fue inculcada por su madre, trabaja junto con ella realizando pantalones y son socias en el taller. Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación Espoir,  su nuevo crédito  lo va  a invertir en la compra de tela para la elaboración de pantalones, su meta es comprar más maquinas para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Ordóñez is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Amigas” (Friends Forever). She lives in the community of Cochapamba, which is known for its natural beauty. The people earn their living raising animals and farming. Most of the younger residents have emigrated in search of better days for their families.

Ruth is 26 years old, married, and has a seven year old son who attends the local school. Her husband works as a mason. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to build their own house.

Ruth works as a seamstress and learned the trade from her mother. They work together making trousers and are partners in running their shop. Ruth is in her third loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fabric for making trousers. Her goal is to buy more machines in order to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making trousers

loans.name: Matanat

texts.ru:
Matanat mat 2 detey. Ona jivet v qorode Baku. Ona nachala etot bizness 5 let nazad koqda posle toqo kak umer yeyo muj. Za pervuyu summu kotoruyu videlilo yey Kiva ona ochen blaqodarna chto oni pomoqli yey. 

No teper ona nujdayetya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji.V etom maqazine malo novix tovarov ona xochet razvit svoy maqazin. Na budusheye ona xotelabi chtobi yeyo docheri kototim 10 i 16 let postupili v universiteti ,potomuchto po yeyo slovam ved nikto neznayet chto sluchitsya zavtro pust u nix budet kakaya nibud professiya.
texts.en:
Matanat is a mother of 2 children. She lives in the city of Baku. She started this business 5 years ago after the death of her husband. She is grateful that the first loan she obtained from Kiva helped her. However, she now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale. This store has a small number of new products, and Matanat wants to expand her store. In the future, she wants her daughters, who are 10 and 16 years old, to go to a universities because, according to her own words, since no one knows what would happen tomorrow, they should have an education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamranu 45 let. On  jivet v qorode Baku. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey 6,10,13 let. Dochka 6 let malenkaya toka v etom qodu v shkolu poydetn , sin 10 let uchitsya v shkole i xochet stat ekoloqom i zashishat prirodu,i doch 13 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetysa nashimi nacionalnimi tancami. 
 
Pervuyu summu Brala mama Kamrana Leyla Askarova  chtobi pomoch svoyemu sinu, i seychas oni blaqodarni za piomosh KIve. Seychas Kamran nujdayetysa v summe 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapasniye chasti  shini dlya mashin.
texts.en:
Kamran is 45 years old. He lives in the city of Baku. He is married and has 3 children, who are 6, 10 and 13 years old. His 6-year-old daughter is little and will be starting school this year. His 10-year-old son goes to school and wants to become an ecologist and defend the nature. And the 13-year-old daughter also goes to school and is involved in our national dancing. Kamran's mother, Leyla Askarova, obtained the first loan in order to help her son, and now they are grateful to Kiva for the help. Currently, Kamran needs a sum of 2000 AZN in order to purchase spare parts and car tires.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and tires

loans.name: Fikret

texts.ru:
Fikret A. jivet v Absheron regione. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Fikretu 51 qod. Iz eqo detey 2 uje jenilis  i toka odnoy eshe 18 let i ona qotovitsya postupit v universitet na ekanomiku. 

On uje 10 let zanimayetsys etim biznesom. Ranshe on derjal ovec i prodoval ixniye koju i myaso. A seychas on reshil derjat korov i u neqo uje yest 2 korovi. no on xochet kupi eshe shtobi bilo pobolshe maloka dlya prodaji i pribil bila bi bolshe.  S dvuma korovami pribil malenkaya. I v budushem on xotel bi rpoizvodit i sir.
texts.en:
Fikret A. lives in the Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children. Fikret is 51 years old. Two of his children are already married, and one daughter, who is only 18 years old, is getting ready to get into a university to study economics. Fikret has been involved in this business for 10 years. Previously, he kept sheep and sold their skin and meat. And now, he decided to keep cows and already has 2 cows. However, he also wants to buy more cows in order to have more milk for sale and more profits. The profits are small with two cows. In the future, he also want to start making cheese.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is a widow who lives in Prk. Saging, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating two business ventures: vegetable sales and the operation of a general store.

Myrna joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 4 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her hard work, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP ($275), which she intends to use to buy vegetables and additional inventory for the general store. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up for future home repairs and the betterment of her business. Myrna B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional vegetables and inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothes for her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Casa Hamaquera Group

texts.es:
La Casa Hamaquera es un grupo conformado por tres féminas emprendedoras provenientes de Masaya considera la cuna del Folklor nicaragüense. Este departamento cuenta con la mayor expresión Folklórica y una gran variedad de producción de arte y artesanía.
Las hamacas son parte son parte de la cultura nicaragüense que data desde antaños y la fabricación de esta ha sido transmitida de generación en generación tal es el caso de Evangelina L. fabricante de manilas, Ana S. y Amalia del Socorro Vásquez quienes fabrican hamacas de todos los colores y formas. 
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para mejorar y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
“La Casa Hamaquera” (The House of the Hammock Makers) is a group consisting of three female entrepreneurs from Masaya, which is considered the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore. This department experiences the highest level of folkloric expression and produces a wide variety of artistic and handcrafted objects. Hammocks are a part of Nicaraguan culture that dates back several years. Making hammocks is a skill that has been passed from generation to generation. Evangelina L. manufactures manila rope, while Ana S. and Amalia del Socorro Vásquez make hammocks in every color and style. They will invest this loan to improve their businesses and keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making manila rope & manila hammocks

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Doña  Isabel es una mujer trabajadora, de 56 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, su trabajo ha sido de domestica para lograr a salir adelante económicamente ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de los niños. 
Tiene dos trabajos.
Medio tiempo trabaja como cocinera, y nace la idea de vender ropa, prendas, para lograr pagar los gastos básicos. Las dificultades que ha tenido es que los clientes le retrasan los pagos, y a veces le cuesta colocar los productos.
Lo bueno es que cuenta con un trabajo fijo, ya que cuando le toca pagar pues ajusta con su salario. Con este financiamiento comprara: una docena de pantalón para caballero, camisas, trajes de niñas, docenas de sandalias para mejorar sus ventas ya que tiene poco para vender, y ha colocado casi todas las mercancías.
Y a veces no logra comprar cuando tiene poco por que no cuenta con dinero en efectivo. Lo que para ella el financiamiento es de gran relevancia por que da la oportunidad de mejorar e invertir al comercio.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is a hardworking woman who is 56 years old and the mother of three children. She works so that her household can get ahead financially since the father of her children does not provide them any support.

Isabel has two jobs. She works part-time as a cook and also sells clothing and jewelry so that she can pay for basic expenses. The difficulties she has encountered occur when customers delay their payments, which prevents her from acquiring more products.

It is a good thing that she has a steady job, so when her customers pay her, it is additional income on top of her regular salary. With this loan she will buy the following: a dozen men’s trousers, shirts, girls’ dresses, and a dozen pairs of sandals to improve her sales since she is low on these items. Almost all of these products have already been ordered.

There are times when she is not able to buy more merchandise because she does not have cash on hand, which is why this loan is of great relevance since it provides her the opportunity to improve and invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, dresses, and sandals

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la Modesta H. coordinadora del grupo quien vende hielo, helados, leche, cuajada desde hace 16 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en capital de trabajo sueña que algun día poder trabajar con propio dinero. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Flor G. quien vende pollo y Rosa H. quien comercializa frescos, helados y hielo. Ellas con el préstamo piensas en mejorar sus negocios y progresar.
texts.en:
The Melania Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Modesta H., the group coordinator, who has been selling ice, ice cream, milk, and curds for 16 years. She will invest her loan as operating capital with the goal of accumulating her own money. Her fellow group members are Flor G., who sells chickens, and Rosa H., who sells soft drinks, ice cream, and ice. They plans to use their loans to improve their businesses and make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their small businesses

loans.name: La Venta Group

texts.es:
La Venta es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Aura Lila L. L. quien vende cosméticos y ropa usada desde hace cuatro años. Sus compañeras de grupo son Migdia Arabel Landez O. comerciante de ropa usada, Juliana C. H.  es propietaria de una pequeña venta la cual estas bien surtida y Elizabeth H. P. a partir del 2009 vende pollo. 

Ellas tienen la meta de prosperar y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“La Venta” (The Sale) is a group that consists of four hardworking individuals. One of them is Aura Lila L. L., who has been selling cosmetics and used clothing for four years. Her fellow group members are Migdia Arabel Landez O. (a used clothing merchant), Juliana C. H. (the owner of a small well-stocked store), and Elizabeth H. P. (who has been selling chicken since 2009).

Their goal is to prosper and expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for his home

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rojo está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Silvia O.  coordinadora del grupo  quien tiene un pequeño negocio de recargas, alquiler y venta de teléfonos de las compañías de telefónica claro y movistar. 
Los otros integrantes son Ana Carolina R. es propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura el cual inicio su madre hace 20 años donde aprendió este oficio que ella continua ejerciendo y Jairo S. hace tres años tiene un pequeño bar.
texts.en:
The “Rojo” (Red) Group consists of three hardworking individuals. One of them is Silvia O., the group coordinator, who has a small business selling electronic loads. She also sells and rents out phones that are subscribed to phone service providers Claro and Movistar.

The other members are Ana Carolina R., who owns a small sewing workshop that she started 20 years ago with her mother who taught her, and Jahiro S., who has been managing a small bar for the past three years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic loads, phone cards, and cell phones

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es:
Doña Camila es madre de tres hijos, vive en un barrio de la capital Villa Venezuela, su negocio es la venta de ropa y venta de electrodomésticos de segunda mano, el cual estos los  vende por encargo, pues ella tiene sus conecte de compra favorables.
Este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años, con dinero prestado en otra institución lo que logro capitalizar, con una pulpería  pero luego le resulto la ropa por que era una mejor inversión y que vendía en los departamentos, con las ganancias y los prestamos hizo su casa de concreto, ayudo  a sus hijos con sus estudios como madre soltera por que no tuvo el apoyo de su compañero.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de ropa interior, una docena de biquinis, de dama, una docena de bóxer para caballero, calcetas, cosméticos productos Avon, y electrodomésticos, con el objetivo de atraer al cliente mediante sus productos y lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Camila is the mother of three children and lives in Villa Venezuela, a neighborhood located in the capital city. She sells second hand clothing and small appliances by request. She has good connections for purchasing them. She started this business as a general store many years ago, with money that she borrowed through another institution, but eventually settled on clothing sales because it turned out to be a better investment because she had better sales within the surrounding areas (departments). She used her earnings and loans to have her concrete home built. As a single mother, she also helped her children with their education, because she did not have her partner’s support. She will use the money from this loan to invest in undergarments; a dozen ladies’ bikini bottoms, a dozen pairs of men’s boxer shorts, socks, cosmetics, Avon products, and small appliances. Her goal is to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas originarias de Masaya, ciudad de las flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Lidia V. quien tiene una tortillería. La tortilla es el bastimento por excelencia de los y las nicaragüenses y no falta en el desayuno, almuerzo y cena.
 V. inicio con este negocio en el 2003 con la compra de un quintal de maíz, medio flete de leña (la mitad de una carreta de leña) y un comal, actualmente el negocio ha ido creciendo que no se daba abasto ella sola echando tortillas.

Mientras las otras integrantes del grupo Yolanda B. y Vilma M. se dedican al comercio de cosméticos por catalogo y desean que sus negocios crezcan.
texts.en:
The group "Unidas" ("Together") is composed of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, strong women from Masaya, the city of flowers. The group's coordinator is Lidia V., who owns a tortillería or tortilla shop. Tortillas are a Nicaraguan staple, eaten at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. V. began her business in 2003 with the purchase of 46kg of corn, half a cart of firewood, and a metal hotplate used for cooking. Currently, her business has been growing so much that she is unable to make all the tortillas herself. Meanwhile, the other members of the group Yolanda B. and Vilma M. sell mail-order cosmetics. They want their businesses to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Primary materials for business

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José Enrique es un joven de 23 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo, comerciante desde hace varios años, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, oficio que desde su pubertad hace para ayudar a sus padres. Los cuales se dedicaban al comercio.
Cuando las ventas se ponen bajas venden poco y algunos productos que no duran se pierden lo que para ellos es pérdidas. Lo que se hace a veces para no perder es dar mas barato de lo que se compro por docena y así no perder del todo.
Las frutas y las verduras por ser tan ricas y saludables se venden, es cuando los productos aumentan es que bajan, pero es un comercio bueno que día  a día se vende. En ensaladas en bolsa, oh en fruto entero.
Con este préstamo desea aumentar sus ventas, comprara: saco de zanahoria, quintal de papa, quintal de cebolla. Chiltoma, repollo, tomate, dos quintales de naranjas, sandia, melón, banano, pepino, ayote, 
Y más productos. 
Con la inversión se aumenta las ventas comos las ganancias, y este es el propósito que a través de este financiamiento espera alcanzar.
texts.en:
José Enrique is a 23 year-old young man. He is married and has one child. He has been a salesman for many years. He has sold fruit and vegetables since puberty when he began working to help his parents, who work in the business. When business is slow, the family make fewer sales and lose the produce that goes bad, which is bad for their business. To avoid wasted produce they sell produce sold by the dozen at a discounted rate, that way they do not lose everything. They sell a lot of fruit and vegetables because they are both healthy and delicious. When the amount of produce increases, the price lowers, but overall it is a good business with daily sales, whether of bagged salads or whole fruit. With this loan, José wants to increase his family's sales. He will buy a sack of carrots, 46kg of potatoes, 46kg of onions, sweet pepper, cabbage, tomatoes, 98kgs of oranges, watermelons, melons, bananas, cucumbers, hard squash, and other products. With this loan, both sales and revenue will increase, which is the goal José hopes to achieve.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marjorie Leonor

texts.es:
La Joven Marjorie tiene la edad de 35 años, vive en el barrio anexo a Villa Flor, madre soltera de un hijo, el cual ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para poder dar lo necesario a su hijo. 
Su mama siempre la ha apoyado, vive con ella y su hijo de diez años, trabaja como analista de recaudación desde hace varios años ha logrado mantenerse estable su trabajo para lograr un salario fijo.
Con lo que gana alcanza para la alimentación, estudios, transporte y también ayuda a su mama con los gastos básicos, de agua y luz.
Entre sus planes es hacer mejoras a la casa pero no ha logrado debido a que no cuenta con dinero, y todo esta con altos costos. Para construir.
Es por eso decide por este medio de financiamiento para construir un pequeño porche en frente de su casa para un mejor espacio.
Comprara: piedra, bloques, un metro de arena, cemento, hierro, zinc para comenzar  hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 35 years old. She lives in the neighborhood attached to Villa Flor. She is a single mother and works hard to be able to give her son everything he needs. Marjorie's mother has always supported her daughter. Marjorie and her ten-year-old son live in her mother's house. Marjorie works as a collections analyst. For many years, she has maintained a stable job and earned a fixed salary. With the money she makes, Marjorie pays for food, school, and transportation in addition to helping her mother with basic living expenses, like water and electricity bills. One of her plans is to make improvements to her mother's home. So far she has been unable to make the desired improvements because she does not have enough money to cover the high costs of construction, which is why she has asked for a loan through Kiva. Marjorie plans to build a small porch in front of the house to offer the family more space. She will buy stones, blocks, sand, cement, steel, and an iron roof to begin construction.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to build front porch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: college tuition

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es:
Freddy es un joven, de 24 años de edad, con deseo de superación, padre de un hijo, su esposa trabaja con el despachando para lograr la atención al cliente.
Antes vendía verduras y frutas en un mercado de la capital, había veces que perdía las frutas y era cuando le bajaba el capital. Es por eso decide cambiar de negocio y vende su pequeño tramo.
Y comienza a poner su pulpería, el cual tiene un año de estar administrando.
Su objetivo es lograr aumentar de inventario para logar mejorar las ganancias ya que queda poco por productos, es por eso quiere invertir mas y opciona por el financiamiento para lograr el objetivo de crecer.
Con esto lograra comprar, quintales de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, caja de jabón, golosinas, lácteos, gaseosas. A si como aumentar la venta de leña. 
Sus planes a futuro es lograr hacer mejoras a su casa, ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Freddy is a 24 year-old youth who has a desire to succeed. He is the father of a son, and his wife works with him providing service to his customers. Before, he used to sell fruits and vegetables in a market in the capital. There were times when he lost the fruit and when his capital was falling. For this reason he decided to change businesses and sell his small stand in the market. Then he started up a small grocery store, which he has been running now for a year. His goal is to increase his inventory so that he can have better earnings, since he currently has only a small number of products. For this reason he wants to invest more and he has chosen to take this loan in order to achieve this objective. With this loan he will buy 100 pound units of rice, sugar, beans, and corn, boxes of soap, snacks, dairy products and soft drinks. He will also increase his sales of firewood. In the future he plans to make improvements to his house, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy 100 pound units of rice, sugar, beans, and corn, boxes of soap, dairy products and soft drinks to increase his sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of blender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a dedicated farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. She is 55 years old, married and has 6 children between the ages of 19 and 30. Mary has been farming for 10 years and has employed 4 people from her community. Her products are milk, eggs, and chickens which she sells locally. She is also employed selling clothes at the local market.

Her biggest challenge has been fluctuation in the prices of milk and inconsistency in demand, making it hard for consistent budgeting.

Mary has requested a loan of KES 70000 from Juhudi Kilimo. With this loan she will be able to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In the future, she would like to improve on the size and quality of her dairy herd and poultry.

She says Juhudi has given her a lot of exposure on farming as a business and has provided her much needed financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gualaceñitas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Gualaceñitas esta formado por un grupo de 12 mujeres dispuestas a salir  adelante en sus respectivos negocios, son mujeres que luchan cada día para progresar y brindar a sus familias una mejor estabilidad económica, viven el cantón Gualaceo que se encuentra ubicado a 35 Km. al este de Cuenca, es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y D. país. Es tierra de gran fertilidad, espléndido paisaje y agradable clima por lo que constituye un gran centro turístico. 

La Señora. Diana Beatriz vive en el centro D. cantón Gualaceo, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran de 12, 9, 5, 4  años, todos se encuentran en la escuela, su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.
Nuestra socia se dedica hace 3 años a su negocio que es una licorería, trabaja desde la 1 p.m. hasta las 2 a.m. y le va M. bien. Se encuentra en su tercer crédito en la fundación Espoir y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para crecer mas en su negocio, su meta es tener su casa propia.

La Señora. Florinda D. P. se encuentra en su segundo crédito, se dedica a su  taller de costura el cual tiene hace un año en donde confecciona  ropa deportiva, labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. aprendió esta actividad realizando cursos, el local en donde tiene su taller es arrendando.
Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad es casada y  tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 12, 10, 8 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, su esposo trabaja en una zapatería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para la elaboración de la ropa deportiva, su meta es seguir creciendo en su taller.
texts.en:
The community bank "Gualaceñitas" is composed of a group of 12 women, ready to move forward in their respective businesses. They are women who fight every day to progress and offer their families improved economic stability. They live in Gualaceo, which is located 35km east of Cuenca. It is a prosperous town, located in one of the province's--and the country's--most beautiful valleys. It is an area characterized by great fertility, splendorous landscapes, and agreeable climate, which makes it a large tourist destination. Diana Beatriz lives in the center of Gualaceo. She is 28 years old and married with four children. Her children are 12, 9, 5, and 4 years old; all of them are in school. He husband works as a bricklayer. The family does not have their own home, so they live with Diana's parents. For the past three years, Diana has run a liquor store. She works from 1PM until 2AM, and she does very well. She is in her third loan cycle with the Espoir Foundation, and her new loan will be used to purchase new merchandise in order to grow her business. Her goal is to be able to afford a house of her own. Florinda D. P. is in her second loan cycle. For the past year, she has worked as a seamstress making athletic clothing. She works from 8AM until 6PM. She learned how to sew through courses. She runs her business out of a rented shop. Florinda is 31 years old. She is married with four children. Her children are 12, 10, 8, and 2 years old; the eldest three are in school. Her husband works in a shoemaker's. The family does not have its own home, which is why they rent. She will invest her new loan in the purchase of fabric, zippers, and buttons needed to make athletic clothing. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying liquor/Buying fabric, zippers, buttons

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes is 41 years old. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 6 and 22. All the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 20 years and has employed one farm-hand. Her products are maize, beans, tomatoes and vegetables which she sells locally. She also earns income from her tailoring services and from selling second-hand clothes at the local market.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of a market and better prices for her products and the high cost of production.

Enes has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable her to acquire a good quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will assist her in paying school fees for her children.

She hopes to purchase and develop a plot of land to have rental houses and own business premises in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine (pictured with her 2-year-old child) is a hard-working farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. She has been practising mixed farming for the last 10 years and produces tea, vegetables and milk which she sells locally.

Josephine is 38 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 2 and 18. Three of her children are currently attending school. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough capital to engage in other businesses.

She recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.30,000 and has requested this new loan of KES.60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. With this loan, the family's income will increase through the sale of milk and thus ease the burden of paying school fees.

In 5 years' time, she would like to purchase a pick-up truck to transport milk and other farm products to the market. She would like Juhudi to diversify their loan products in future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Chepkwony

texts.en:
Chepkwony is a mixed farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 38 years old, married, and has been blessed with 4 children ages, 4,6,10 and 13. All the children attend school. Chepkwony has been farming for the past 17 years and employs 2 farmhands. He produces milk, tea, and chickens which he sells locally.

His biggest challenge has been tick control which is a major hurdle, especially for certain breeds like friesian, and the fluctuation in the prices of milk which makes it hard to budget.

Chepkwony has requested his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 60000. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. This means more income for the family therefore improving their living standard.

In the future, he would like open a retail shop for him to sell his milk, and to purchase a motorbike to transport his farm products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is one of the many active clients of Juhudi Kilimo and a dedicated member of Chemitan Integrated group. She is 52 years old and married, with 3 children aged 12, 15 and 25. All the children attend school.

Esther is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 10 years and employs one farmhand. Her products are maize and milk which she sells to the local market. She also owns and earns income from her rental houses in the same area.

Her primary challenge has been lack of good quality bull semen which in most cases is very expensive to access.

Esther has requested her third loan from Juhudi of KES 50000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will help increase the family’s' income through the sale of milk and improve the family’s living standards and ease the burden of paying school fees.

In future, she would like to improve the quality of her dairy animals and increase her rental houses. Esther suggests Juhudi should assist farmers find good breeds of dairy animals and educate farmers on the best ways to keep a productive cow.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 45 years old. She is married with 4 children ages 16, 17, 22, and 24. All the children attend school. She is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya where she has been farming for the last 20 years. Her products are maize, beans, bananas and milk which she sells to middlemen. She also operates a shop and buys and re-sells cereals. She is also a part -time tailor.

Her biggest challenge in farming is low prices for her products and the high cost of production.

Veronica has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.40,000 to upgrade her banana farm after successfully completing her second loan. This loan will help her hire additional labourers on her farm, and with the income generated she will be able to educate her children to the standard she wants.

She plans to construct a zero-grazing unit for her dairy cows and also build a better house for her family in future.

She is requesting Juhudi to try and lower the interest rate charged  on their loans.

loans.use: To upgrade her banana farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 30 years and has employed one farm-hand. Her main products are maize, sweet potatoes, beans, and groundnuts which she sells locally.

Mary is 52 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children between the ages of 8 and 30. Two of the children attend school. Apart from farming, she also operates a retail shop and sells ready-made clothes at the local market. Her primary challenge has been lack of capital to expand her farming activities.

She recently completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of KES.70,000 to purchase a 'posho' mill (used for grinding maize into flour). The proceeds from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children who are in school.

She appreciates the loan she has been given and is planning to apply for other loans in future to improve her financial status.

loans.use: To purchase a posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for over 15 years, producing milk, bananas, eggs, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He is also engaged in the cereal business.

He is 43 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 1 and 16. Four of the children are currently attending school. His biggest challenge in farming has been high competition and lack of a market for his products.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of KES.62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan the family will have access to enough milk and the proceeds from the sale of milk will be directed to the education of his children.

In 5 years' time, he hopes to have 5 quality dairy cows, two greenhouses and a poultry farm. He acknowledges Juhudi for giving people loans, though he says Juhudi should diversify their products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is 54 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children aged 22, 27, 30 and 34. Kellen is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been farming for 35 years and employs one farmhand. Her products are bananas, milk, beans, coffee, and maize which she sells to the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to provide for her family's needs.

Her major challenge in farming is lack of enough animal feeds, diseases, and high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers.

Kellen has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 50000 to improve her banana plantation. The profits from this investment will improve her family’s living standards as well as their health, since they will have enough food to eat. She plans to expand her banana plantation from the current ½ acre to one acre and increase the number of her dairy cows in the future.

She says that Juhudi is a good company since it cares about small scale farmers who are not able to acquire large loans from big institutions like banks.

loans.use: To improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been farming for the last 10 years on the outskirts of Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been producing milk, maize, beans and pineapples, all of which she sells to the local market. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of enough animal feed that affects her milk production, and lack of reliable casual labourers. She is also employed and earns extra income from her retail shop and rental houses in the same area.

Esther is 50 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 11 and 19. All her children are attending school.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will improve the standard of living of the family since there will be more disposable income from the sale of milk. In future, she would like to increase the size of her land and plant more dairy feed. She also plans to increase her rental houses and the number of her dairy cows. 

Esther is part of a 5 person solidarity group -- when one receives a loan, the others guarantee it.  As it is her rotation, this loan is for Esther's business alone.  She says, however, that group lending is sometimes discouraging because not all members are reliable. She hopes Juhudi will consider giving loans without requiring solidarity groups in future."

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 40 years old. She is married with three children, ages 17, 21 and 23. Her youngest child is attending school. She is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in Eastern Kenya. She has been farming for 22 years, producing milk, coffee and bananas which she sells locally. Her major challenges have been diseases and inadequate water for farming.

Faith has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to improve her poultry project. The extra income from the sale of eggs will help her educate her child and improve the standard of living of the family. She says that Juhudi is good since it has improved her life greatly.

loans.use: To improve her poultry project

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a member and the secretary of Masaba Self Help Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is 25 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 and 12. All her children except one attend school.

Mildred has been farming for the last five years and employs one farmhand. Her products are maize, beans, green grams (mung beans) and vegetables which she sells locally. She is also employed as an Early Childhood Development teacher. Her biggest challenges have been fluctuation in the price of her products and unpredictable weather patterns which affect her production.

Mildred has requested this loan from Juhudi for 41,600 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With this loan, she will be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and earn income through the sale of milk which will assist in educating her children. In the future, she would like to supply poultry and dairy products to other farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som L., 33, sells various kinds of grocery inventory out of her home to earn a living. She buys the items in bulk from wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who are her nearby neighbors. Som L. is a single mother who has given birth to two kids, both of whom are going to secondary school. She currently has an oldest sister who lives with her and helps her with the business. 

Som L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Som L. wishes to have more money to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn K., 56, owns a small store located near her house where she sells a few goods to earn a living. She sells items such as snack food, wine, cooking materials and sweets for kids. She buys these items in bulk on credit from market suppliers and returns the income when she sells all her items. She sells retail to people who are her nearby neighbors. 

In addition to her grocery trade, Khorn K. always takes time to farm rice crops, which is her annual business. She has four children: half of them are already married and the remaining two are single. One of her daughters is employed in a garment factory. Her husband works on the field with her. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, Khorn K. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Khorn K. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine M. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. Catherine has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the harvest of fruit such as avocado, mango and cactus fruit (pitaya)

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en: Ariel C.'s main source of income comes from providing haircutting services to local community members in his barbershop. He is 36 years old, married and has two small children. They are from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Ariel has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ariel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, slippers, soap, bleach, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey H. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old. Rey is single. Rey owns & operates a motorela, or habal-habal, transportation business. A habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat. Rey has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first one taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch H. is 39 years old and is the village bank president. She was selected by its sixteen members who are located in Prey Phav village in Takeo province. With the loans, each member of this group will use the money to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Touch H. is a grocery seller who owns a small store through which she is able to earn a small income to support her famiL.. In order to increase her income, which will improve the famiL.'s standard of living, Mrs. Touch H. decided to ask for a loan.  It will be used to buy more groceries to enlarge her business, while the rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food for her new business. Her husband is a laborer where he receives a small salary to support his famiL.. This couple has five children; one is laborer, three are students and the youngest is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Renand

texts.en:
Renand I. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Renand is single and has 1 infant. Renand owns & operates a motorela, or habal-habal, transportation business. Renand has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Renand joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Renand is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Renand from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
